author: {'steamid': '76561199122091336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1438, 'last_played': 1632777381}
review: Would recommend. Graphics aren't the best, but they get the job done (and the Apostles look great, they actually scare me in the Endless Eclipse mode) and are way better than the 2016-2017 version of Berserk. The controls are a bit janky, but I'm on computer, so they probably work well with a controller. There are different things to unlock and different outfits to put on. The story mode is also very enjoyable. 10/10

review: As a huge Berserk fan and Berserk being one of my favourite franchises ever I really enjoy this game. Battles are fun to play and the animations are realistic with all the blood splashing around and stuff and they did a good job telling the story in this game. Besides Guts you can also choose to play Griffith, Casca and the others and Griffithâ€™s eclipse mode is awesome. You should get it on sale tho, full price is just too much (as always with anime games like these).

author: {'steamid': '76561198203046265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2015, 'last_played': 1626297481}
review: I was skeptical about this game when I'd first heard about it, figured minimal effort would be put in to capitalize off of a popular property with a serious need for a game, but I was wrong! While I did run into some mild issues here and there (one crash and some mild optimization issues), I definitely had lots of fun with this. Combat is a bit repetitive after a while, but considering this is by far the best attempt at adapting anything post-golden age arc, I'd recommend for any fan of Berserk.

author: {'steamid': '76561199024875299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1685978216}
review:
If you are a Berserk Fan you will enjoy this game as you play through various parts of the story.
The game covers 268 Chapters of the Manga, but skips the Lost Children Arc and some caracters like Luca or Roderick.

Gameplay wise, the animation is good, especially the combat system. You can play with different caracters such as Guts, Zodd, Serpico etc. and each of
them have different combat abilities/animation. A caracter can also be leveled up to increase its power.
However I must say the game is overpriced. Every mission is basically the same but with different maps. 
Eclipse Mode allows you to get different Outfits for the caracters such as Fetmo or new Horse Sets. 
A ingame challenge system is also there. If you complete various given tasks you get an "Behelit" (not impacted on story), which unlocks in the gallery different portraits. 

I have to say that I am impressed by how the Studio manged to animate frames better than how the 2016/17 anime.
They also used the movie scenes from the Berserk Golden Age Arc movie.

As for controls, I recommend playing with a controller because you can't use camera movement/attack with the mouse, only with the keyboard.

You don't need a great PC to run the game, but also don't expect to get consistent 60 FPS.

If you want to get into Berserk I wouldn't recommend the game as it skips things which are necessary and the story could be for some questionable, however as I said for a Berserk fan this game is great!

RIP Kentaro Miura

author: {'steamid': '76561198159163746', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 7302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7302, 'last_played': 1623620722}
review:
An amazing game developed by Omega Force and brought to us from Koei Tecmo, that occurs in the famous dark world of Kentaro Miura's Berserk.

The "Hack n Slash" genre combined with "Dark Fantasy" make a simple and well done combo in which the player must eliminate any foe that tries to resist, with easy to learn mechanics aimed for the casual audience, while re-experiencing the dark and eerie atmosphere of Berserk.

The story of the game includes events present in:
- "The Golden Age Arc"
- "The Black Swordsman Arc"
- "The Conviction Arc"
- "The Falcon of the Millennium Arc"

The game may not be very challenging but it will appeal to the people that played "Hack n Slash" type of games and to the fans that are eager to get some more Berserk experience!

Also Thank You Kentaro Miura for sharing to us your vision and your amazing skills throughout your works! 
I hope you are in a good place!
Rest In Peace Kentaro Miura (July 11 1966 - May 6 2021).

author: {'steamid': '76561197993757463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1659682339}
review:
It's a game that follows the simple 1 versus 1000 gameplay that you're used to from this company (such as the Dynasty Warriors series for example.) Aside from the occasional graphical laziness (such as a character just rotating in place instead of actually turning their body (like you can see their legs and at some times the characters' feet just sliding in a circular motion to turn to face something. it's silly looking but it can be forgiven) or a few grammatical or spelling errors (there is only a Japanese dub, you will be relying on the subtitles and the mistakes have the ability to confuse you at times and will notice).

These are things that I found myself able to play through without issue, but there was one mission where you have to protect an area, preventing enemies from exiting the level to attack something.... and then you prevent the enemies from escaping.... to that same location that they were about to attack. It was lazy and that genuinely gave me a headache. Usually I am able to suspend my disbelief that I simply couldn't ignore.

That being said, this game lets you play as numerous characters from the show (I did not read the original Manga) and the events and the art style follow the remade Golden Age Arc very closely. I found myself enjoying these aspects. You are able to use various equipment such as throwing knives in addition to the weapon that your character comes with (such as Guts' gigantic sword, Griffiths' rapier, etc). At some point you get a rapidly firing crossbow which allows you to engage an entire horde of enemies all at once, stun locking some enemies and putting weaker ones on the ground; You can also use this to build up a long combo well into the triple digits. Unfortunately the animation for getting these equipment out take too long to make them something you can rely upon. On the one hand this does well to balance the game on lower difficulty settings but on the other for those who want a challenge they may be better off just pretending this equipment isn't there. You can also carry reusable items for things like healing or temporarily boosting certain stats like attack or defense in a pinch so it isn't a complete loss. You select these by swapping through them using the directional pad which is extremely difficult to do while moving and I do not believe you can do so while in an attack animation once again making it difficult to use reliably.

All in all though, it is a great game that follows the original story line (at least of the remake) very faithfully and I have had great fun experiencing this story (no nudity though, you have the internet for that fellow pervs). If you like the 1 versus 1000 gameplay of Dynasty Warriors, Samurai Warriors, or Warriors Orochi then this will be more of the same of that. If you are not a fan of that but like the Berserk series enough, I would still recommend this game but perhaps to a lesser degree.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005104396', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1641733473}
review: See you at the Campfire of Dreams.  Rest easy Kentaro. Thank you always.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135477104', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2408, 'last_played': 1636129414}
review: Decided to do a review as the author of Berserk has passed away recently and I wanted to express how enjoyable this game was for me to play (Though I am still getting used to how other characters play besides Guts to this day). The story of berserk was portrayed nicely in my opinion as the cinematic's and cut-scenes take the player on Gut's Journey (with the events tab adding some small discussions). Playing as Guts gives of the feeling like you are playing a better adaption of the manga than the 2016 & 2017 anime (in my opinion) as you go through the adventure fighting the likes of Bazuso through to the likes of Ganishka and unlocking the Berserker armour or "The Beast of Darkness" outfit afterwards is very satisfying and fun to play with. In summary the game was lots of fun to play, teaches you about the world of berserk and can take a good while to finish as endless abyss is kinda the endgame grind after story mode (If that makes sense).

author: {'steamid': '76561198191295734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1620314861}
review:
I just finished the main story, and during that time played a bit of the "Endless Eclipse" mode.

I'm going to start with the cons:
I was a little worried about buying this at first, considering this game came out a few years ago and was still being sold at full price. Not to mention that the game has subtitles and all the text can be in English, but none of the audio is. That wouldn't normally be an issue for me, but in a game where plot and dialogue is happening while you play, it can be hard to watch what you are doing while also reading the subtitles.

Once you finish the Golden Age (and the movie can no longer be used for cutscenes) the cutscenes take a small hit. There is a bit toward the end of the game where the quality of the animations in the cutscenes drop to people swiveling around on a fixed point, mouths don't move, and people pop into place. It's not great, but this seemed to only last for a few levels? Maybe whoever was put in charge of that segment of the game didn't do a great job, or possibly the team was forced to rush through that part to meet a deadline? Not sure, but it does improve from there and ends on a strong note. 

(It might not matter to everyone, but just so you know, they censor a lot of stuff in this game, which would normally be fine, but like, it's really noticeable to the point of being embarrassing (and maybe a little insulting?) that they are trying to censor so hard. Like if someone tried to put Game of Thrones on the Disney Channel or something. It's just really weird to me that in between 20-30 minute segments of bisecting thousands of men into a fine mist of beef stroganoff and pink mashed potatoes, that they would sometimes blacken more than 50% of the screen, especially for a Berserk game that was made in Japan.)

The camera is just sightly too close to Guts while playing. It's a little frustrating, but it's not that close that it makes the game impossible to play, and you will definitely get use to it quickly.

Other than those few things, I can't find much more negative things to say about it. If you like the Dynasty Warrior Style games, you'll love this. The crafting and item upgrading is surprising fun, and the new equipment that Guts unlocks as the game goes on are fun to use and all have their own weird uses in combat. 

The Endless Eclipse is just like any other Endless enemy mode in other games, but this one has individual missions for you to complete as you go, with small side quest like objectives that, if completed, will net you a good amount of gold and items. 

I saw some people complaining that this game stems too far from the source material, which is sort of a half truth. It does change a few things, but the things are fairly minor. I genuinely believe this to be a far better experience and summary of the story than the 2016 and 2017 anime were, for whatever that's worth.

The side characters are portrayed far less annoyingly in the game than the anime as well. Their interactions are treated lighter than some of the darker parts of the series, but are treated with respect (except for a certain character), and don't give you whiplash to the point of being tone deaf like the anime did.

All that being said, I would say that maybe $60+ for this is too much, but if you catch it on sale, like I did, absolutely go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081048536', 'num_games_owned': 1214, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1620312601}
review:
If you really like hack and slash games, you'll probably like this but I'm impartial on them and can say that this is bad.
The combat on foot is fine, more than acceptable but something that really annoys me is how low and close the camera is to your character, feels strange when I'm meant to be looking around me at the 1000 enemies surrounding me. Horse combat is really bad, not much else I can say on that. The difficulty options are strange, Hard and below are all fine but I kept getting 2 shot in the Berserk difficulty, I get that it's meant to be hard but the enemy damage output just skyrockets instead of more elite enemies coming at you which is something I rather dislike.
They use the Berserk Movie clips as cutscenes which is kinda lazy since the intro video is a awesome in game engine cutscene, wish they did more of that. 
Also, for whatever reason the menu sound design is really bad quality in comparison to in game, found that really strange. And those cutscenes I spoke of earlier were really low framerate half of the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310147380', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1620247602}
review: People complain about this game, I will admit it is not a masterpiece, and people complain about it running on windows 10 if you have windows 10 when launching the game itll ask you if you want to watch it in compatibility  mode just click yes, gameplay wise if you are a fan of berserk and like playing dynasty warriors the this game is perfect for you

author: {'steamid': '76561199008829628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5478, 'last_played': 1620191318}
{'steamid': '76561198176738205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1621962586}
review:
Game is brainless fun, It's the kinda fun you can't really complain about. It's simple, you cut hordes of enemies in half and get to play through more than just the Golden Age arc.

Game is fun, get it on a sale, R.I.P. Kentaro Miura you absolute legend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324280389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1627960019}
review: Pretty good recap of the berserk story, get to play as Guts in a videogame so its great

author: {'steamid': '76561197985041493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1651322633}
review:
So far I really like this game. I have never really been a big fan of games with a dynasty warriors style, but I think it fits really well with the berserk universe, I think this was a great choice for the case of berserk. Many characters, each with their own style of combat, the only thing is the execution is a little monotonous and even after raising difficulty it doesn't change enormously.

It feels like an interactive movie which covers the berserk series and is really well-rendered both graphically and gameplay-wise, just sit back, mash some buttons and watch the beautiful attacks unfold.

I don't see much reason for anyone who is not a berserk fan to get this tbh, I feel like this game is more of a complementary thing to a berserk fan (such as myself).

author: {'steamid': '76561198235174480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1620095834}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072602961', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1619848100}
review:
If you're a Berserk fan, I'd say buy it on sale. You're getting exactly what you'd expect, a Musou game with a Berserk coat of paint. 

You get to experience a good 75-80% of the manga with braindead, gory hack and slash tacked on. It's fun in bursts, or if you just wanna experience Berserk in ways other than reading. 

If the above sounds appealing, give it a buy when its on sale. Even then, I would not recommend at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139520562', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1700042995}
review:
-Rest in Peace Kentaro Miura (1966-2021), thank you for your amazing work of art-


You can f*ck sh*t up as zodd, the wyald fight is in here and its an overall better adaptation from the manga than the 2016 anime, thats all you need to know. 

But in all seriousness, be mindful on the fact that this game has optimization issues and does not run well on most systems. If you dont mind the game running at 40-50 fps for the most part and youre a berserk fan, totally go for it

author: {'steamid': '76561198076485903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1619857275}
review:
This game runs insanely badly on windows 10 despite being out for 4 years, at bare min graphics 1080x1920 there's still too much lag for me to enjoy playing. Not to mention graphics glitching out during fights. Taking the resolution down further helps with lag but for a 60$ game that shouldn't be necessary especially a 4 year old game...

As a longtime berserk fan I've wanted to try this game since it came out but it seemed overpriced and mediocre. Wish I had stayed away, going to spend some time trying to optimize it to run better at higher graphics settings but might just end up refunding it if I'm not over the 2 hour limit by then...

A 60$ game with 7 paid dlc shouldn't run nearly this bad. Borderlands 3 ran smoother in 4k and doom eternal played perfectly at max graphics on this laptop, so clearly something is in serious need of fixing though after this long I wouldn't count on the devs to fix anything.

**Update: I did end up managing to get the game running better at high graphics though 4k is still too laggy for me. Now that it's playable I have been enjoying it overall though not sure it's worth 60$. About to finish the Golden Age and so far they've done a solid job with the story for the most part, aside from some clunky dialog changes. Will try and update once I've finished the story mode.

Anyways if you can get it running smooth it's worth trying if you are a Berserk/Dynasty Warriors fan. Though with how repitiive the gameplay of these style games gets you might be better off just watching playthroughs or the movies and saving the money to buy the manga or other games. It is fun playing through the story as Guts or other characters and going on rampages though most of the Golden Age missions started to blend together due to the repitive maps and objectives. Hoping post eclipse gets more exciting.

The Femto story mode eclipse boss fight is one of the worst I've ever played, he just spams a ridiculous amount of knock back attacks while you are constantly getting slowed down by debuffs. Incredibly rage inducing, it only took 3 special attacks to beat him but it felt like forever trying to actually get close enough to land hits. Not to mention they don't even fight in the story at this point so it just felt super unecessary, an unwinnable fight would have been more fun....

**Finished story mode update: Took about 20-30~ hours including some idle time. It started out pretty generic during the golden Age, lots of similar castle battles. Fighting Zodd was a fun turning point that started getting me more hyped for the rest of the story but ended up leaving me disappointed. The Eclipse was really well done overall aside from the BS femto fight. Later parts like Qliphoth felt unfinished though, the level design was pretty bland compared to the Eclipse. Fighting with Gut's party is exciting, being able to play as Schierke and Serpico is fun. Though after beating the story there's not a whole lot to do, really wish it had some sort of Ambition mode where you could choose your party, otherwise there's not much reason to bother upgrading each character. The Endless Eclipse mode is cool but seems a bit to random and repetitive without being able to customize a team (you can play as any character and allies randomly pop up temporarily)

Even at 50% off it seems pretty overpriced but could be worth it for Berserk fans. Parts are great but parts feel unfinished.

review:
This game is great even if you don't know the show that much as it does somewhat provide a little bit of the real story, but still is too lacking to get a true feel. I recommend before playing too far into this game that you watch the anime or read through the manga.

Compared to the other musous I've played, which is only Hyrule Warriors Definitive Edition, lol. It is really a good game and straight forward, but is lacking in content, as Hyrule Warriors has hundreds, if not, a thousand or so hours of content. I don't know if the other games have that much content, but I just wanted to include my take.

This game is great and if you like this genre and don't care about spoilers, or if you know the story, you will most likely enjoy this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990491944', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1604, 'last_played': 1634724013}
review:
If you really like a decent story line or are a fan of the series than it's a good pick up.
If you want a game that has a lot of content and heavy replay value this is not the game. It's extremely repetitive and gets boring fast, like most games in the "Dynasty Warriors"-ish style. The only upside is, it's almost like they knew it was repetitive. The game has some cool scenes inserted from the original animation and is quite short, allowing you to jump into Endless Eclipse Mode and using other characters quickly. 

Also Endless Eclipse WILL crash at shitty moments. Just gotta get over it and move forward you'll eventually get to Layer 100.

Gets a thumbs up simply because it was a fun quick play. While repetitive it's also short so it never gets too boring. Endless Eclipse is fun but crashes quite a bit. Getting all the achievements and a 100% save doesn't require a massive grind either.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978693708', 'num_games_owned': 1696, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1516, 'last_played': 1661628799}
review:
You probably know if you're going to like this game before you buy it. It's a good musou, it's a good Berserk game. You hit dudes with the same 3-hit combo a million times and throw some special moves and transformations in every now and then. The PC port is completely fine and I never had issues across ~25 hours of playtime. The story mode has you only play as one character, but it never felt like it got old to me. After story mode, you can replay missions with whichever character you want, and you unlock a 100 floor "dungeon" that you can play as anyone.

Easy recommendation if you like the anime / manga. If you're coming in as a musou fan, this one is definitely fun and has all the usual things you'd expect, but the character selection is pretty limited compared to something like Dynasty Warriors. Also there's a magical unicorn DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198436640511', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1644343791}
review:
If you often think about mindlessly slaughtering endless hordes of people with a sword that's the size of a car, then this game is pretty much a perfect choice. It mainly consists of slicing down hundreds of enemies at any given time with little bits of story dribbled in there, however if you've already read or watched the source material then you'll have no problem following on, even if you haven't though, the game does it's best to tell a story with anime cut-scenes between levels.
At Â£49.99 i would say it's a bit of a hard purchase and while it does go for less than half of that at Â£19.99 in sales, the reason why I bit the bullet and payed full price is that it doesn't go on sale very often though if it does and you have a bit of cash burning a hole in your steam wallet then go ahead and give it a try, as of writing this review I have 40 minutes in the game and I have beaten the first level which gives you a good view of how the rest of the game is, so if you don't like it you still have plenty of time to request a refund.
I will say that the game performs fine I guess - I have a ryzen 7 2700 and a RX 580 with 16GB of ram and I get 40-60 fps which is completely playable but given that it pretty much forces you to run it in windows 7 compatibility mode it does tank the performance a bit.
Overall I'd say if your looking at this then you're probably interested in the game so give it a try :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995234696', 'num_games_owned': 1564, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1615164642}
review:
I put about 10 hours into it and reached a point where I cannot progress any further because the game crashes after the cutscene. This forces me to repeat the entire mission each time. 

Definitely the quality I'd expect from a full priced game. Pick this up if you like paying $60 for a game that you can't beat due to unpatched bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338047131', 'num_games_owned': 2432, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 1599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1599, 'last_played': 1614812693}
review:
(English)
This game has a lot of issues so get it on sale & Keep in mind it's a low budget game.
But, is it worth it?
Well, for a berserk fan? Definetely yes. Its better than the anime version & the games goes until you defeat guts vs ganishka to go to elfhelm. There's some cut content here and there, still i had a lot of fun rinse & repeat around the game as guts.
But, is it worth as a musou game or game at all?
Well... for the price & for gameplay wise i really think isn't a very good game around a 6/10 game, mainly because it's a low budged game.... you can have a better musou experience with other games from Koei or play Nioh which it's a better game too. 

Pros
-Songs
-GUTS
- Lore/Story Chars
-Cutscenes+some animations
- Frenzy mode+Transformations

Cons
- Repetitive scenarios/maps/gameplay
- Apostoles boss hitboxes it's a joke it's so bad(they can even stun lock you sometimes for around 30/50s)
- Achievs are really grind, so i recommend only doin' story mode because it's good.

review: Mindless button mashing fun! The character models, animations, and voice acting are top notch! Lot's of clips from the movies. There's even what if scenarios that add extra fun! If you're a Berserk fan, this game is a must. Otherwise, it's still a fun game that I would definitely recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198878515384', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1613857689}
review: its pretty good, not at full price though. I've never played another dynasty warriors game before so  I cant really compare this to the rest, but as a hack and slash it does its job pretty well, even if it does come down to essentially mashing 2 buttons. I think the real reason most of us might want to play this is because of the material it's based on. As a fan of berserk i enjoyed the game probably more than i would have if it had a different skin and narrative, so if you like berserk you'll probably enjoy this on some level

review: Its a good game, only thing thats crap about it are some glitches/bugs here and there, but overall, an amazing story (i mean its Berserk) and fun gameplay of Dynasty Warriors!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001782631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1642721626}
review:
Even tho most of the Warriors titles are basically the same game, i found Berserk to be somewhat unique compared to the generic Koei Tecmo Warriors games.

The game unravels itself by using the 90s anime as cutscenes, which is pretty neat. There is some added CGI tho.

Gameplay feels great and it's fun to whack people as Guts.

Anyways, keep in mind that it is just another Warriors title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263682135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2100, 'last_played': 1696750572}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080534992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1223, 'last_played': 1700383107}
review: Great for a berserk fan to get his fix of berserk in game format, the game is very true to the story...for the first half anyway after the golden age arc the game plummets hard from greatness. Understandably this game came out before berserk 2016 was released, but its as if the team creating the game read through berserk, found it way way too brutal and decided to just play the "this doesnt need to exist for the story" as many other adaptions have done in the past. noone seems to learn from it. however it seems in this particular case they abandoned the story in a very lazy fasion. but ill still reccomend the game, cuz big sword kill

author: {'steamid': '76561198061652531', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1614470549}
review: It's Berserk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042009674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2868, 'last_played': 1489587887}
review: Extremely bland and grindy. The worst musou games have to offer, and not a very good retelling of the story. None of the what if scenarios or extra missions most musou games offer. You get the option to replay a couple missions with other characters, but there's basically no point and Guts is the only one with a decent moveset. After completing the campaign all you have left is completing bonus objectives to unlock gallery extras that would have been interesting 20 years ago, and the Eclipse. The Eclipse is the laziest, blandest gauntlet I've seen in awhile. Last criticism is that they couldn't getting the licensing rights for the the original score, so all the cutscenes from the movies are butchered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240323958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6630, 'last_played': 1558986230}
review: This game is a hell of a lot of fun for mindless hacking and slashing through endless hordes. While it may not be the best plot-wise (as there is still a lot of Berserk's story left out), I find a certain satisfaction in watching Guts or the others rip and tear through the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122193732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3177, 'last_played': 1672795820}
review:
Good game to turn your brain off to. Has port issues, including lack of mouse spupport, bizarre keyboard config with no way to change it in game, framedrops, and crashing. That being said, if you use a controller and have a decent CPU, it's very playable, and quite fun.
Story is a pretty decent length, though the real meat of the game is in Endless Eclipse mode, and getting all the unlocks.
7/10 Griffith did nothing wrong

author: {'steamid': '76561198101068803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 3002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3002, 'last_played': 1609664680}
review: For those who are unaware of the term "musou fighter" it is like the Dynasty warrior games, where you are one versus a thousand. Berserk and the Band of the Hawk is just that, a classic retelling of the Berserk story in the styles of a musou game. For anyone who is a fan of either the anime or just musou games in general I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049723621', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1609264171}
review:
If you like this game you are a part of the "Fuck Griffith" Gang. Congrats.

No but jokes asside. As a Berserk fan I really enjoy this game. It may be over the top hack and slash action but I still enjoy the story telling because they tried really hard to be loyal to the manga.

Mechanics are pretty easy as you just have light and heavy attack, a dodge and sprint button and a power gauge that you can fill for a big AoE attack.

The only bad point I have for this game is that it can get repetitive after a few hours so just relax and go easy on it. I personally have never played a game of this kind but I can still enjoy it.

Oh and what I forgot... the music is not that great in my opinion so just turn it off and put on a classic Berserk 1997 OST playlist or some cool remixes and go at it.

review:
[h1][b]Dream ? You can't eat dreams...[/b][/h1]

[i][b]BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk[/b][/i] est un Musou reprenant l'univers et l'histoire de l'oeuvre de KentarÅ Miura, [i]Berserk[/i]. Qui connait [i]Berserk[/i] et le genre de jeu Musou doit certainement se dire "...mais Ã§a dÃ©chire !", ce Ã  quoi je rÃ©pondrai simplement : oui mon bon ami, oui, Ã§a dÃ©chire.
Si je ne pense pas qu'il faille nÃ©cessairement connaitre l'oeuvre [i]Berserk[/i] pour prendre plaisir avec le jeu, il est toutefois nÃ©cessaire d'apprÃ©cier le Musou et son inÃ©vitable rÃ©pÃ©titivitÃ©.

Le Musou, pour rappel, c'est un genre Hack 'n' Slash dans lequel on contrÃ´le le plus souvent un seul personnage par bataille face Ã  des centaines de petits ennemis servant de chair Ã  canon, quelques ennemis plus forts et solides, et un boss Ã  battre en conclusion de quelques quÃªtes moyennement diversifiÃ©es. On y ajoute des attaques chargÃ©es puissantes et spectaculaires, des attaques ultimes, et mÃªme parfois des transformations. Bref, c'est un genre de jeu bien bourrin, un dÃ©fouloir plaisant Ã  souhait, mais qui peut malgrÃ© tout se vouloir bien plus exigeant et technique en difficultÃ© maximale.
L'univers de [i]Berserk[/i], guerrier, fantaisiste, violent et sanglant, se prÃªte donc particuliÃ¨rement bien Ã  ce genre de jeu. Et sans surprise, la dÃ©couverte manette en main est un vÃ©ritable plaisir.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2324439807
Quand je dis ne pas penser qu'il faille nÃ©cessairement connaitre [i]Berserk[/i] pour apprÃ©cier le jeu, je veux dire que celui-ci reprend bien l'ambiance et le dÃ©roulement de l'histoire, et pour cause puisqu'il puise allÃ¨grement dans les 3 films de 2012-2013 en nous en montrant de nombreuses sÃ©quences. Maintenant, jeu vidÃ©o oblige, tous les passages de l'histoire originale 
 ne sont pas gardÃ©s, et la censure fait des siennes. Ainsi, celui ou celle qui ne connait pas l'histoire suffisamment en dÃ©tail pourra se demander en cours de jeu : "pourquoi il manque un oeil Ã  Guts ?" ou "...un foetus magique ?", et c'est lÃ©gitime parce que l'oeil crevÃ© de Guts et le viol de Casca ne sont par exemple pas montrÃ©s (ni mÃªme Ã©voquÃ©s je crois).
Trop souvent, l'adaptation d'une oeuvre en anime/film n'est pas parfaitement fidÃ¨le au manga/light novel qu'elle reprend, et c'est Ã©galement le cas lors d'une adaptation en jeu vidÃ©o. L'anime saute des passages et censure l'oeuvre originale, et le jeu vidÃ©o saute des passages et censure l'anime. Ce qu'il reste est donc trÃ¨s Ã©dulcorÃ©. Dans [i][b]BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk[/b][/i], c'est un peu confus... Parce que cela reste violent (sang, dÃ©membrement, dÃ©capitation...) mais Ã§a la joue prude (pas ou trÃ¨s peu de nuditÃ©, scÃ¨nes de "sexe" peu ou pas Ã©voquÃ©es...). L'anime de 2016-2017 nous fait la mÃªme en Ã©vitant la controverse Mario, Ã  savoir pas de tÃ©tons, mais ne lÃ©sine pas sur la violence. Et malgrÃ© tout, le jeu a l'avantage de faire apparaÃ®tre Wyald, un personnage bien trash (mais version soft quand mÃªme dans le jeu) qui n'apparaÃ®t ni dans les animes ni dans les films [i]Berserk[/i], juste le manga.
Bref, je le redis, connaitre [i]Berserk[/i] n'est pas nÃ©cessaire, mais dans ce cas il manquera quelques explications pour comprendre certaines choses. Et inversement, connaitre [i]Berserk[/i] est Ã©videmment un gros plus, mais on se rendra alors compte qu'il manque beaucoup de dÃ©tails et de passages des autres formats de l'oeuvre.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2314559695
Bref, revenons-en au jeu. 3 modes y sont prÃ©sents :
Î˜ le mode histoire qui nous fera revivre les grandes lignes des aventures de Guts Ã  travers 46 missions s'Ã©talant de la rencontre avec la bande du faucon jusqu'au dÃ©part en bateau pour Elfhelm. Le jeu couvre donc en partie l'arc du Golden Age, du Black Swordsman, Conviction et The Hawk of the Millennium. Il va ainsi mÃªme un peu plus loin dans l'histoire que l'anime le plus rÃ©cent.
Î˜ le mode libre, permettant de refaire les missions du mode histoire en jouant avec n'importe quel personnage jouable. Ces personnages jouables sont au nombre de 8 : Guts, Casca, Griffith, Judeau, Zodd, Wyald, Serpico et Schierke.
Î˜ le mode Endless Eclipse, qui nÃ©cessite plus de mots que les autres. C'est un mode dans lequel on va jouer un des personnages et s'enfoncer couche par couche dans les enfers en rÃ©alisant diverses missions.
On commence par choisir son personnage, puis un mini-scÃ©nario qui va nous faire traverser 5 couches. Une mission nous sera donnÃ©e dans chaque couche (tuer 100 ennemis, terrasser tel personnage, escorter un personnage jusqu'Ã  la sortie, etc...) et une fois celle-ci accomplie, le portail nous menant Ã  la couche suivante se dÃ©bloque. Dans la cinquiÃ¨me, on affrontera un boss pour terminer la petite histoire, aprÃ¨s quoi il faudra en choisir une autre et repartir pour 5 couches. Il y a en tout 100 couches Ã  traverser, et il n'y a de checkpoints que toutes les 20 couches. Si on quitte ou meurt avant d'atteindre le checkpoint, il faudra recommencer depuis le dernier (ou celui/ceux d'avant, au choix). Autre spÃ©cificitÃ©, on ne rÃ©cupÃ¨re pas de vie et d'objets entre les couches. Chaque objet utilisÃ© ne sera rÃ©cupÃ©rÃ© qu'en recommenÃ§ant le mode (Ã  partir d'un checkpoint). De mÃªme pour la santÃ©, mais une mission spÃ©ciale se lance une fois dans chaque lot de 5 couches, permettant de rÃ©cupÃ©rer un objet redonnant toute notre santÃ© en la complÃ©tant.
C'est ce mode qui va considÃ©rablement allonger la durÃ©e de vie du jeu, y rajoutant plusieurs dizaines d'heures pour ceux qui voudront aller jusqu'au bout avec tous les personnages (et ainsi dÃ©bloquer tous le contenu du jeu).

CÃ´tÃ© ambiance, c'est un rÃ©gal. J'avais un peu peur que celle-ci se rapproche trop d'un Dynasty Warriors, mais non, c'est trÃ¨s proche de celle que j'imagine pour [i]Berserk[/i], trÃ¨s influencÃ© que je suis bien sÃ»r par les films et sÃ©ries animes de la licence. Musiques calmes, douces et poÃ©tiques pour les moments de discussion, de rÃ©flexion et le menu principal (mais pas de Susumu Hirasawa Ã  ce que je sache :'( ). Musiques de type heroic fantasy lumineuses ou sombres avec orgue pour les batailles et combats de boss. Doublages japonais par les doubleurs des films et de la derniÃ¨re sÃ©rie. Le son des armes et des coups immersifs, particuliÃ¨rement en mode furie, Ã©voquant parfaitement le bruit des os et de la chair broyÃ©s par les coups puissants portÃ©s par Guts et son Ã©pÃ©e dÃ©mesurÃ©e...(oui je me fais dÃ©jÃ  soigner).

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2297572343
En fait, j'Ã©cris beaucoup pour ne rien dire, parce qu'une fois qu'on a dit que [i][b]BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk[/b][/i] est un Musou Ã  la sauce [i]Berserk[/i], on a dÃ©jÃ  presque tout dit. Il reste juste Ã  savoir quel est son contenu, et si le jeu est bien rÃ©alisÃ©, deux choses que je viens d'Ã©voquer. Ici le contenu est consÃ©quent, comme le bestiaire d'ailleurs, et le jeu trÃ¨s bien rÃ©alisÃ© (mÃªme si on peut de temps en temps rÃ¢ler Ã  cause de la camÃ©ra, surtout face aux boss gÃ©ants).
Si on aime [i]Berserk[/i] et le genre Musou, on va adorer le jeu (c'est mon cas). Si on aime le Musou sans connaitre [i]Berserk[/i], on peut aussi aimer le jeu et par la mÃªme occasion dÃ©couvrir (en surface) l'univers fantastique de [i]Berserk[/i]. Si on aime [i]Berserk[/i] sans aimer le Musou...lÃ  par contre, fatalement Ã§a va coincer, pas sÃ»r que ce jeu soit fait pour vous malheureusement. Mais dans tous les cas, si vous voulez acheter le jeu, attendez une promo. Non pas qu'il ne vaut pas ses 60â‚¬, au contraire. Mais ce jeu qui date de 2017, on le trouve aujourd'hui bien moins cher sur console donc pourquoi le payer au prix plein sur PC ? author: {'steamid': '76561197989952345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1604985642}
review:
TL;DR 
7/10
Okay, only for Warriors/Berserk fans.

Do you like Dynasty Warriors games?
This is a generic one.

Do you like Berserk?
This is probably the closest we'll get to a Berserk game that follows the manga.

Do you like button mashing?
This is a button masher (Input Combos)

If you like all three, then this game's pretty decent. The cutscenes feel like they ran out of time, for the first half of the game they hash in scenes from the Berserk movies... then use the in-game engine for the rest of the story, up until the Kushan emperor where the game ends. Feels like it's unfinished.

I completed the story in about 10 hours on normal mode, you're forced to play as Guts for about 95% of the missions. For whatever reason they have  other characters you can play as in some of the story missions (about 2 per other PC) which makes no sense. Would have been better to just force players to play as Guts the entire story...

Most of the Behelit challenges aren't unreachable, they unlock gallery items. You can 100% this game in a few weeks if you really wanted to. The endless oblivion mode offers more challenges, and as always there's a free mode.

You could probably milk anywhere from 10-80 hours from "Berserk and the Band of the Hawk"

author: {'steamid': '76561197997840618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1360, 'last_played': 1604905288}
review:
Not the best Musou/Warriors game. 
It's very story-driven, and it has an impressive amount of content at least.  There are a TON of missions, and a lot of cutscenes done in-engine, which they normally don't do.  As another plus, you also get some glimpses of the anime for cutscenes as well. 
However, because it's THIS story, you're forced to play as the main character for about 90% of the story mode, making you wonder why they even bothered putting other characters into the game when you only really use them for a mission or two. 
The story starts at the beginning, but it doesn't really find its form gameplay-wise until it gets close to the end.  Most of the missions I played were INSTANTLY forgettable, with very uninteresting set pieces and enemies, which is surprising considering the source material they're pulling from.  And when the levels DID get interesting, they would usually be ruined by a dumb mechanic or a boss fight that's only difficult because of the near-infinite amount of I-frames the bosses get.  On top of that, the game doesn't end at a very satisfying part of the story.  This series will seemingly never have a complete adaptation aside from the manga, which is unfortunate. 
And to top everything off...this is just a bad port, plain and simple.  I have a pretty good gaming computer that can run games that are more intense than this, and even with everything on low, this game does NOT run well.  If basically ANYTHING interesting happened during a mission, the frames would dip down pretty bad. 
I had to suffer through this because Berserk is my brother's favorite thing ever, and he wouldn't stop pestering me about it.  Now that I'm done, I can finally remove it to make room for something actually good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005141399', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1604020144}
review:
Attempting to refund this game after only 30 minutes. Two big reasons why I can't recommend this:

Firstly, the story telling. For some reason the game opens with a quasi flash forward to the events of the eclipse. Whilst I suspect most people that play this probably know what happens, I still found this spoiler somewhat jarring. The levels themselves don't feel particularly cinematic and are rather dull affairs.

Secondly, the gameplay is just so boring. I genuinely feel as if this gameplay is somehow simpler and worse than the dynasty warriors games from the 2000s. There doesn't appear to be many combos and some combos clearly work better than others. The regular enemies infinitely respawn and normally require you to kill X before moving on; I hate this and would much rather just have X there to begin with and be somewhat challenging. Standing in the same spot spamming a couple of buttons until you reach a quota is not that fun. The bosses from the first couple of levels are also very easy and very dull. There's no need to block, even on the harder difficulty, you just spam the same couple of buttons whilst you character hits them with the same movements. 

To put it into a perspective that Berserk fans might understand: This is like the game form of the 2016 anime. It's still Berserk, but it should've and could've been so much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062247697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 4836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4836, 'last_played': 1600520618}
review:
Bloody, gory, brutal, Berserk as Berserk should be. 

This game tells the story of Guts from his teenagerhood, throught the Eclipse all the way up to the escape in Vritannis. You play (mostly) as Guts in a plotline quite close to the one of the manga. The game presents you with several cutscenes to enrich the experience. Some cutscenes are animated with the game's assets, some directly extracted from the movie. There are also extras providing further details for those who enjoy further character development.

You get to play Casca, Judeau, Griffith [spoiler]did nothing wrong[/spoiler], Serpico, Schierke, Zodd, Wyald and Guts (later in FREAKING BERSERK ARMOR). The characters are really different in terms of speed, damage and overall strategy. You can also collect, customize and equip accessories.

The gameplay is a bit of a shock at first. This is a musou-style game, so it will always be you versus a horde of enemies. That is welcome at the endgame, but at the beginning it feels off. There are only 2 attacks: light and heavy. Combos are very different, but also quite easy. The whole game is very easy even in Hard Mode. Enemies hardly attack you, they are there mostly to fill your "frenzy" bar, which allows you to go all "ORA ORAAAAAA".

Getting all achievements will involve a repeating 100 layers of "the Eclipse" with each character - basically, 100 randomly generated quests, completely disconnected from the story. It gets old very quickly, but well, achievements eh? Otherwise, the achievements make sense and encourage the player to explore the different playstyles. Awesomely developed!

There was no Linux port, but it worked flawlessly with Proton, after disabling the cutscenes. Thanks Steam Team for supporting the Penguin!

This is game is a great opportunity for people to get in touch with Berserk, since anime adaptations are still on the "meh" side. Also... playing with the Berserker Armor is HNNNNNNGGGGGGGGG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037930125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1647068075}
review: i would recommend this game to people that enjoy the dynasty warriors and berserk anime. not too monotonous or repetitive in the gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976081787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1225, 'last_played': 1600880928}
review:
For those interested in a decent mindless hack and slash game, this is definitely a good title.

First off, This game is based off the anime & manga. For those who have seen or read them, you are going to know more of what is going on as the game skips a LOT of minor points that made the series so good. Another issue is that they are taking the story based off the Golden Age Arc anime series which is heavily truncated compared to the original episodes (Yes the manga's are more detailed... are they not always!)

Those who have not had any interaction with the series will be just fine. However you may feel that some plot events feel a bit rushed or are lacking in proper justification. This is a big thing for the first arc of the game. After that, the events tend to move with more plot.

Soooooooooooooo, what exactly is this game about you might ask. Well take the highly blood filled anime Berserk and put it in the "Dynasty Warriors (DW)" game and this is what you get. If you have played ANY dynasty warriors game you know how it works. Lots and lots and lots of enemies who do an attack every once in a while and who stand there while you pummel them with no regard (Honestly it sort of works well for the berserk series). 

You start off playing as Guts (Yes that is his name) hacking and slashing under the Band of the Hawk until events lead you a different direction. Throughout the game you will meet now people and be able to play them in certain levels or previously beaten levels. Each person has a different style of fighting with unique rage moves. However this is a DW game so you will be spam hitting 2 buttons the majority of the game.

As far as graphics are concerned, they are decent. This was never designed to be Crysis or any super detailed game. The locations a very limited. You are mostly going to be running through a forest, a castle, a town, or dungeon. But what would you expect from medieval times, Disneyland was not quite invented yet. There is plenty of gore as you slash your way past about twenty different style creatures and humans. What you will not like is the super HORRIBLE camera angles. During large fights, especially ones with large creatures and walls the camera will be obstructed and you will not be able to see a thing. Speaking of walls, there is a large supply of invisible walls where enemies will come from and you can not enter.

Voices, Sounds and music are mixed bag. The game music is appropriate for the genre and are not annoying while going through the game. The sounds are pretty accurate and nothing to really complain about. The voice acting on the other hand is sometimes loud depending on characters, out of sync with the lips of characters and is ALWAYS much slower than the text. One thing to point out, this game is "ENGLISH SUBTITLED" so every thing is spoken in Japanese and written in English at the bottom of the screen. Not much of a problem unless you are in the middle of battle and everyone decides to have a conversation to include bosses!.

With all that said, if you are a fan of the Berserk series and are looking for a game to experience the show. This is a good (definitely in NO way great) tittle to pick up. If you have no idea about the series and are looking for a simple hack-n-slash game it is also something decent you will like (provided you are a fan of the Dynasty Warriors game style). If none of those categories fit your taste or you are looking for something with great graphics, depth in controls, and AAA gameplay, You are definitely in the wrong location and should quickly hit the "back" button and find another game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130301428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1693751282}
review:
As a Dynasty warriors styled game, it runs just about as well as they do. The story is summarized so you don't lose interest but also keeps it fairly paced so you don't blow through it. Difficulty is fair and combat can get stale if you don't increase the difficulty ever so often. It's safe to say mashing the attack button is the main point of the game, but because were swinging a giant hunk of metal for 90% of the game it's understandable. All in all I've never experienced any crashes but I don't want to speak too soon. It runs compatibility in windows 7 which is odd for a game that came out after windows 10 but either way. 

*SPOILER AHEAD* (Though not really since this game came out a couple years ago.)

Now the thing that really ticked me off is the fact that you can only play as Guts, Casca, Griffith, Judeau, Zodd, Schrieke, Serpico, and Wyald. Everyone except for Judeau and Wyald make sense to have, like Judeau I get but if your going to have him why not have idk Pippin or Rickert even, as they were shown to be capable fighters. And Wyald is kinda a wild card (Hehe get it) as his only prominent role is hunting down the Band of the Hawk one time and being an apostle but otherwise has little to no relevance. Understand there are multiple beloved and wanted characters people wish to play as other than just these guys. For instance there is no mission where you play as Bazuso, the big guy Guts kills in the beginning, where we see what would happen if Guts didn't win. It's ridiculous as every important character that you don't play as is just a copy and paste of regular units. Literally 3-4 of the bad guys are the same fight aside from looking slightly different and maybe getting an apostle fight. It's simply lazy and a spit in the face of anyone who actually loves this Manga and show. 

I can't say you shouldn't buy this because I quite enjoy it, but I'm for sure not going to suggest you buy either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167300456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1587908160}
review:
Story like Berserk was meant to be quite something, stunning like Nier:Automata and challenging like a Dark Souls, but all we got is mediocre slasher with funny facial animation. Only good thing about this game is a memories of TV series from 1997/8
--
Rest in peace, Kentaro Miura

author: {'steamid': '76561198850249043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1514, 'last_played': 1598141187}
review:
Si eres fan de berserk, como es mi caso, supongo que llevarÃ¡s aÃ±os a la espera de capÃ­tulos del anime y/o manga y cuando juegas a un juego basado en el manga esperas que el nivel del juego este mÃ­nimo a la altura de este, el caso es que estÃ¡ al nivel de la animaciÃ³n del anime... pero no por la animaciÃ³n en sÃ­, si no por la simpleza del juego el cual la compaÃ±ia desarrolladora ha hecho un Ctrl+C Ctrl+C de cualquiera de los juegos que han publicado anteriormente (si les echais un vistazo verÃ©is a que me refiero), no veÃ­a una mecÃ¡nica tan repetitiva desde juegos de los aÃ±os 90 o incluso del 2000, pero estos eran mejores juegos; la sinopsis mas simple del juego es la siguiente: coges el estilo de juego de un Dead Rising, que consiste en solo matar, matar... ah a si y matar, con npc sin fin, una IA bastante deficiente que pasa de atacarte en la mayor parte del juego ,algÃºn que otro boss y listo, sumÃ¡ndole ademÃ¡s a esto copiar exactamente igual los diÃ¡logos del anime (la primera temporada e incluso algo de la segunda) y metiendo media serie/pelÃ­culas como cinemÃ¡ticas; y agravando esto aÃ±adiendo algunas de estas escenas con animaciÃ³n 3D peor que en el anime de 2016/17 Â¡OJO!

HabrÃ¡ algun@ que piense: pero si le has echado 25 horas. Tienes razÃ³n, pero solo por el hecho de que me costÃ³ 30 euros el juego, por lo que lo he jugado hasta llegar a pasarmelo, siendo cuanto menos tedioso.

He podido llegar a la conclusiÃ³n que este juego merecerÃ­a la pena si eres fan de todo lo contrario a los juegos soul-like (a no ser que pongas el juego en dificultad berserker o quizÃ¡s en hard, no vas a morir y quizÃ¡s ni eso), lo Ãºnico parecido a los juegos de tipo soul es la experiencia "interminable", en la que para matar a cualquier jefe o minion enemigo en general, tardes muchÃ­Ã­Ã­Ã­Ã­Ã­Ã­Ã­Ã­Ã­Ã­simo tiempo (no por dificultad, si no porque a ciertos NPC les quitas taaaaan poca vida que aunque ellos te quiten menos tardas como media hora y ni si quiera te estresas por la vida de tu personaje, aunque por la tuya si, por que la pierdes intentando pasarte medio juego...), llegando a hacer misiones realmente absurdas y haciendo que des vueltas por el mapa sin parar (menos mal que el mapa de cada misiÃ³n no es "grande"), los cuales (los mapas) ademÃ¡s tambiÃ©n se repiten en misiones que no tienen nada que ver pero los usan en otro orden (empiezas por el lado del mapa que acabaste en esa misiÃ³n 7 puestos mas atrÃ¡s que ya hiciste) para que parezcan distintos, es para mear y no echar gota bÃ¡sicamente.

Si tienes 30 euros cuando estÃ© en rebaja o 60 euros sin rebaja, y no sepas si quieres tirarlos a la basuras o quemarlos, quizÃ¡s te interese comprar este juego que se llama Berserk (por que lo pone en el tÃ­tulo), igual que podrÃ­a llamarse: pulsa el botÃ³n A del mando 99999999 veces y te has pasado el juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091570236', 'num_games_owned': 594, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4843, 'last_played': 1658663823}
review:
BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk is a dynastywarrior-like game that is surprisingly good and one of the best manga adaptation of all time (no joke).

 Graphics are good and enjoyable, models are detailled but you will not pay attention.
 The gameplay may be repetitive, it's all button smashing but challenges and bosses are here too and require to think strategies to overcome them. 
 The story are worth to follow and all manga's chapters are here ! (exept the "Lost Children Chapter" for obvious reason). (Come on, It's Berserk)
Soundtrack is mediocre, It's a shame that the game didn't use the official Berserk ost. At least you can unlock all OSTs in-game and listen to them if you want.

For true Berserk fans, this game is priceless ! Put your grasses on/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198061820683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1430, 'last_played': 1610175497}
review:
Like many others, I'm a huge Berserk. Love the manga and anime and, of course, now this game. The first half of the game's story is revolved around the Berserk movie trilogy, also sometimes adding scenes not depicted in either the 97 nor 16/17 anime, which was a really nice surprise. The second half of the story relies on in-game cutscenes, which aren't the most beautiful thing in the world but gets the job done and never subtracts from the enjoyment. 
Game play, I'd say it is repetitive but i never found myself not enjoying it. I think part of the fun was being able to collect material for forging better weapons. There is not much replay-ability to it though i still come to it every once in awhile. Overall, I love this game and would give it a 4/5!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016628406', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 4831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1898, 'last_played': 1622928926}
review:
Berserk and the Band of the Hawk is an interesting way of conveying the events of the famous Berserk manga. Without the context of the manga, you're likely to be incredibly lost as to what exactly is going on in the game, especially as the quality of the cutscenes diminishes significantly after the Golden Age arc. That means that if you're going into this game, you're either more of a fan of the gameplay style or you are a fan of the Berserk series.

However, it is important to note that I first attempted to play this game using Keyboard & Mouse, which is an unforgivably terrible idea. The Keyboard & Mouse method of the game is unplayable and is incredibly poorly optimized. It's really unfortunate that that is how it is, and I ended up having to wait until after I got a PS4 controller before I could play the game.

As an adaptation, the Berserk game does fairly well. A lot of the heavier and grittier moments that contain more overt sexual content are skipped over entirely and leave only mild speculation in its place. What's strange is that there are a lot of filler missions, and yet entire arcs of the manga are skipped over in the game, such as the Lost Children arc. This is mildly infuriating since there are some interesting story points to hit but those arcs are completely skipped over in favor of filler fights that are only there to pad out the game.

As a game, it functions as well as you'd expect. In story mode, you're likely to at some points get bored of doing the same repetitive nonsense as usual. Yet boss fights are surprisingly not very fun, especially when you get pinned to a wall and juggled by an enemy with no hope of recovering, or when an enemy has a large damage invulnerability window when doing certain attacks. The Femto boss fight in particular ended up being one of the most infuriating and dull boss fights I've fought in a video game before.

Free Mode, on the other hand, allows you to use any character you'd like whenever you'd like. This makes smaller characters like Schierke offer a more wide variety in terms of how you play and what abilities you have, since she is a magic user and doesn't just slash a couple hundred enemies at once. Once you get certain playable characters to level 100 of the Endless Eclipse, you also unlock powers for them that basically turn the game into easy mode even on the highest difficulty, allowing you to have more generic fun as well.

The Endless Eclipse allows for good item management and opportunities for leveling whilst also learning how to best utilize your character. This can become incredibly difficult when you are using someone overtly less powerful than Guts, but nonetheless is doable. The checkpoint system every 20 levels is also insanely handy, but once you reach the end, you feel like you know what you're doing and how to do it, even if it means being cheap and running in circles until your fury meter maxes out.

BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk is a fun and entertaining way of telling the story of Berserk. Where this game shines is in its gameplay and character variety outside of story mode, and where it tends to fail is that this game almost requires you to know the material beforehand, or just accept that you're unlikely to be able to follow along very well with what's going on.

Overall, I am just so happy that it came out before they could utilize scenes from the 2016 anime "adaptation."

author: {'steamid': '76561198090379957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2688, 'last_played': 1694487482}
review:
Frankly speaking, the game is really fun. I've seen some reviews label this as basically an asset flip, but I personally don't see it that way. As a Musou game, as well as a Berserk game, it does fine work in both regards. (Perhaps not the best representation it could muster, but it's fair.) Berserk is my absolute favorite story, and this game is just...I find it to be very satisfying to control Guts at each stage of his life up to Ganishka. However, from a more objective point-of-view, I can't recommend buying this game, and it all comes down to just how bad of a port it is.

I've played some bad ports, but this is by far the worst I've ever had the displeasure of getting my hands on.

First off, let me say this: Windows 10 was released in July of 2015, whereas this game was released in frickin' February of 2017. Nearly two full years of a full public release, and it still requires compatibility mode to run "properly." I've put 45 hours into this game as of this review, most of which were from the two weeks post-release, and I've had over 30 crashes. That isn't an exaggeration. Following their advice, [i]not[/i] following their advice...nothing works worth a damn. There's a guaranteed crash when you do too much inventory management at once at the shop and a chance of crash shortly after ending a mission, the latter of which only increases in probability the longer you play. On a technical standpoint, this game is held together with spaghetti code and the hopes and dreams of child workers stuck in humid factories -- YandereDev would be proud. 

[b] This game has not been updated once since its release. It's absolutely abandonware thrown up onto the Steam storefront to get money out of gullible people like myself, and I urge you all to stay away from buying the game. [u] Don't even buy it for a friend, as that could be considered an insult to the recipient in many parts of the world. [/u] [/b]

- Edit (July 17th, 2020): Runtime error...after runtime error...after runtime error, after runtime error, after runtime error! The crashes just will not stop! This time while it was trying to save data (which is not the first time this has happened). I repeat, please, do not waste your money with this!

review: La jugabilidad es super repetiva y nada desafiante, sin embargo no es un mal juego, puede ser entrenido a ratos pero definitivamente no es de lo mejores del genero, solo para fans de berserk y de preferencia agarrarlo en algun descuento.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097889460', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1570, 'last_played': 1640157488}
review: Ce jeu a licence (jamais bon signe) est une grosse surprise, je m'attendais a une grosse bouse, et au final c'est juste la meilleure adaptation des jeux de la licence du manga culte. Bien sur il est imparfait: gameplay peu technique, camera completement foireuse, graphisme assez retro mais a cotÃ© de Ã§a tellement de points positifs... la puissance des perso bien retransmis in game, l'ambiance glauque a souhait, l'ost fidele Ã  l'atmosphere, beaucoup de cinematiques de qualitÃ©es, une rejouabilitÃ©e consequente et j'en passe. Je n'ose imaginer par contre un jeu a la maniere de Dark Souls mais pour la licence Berserk.. en attendant on a la enfin un bon jeu fidele au manga et complet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095433784', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1662, 'last_played': 1594346922}
review:
[i] CLANG CLANG CLANG [/i]
Don't expect Devil May Cry levels of combos. It has the same gameplay loop as Dynasty Warriors.
If you enjoyed Dynasty Warriors and love Berserk, then you'll have no problems with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198442679121', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1595545239}
review:
si no leiste el manga ni nada (como yo) esta re divertido de jugar al principio, pero despues, despues es otra historia, lugares repetitivos, enemigos en masa, siempre hacer lo mismo, y bueno esta en ingles pero no importa mucho eso, ademas que hay partes de anime con el juego y cuando avanzas mas en el ya no las encontras a las cinematicas (supongo porque es de la primera pelicula, y como les dio paja seguir haciendo exclusivamente para el juego, simplemente metieron partes al principio) si sos muy fan o estas medio al pedo el juego esta bueno, pude jugar 13 hs seguidas sin cansarme, pero despues es otra cosa.

entretenido 6/10

review:
Un muy entretenido juego Hack N' Slash, machacabotones del gÃ©nero de Dinasty Warriors y similares, ambientado en el mundo de Berserk. Una buena trama y una duraciÃ³n aceptable de unas 15hs para terminarlo. Luego tiene un monton de misiones adicionales para jugar en el modo interminable.
Recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118637597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1386, 'last_played': 1607600846}
review:
Fan du manga, de l'anime et des beat'm'all ce jeux est pour toi. Une des meilleures adaptations sorties dans le genre. Mieux que Kenshiro ou Luffy Ã  mon sens... AprÃ¨s je ne suis pas objectif Berserk est juste la meilleure Å“uvre graphique du monde Ã  ce jours !
Et le jeux la respecte totalement ! Et les intÃ©gration de l'anime dans le jeux, le son des combats, tout est fait pour replonger le fan dans l'univers torturÃ© de Berserk. Puis j'ai Ã©tÃ© surpris positivement par la durÃ©e de vie et le scÃ©nario qui suit presque jusqu'au dernier chapitre du manga.

author: {'steamid': '76561198929589940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1623417636}
review: The gameplay is basically just spamming the same buttons over and over again, but fighting certain bosses you have to actually think of a strategy to defeat them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060535159', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1614, 'last_played': 1614544134}
review: Cool hack & slash game set in the world of Berserk. However, if you do not like Berserk the gameplay will be extremely boring. This game can also be a way of introducing yourself to Berserk since the entire story is covered in great detail. It does however miss some important parts, so above all else I would recommend that you read Berserk first.

review:
The fact that some idiot seems to think it was a great idea to stop the flow of combat to highlight every tiny thing that happens on the field is just too bloody irritating. 
It happens way too often and makes everything tedious.

I hate this mechanic when overused in ANY type of game. 
Unfortunately, this game too, suffers from it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045439804', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1672007323}
review: Berserk and the Band of the Hawk is mindlessly repetitive, but its combat is still somehow addictive enough to be an enjoyable action game with a dark-fantasy story that stays true to its source, most suitable for fans of Berserk. It even left me craving to try out new characters in Endless Abyss Mode. But it desperately needs more challenge and variety to carry it through its campaign, especially considering you canâ€™t bring a friend with you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117453788', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1593219480}
review:
Me encanta el manga y las ovas. Este juego tiene un buen diseÃ±o visual, mejor que el anime. Pero aun asi tiene errores horribles a la hora de jugar, con poca diferencia de enemigos y con pocos personajes jugables.

Por ejemplo no esta el Caballero Esqueleto, tampoco los de la cuadrilla, entiendo que no pongan a Gaston, pero me habria gustado jugar con Corkas.

Al ser un musou los enemigos son de chiste, pero aun asi esperaba algo mas en el diseÃ±o de estrategia del enemigo. Como minimo que el enemigo tuviera alguna mecanica o pegase. Aun subiendo la dificultad los unicos que veo que atacan de verdad son los jefes, pero aun asi solo les sube el daÃ±o y no el nivel de inteligencia de la IA

Como dije los modelos son geniales y las cinematicas de las OVAS estan muy bien metidas con la historia, despues ponen mas imagen de los modelados para seguir con la historia y aun asi se ve mejor que el ultimo anime que hicieron. Estas cinematicas valen la pena como "la autentica continuacion de Berserk". Yo lo vi por youtube ya que no pude seguir jugando a esto. Realmente estas pobres mecanicas de juego  hacen todo este juego horrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198892185297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 9851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7047, 'last_played': 1601165487}
review:
Sorpresa grata en cuanto a la representaciÃ³n de los personajes, siguiendo una lÃ­nea de diseÃ±o aceptable y relativamente fiel a la obra de Kentaro Miura.
El modo historia es bastante largo y completo y ademÃ¡s incluye la modalidad Endles Eclipse, que se basa en superar principalmente 100 oleadas de enemigos, con sus respectivos elementos desbloqueables. A partir de aquÃ­ continÃºa y son aparentemente infinitas.

Debo destacar algunas cosas que podrÃ­an haber hecho de Ã©ste un juego mejor:

1. Se hecha en falta una mayor gama de personajes, hay un montÃ³n creados, pero solo te permiten manejar a unos pocos. No entiendo porque dan trajes que bÃ¡sicamente repiten al mismo personaje en lugar de incluir mÃ¡s variedad. AdemÃ¡s omiten atuendos que SÃ son importantes.

2. La mecÃ¡nica del juego estÃ¡ bien, aunque a la larga es muy repetitiva.

3. Imperdonable que no haya sido traducido o doblado a mÃ¡s idiomas.

4. No tiene la opciÃ³n de jugar a dobles, aunque esto no resulta estrictamente necesario.

LO PEOR: 
No estÃ¡ doblado ni traducido (sÃ³lo inglÃ©s y japonÃ©s).
Repetitivo.
Pocos personajes.
Algunos enemigos finales resultan tediosos.
Conseguir desbloquear todo puede ser complicado y agotador, requiere muchas horas.

LO MEJOR:
Moderada fidelidad al manga.
El diseÃ±o de personajes.
Poder manejar a Guts y atizar con su espada a diestro y siniestro.
Si eres fan de Berserk te gustarÃ¡.
La banda sonora acompaÃ±a y esta bastante bien realizada.

CONCLUSIÃ“N:
Aunque le faltan mejoras, me parece un buen juego. 

PuntuaciÃ³n: 7/10

Mi consejo: compradlo sÃ³lo si sois muy fans y estÃ¡ rebajado de precio.


____________

Pleasant surprise in terms of the representation of the characters, following an acceptable design line and relatively faithful to the work of Kentaro Miura.
The story mode is quite long and complete and also includes the Endles Eclipse mode, which is based on mainly overcoming 100 waves of enemies, with their respective unlockable elements. From here it continues and they are seemingly endless.

I should highlight a few things that could have made this a better game:

1. A greater range of characters is needed, there are a lot created, but they only allow you to handle a few. I don't understand why they give costumes that basically repeat the same character instead of including more variety. They also omit outfits that ARE important.

2. The gameplay is fine, although it is very repetitive in the long run.

3. Unforgivable that it has not been translated or dubbed into more languages.

4. You do not have the option of playing doubles, although this is not strictly necessary.

WORST:
It is not dubbed or translated (English and Japanese only).
Repetitive.
Few characters.
Some final enemies are tedious.
Getting to unlock everything can be complicated and exhausting, it requires many hours.

THE BEST:
Moderate fidelity to the manga.
Character design.
To be able to handle Guts and hit with his sword left and right.
If you are a Berserk fan you will like it.
The soundtrack accompanies and is quite well done.

CONCLUSION:
Although it lacks improvements, it seems to me a good game.

Score: 7/10

My advice: buy it only if you are very fans and it is discounted in price.
