author: {'steamid': '76561198094589835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2269, 'last_played': 1592372051}
review:
So, I'm not a follower of musou games. I am one of those jerks who likes Devil May Cry 3-5 too much to not be disappointed by the lesser combo depth when I compare stylish-action to musou/warriors games (i think the term "hack-n-slash' can go die in a fire, it makes any game described as such come off of brainlessly repetitive or implicitly badly designed). So, I don't have any precedent in my mind of "what makes a good musou game". But, I do like Berserk. I'm not caught up on the manga (yet), but I am in love with the world, it's themes, characters, and all the delicious violence that will never be as stomach churning as the excessive...*ahem* "grape juice". Capital "R". I 

So, I guess I wanted to answer the question on every "on-the-fence about buying this game" Berserk fan's lips; does it do justice to Berserk? ......Well, yes, but actually, no. 

So, gameplay is what I expected; combos are shallow, but easy to do, so any one can keep themselves entertained by pressing "X" more or less times BEFORE pressing/holding "Y" if one animation gets boring to watch/do. And I really love the animations for Guts' attacks; there is a genuine sense of "weight" that the few musou games I played in the past were lacking, imo. Berserk is a perfect fit for this formula of "hoard-cleaving", buuuuuuut.... because of the precedent of established musou formula, lack of escalation is an issue (the mission where Guts' slays 100 men asks you to slay 1000 with a time limit that they don't tell you). But I get it; if they did severely reduce player kill counts to only a few dozen kills per mission UNTIL the 100-man slayer chapter, it wouldn't feel like a musou game until the Black Swordsman Arc, when sending 1000s of squishy demons to splatter against my mighty iron heap would make sense.

Speaking of Arcs, this game ends when Guts and Co. board the infamous boat, so that's your "now go read the manga, you pleb" cliff-hanger this time. The Golden Age arc uses edited footage from the Golden Age Trilogy of movies, and I do mean edited (as in, "we need to localize in China or we won't profit enough" edited). After that, the game TRIES to play out the scenarios from later arcs, but with Koei-Tecmo's budget/time/game engine restraints painted all over it. Grape Horse is here, yes, but Farnese pulls an Alanis Morisette and put on her fly-paper nipple pasties so her hair would keep her image tasteful while she's topless. I say all this because I do genuinely feel like at least half the people who made this game truly love Berserk, but the other half just saw it as "just another job, just another paycheck". Everyone agreed to make the game "fun enough", but not enough of the studio wanted to exceed "overall, good enough". For a series predominantly about the power of will and determination, it was sad to see. Some of the scenes come off as really genuine and filled with effort towards authenticity despite tech/time/money limits (like the meeting with troll-entrails Slan), but scenes like Grape Horse (and even The Eclipse) can come off as "why'd you put this in if you knew it wasn't gunna work with the conditions you had?". The Eclipse mission could have been SO MUCH BETTER than it turned out to be. It's like listening your favorite band's greatest hits album, but every 3rd song or so, your speakers burst into flames and the snare drum got replaced with the sounds of flatulence. Oh, and people talk about the uh....well, I'm just gunna say the "pots and pan clanking", from a version of Berserk we'd all like to forget, is here. BUT! It's layered in with a ton wet squelches and such, so it's not as bad as you might expect. With so much extra audio chaos to drown it out, it actually does it's job right this time; make it sound like a very large hunk of metal is hitting...stuff. You hear the stuff more than the clank.

Overall, I think this game is fun. Do I think it's a "great" game? No. I think it's a bone being thrown to the mad dogs that are Berserk fans, and while the marrow was VERY tasty, there is still a conspicuous lack of hunger-sating meat. If anything, I recommend buying this game if you want to send the "More Berserk games, please, just better next time" message. I honestly think Berserk could benefit less from a paint-by-numbers musou game, and more from a decently constructed spectacle-action framework (DMC3/4/5, Bayonetta, Metal Gear Rising, like the Japan-only PS2 Berserk title did). Musou tends to go "full-throttle at all times, down-time is for menus", but even DMC3 knew when to put on some quiet time in a stage's progression to raise the tension BEFORE dropping a few dozen demons on our heads or putting a boss right at the end of a dark, bloody hallway. But for now, gameplay-wise, this is the best the west has localized so far. Does it do justice to Berserk's presentation standards from the manga? Fuck no, that's nearly impossible, Moira's artwork and story-telling is too sublimely detailed (the game also doesn't beat the Berserk '97 anime). But if we're gunna get any more Berserk games of ANY kind, we gotta show some interest and engagement. It SUCKS that this is the best we can do for Berserk games right now, cuz it's not setting a very high standard. If you'd rather "no Berserk games at all is better than mediocre Berserk games", don't buy this. The Dark Souls series will probably remain the best Berserk games that aren't actually Berserk for a LONG while. But... 

Does it still feel good to liquefy a crowd of slobbering demons or brain-dead enemy soldiers with a hunk of metal the size of a twin bed? Or to use said "sword" as a pole-vault, using the first ground impact to send a possessed horse airborne, then follow-up the forward momentum to cleave it in two from below?

WHAT KIND OF QUESTIONS ARE THOSE!??!?! WHO ARE YOU!?? WHY ARE ALL OF YOUR LIMBS STILL ATTACHED TO YOUR BODY?!??!! 
GAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975042063', 'num_games_owned': 1001, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1644, 'last_played': 1588589447}
review:
A Musou game is the best way to feel like the hundred man slayer and this does it fine. While the gameplay is repetitive, they sprinkle enough new things in through the main campaign to keep it somewhat exciting. 

The story traverses from the Golden Age arc to the Falcon of the Millennium Empire arc, but it misses a lot of the small moments and nuances from the complete story. This is to be expected for this kind of game though.

So far the best and most complete representation of the manga outside of, well, the manga.

review: If you love the Dynasty/Samurai Warriors games and you love the Berserk anime/manga, then you'll love this game. Full of great bloody action and nostalgia. If you are not a fan of mind-numbing hack-n-slash games, then steer clear.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970761123', 'num_games_owned': 2960, 'num_reviews': 904, 'playtime_forever': 1892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1774, 'last_played': 1681070469}
review:
This is a Dynasty Warriors game but based in the world of Berserk. Back in college, I was an Anime fan and one of my favorite animes was Berserk, and this is a pretty faithful adaptation.

Berserk and the Band of Hawks follows the main character Guts on his adventure and itâ€™s a great story. This game made me realize how different Berserk is in tone through. The first half of the game focuses on the Band of Hawks, and you have a very Dynasty Warrior-esque game with a focus on knights and mercenaries. There are a few odd moments, but the cutscenes are taken straight from the OVAs. Sadly those cutscenes run out about the time of the Eclipse, if you know what I mean, if notâ€¦ itâ€™s a turning point of the series, and when the OVAs stopped. At the same time, the game starts to go downhill.

After the eclipse, the story starts to focus on demons as fans of the manga will know. This is a very tonally different part of the game but works well even if itâ€™s a dark turn. However, the quality also feels like it dips and there are just so many levels as you probably expected from a Dynasty Warriors theme. The first half feels well-paced, but the second half of the game is extremely grindy, and probably could have had fewer levels. I beat the game in about 30 hours, thereâ€™s an endless eclipse mode as well that has even more content that I dived into. Thereâ€™s a lot here as you would expect from Dynasty Warrior games.

If youâ€™re a fan of hack and slash games, or Berserk, in general, thereâ€™s no question, you should probably play this game, if you arenâ€™t a fan of the anime, I donâ€™t know if itâ€™s going to be as good, but unlike Dynasty Warriors, there at least is a reason that Guts from Berserk can kill thousands of enemies before them. Heâ€™s quite a badass.

Video Review: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GcbYDD6ISYE&t=612s

author: {'steamid': '76561198379483370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 7080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1649162647}
review:
Berserk and the Band of Hawk:

PREMESSA: questa sarÃ  una recensione molto diversa rispetto alle precedenti che ho fatto. ValuterÃ² non solo il gioco ma anche il manga e l'anime perchÃ¨ serve a far capire se questo tipo di gioco Ã¨ adatto oppure no alla gente.

Berserk Ã¨ un manga creato da Kentaro Miura dal 1989 ed Ã¨ tutt'ora in corso.

Mini-Trama con Spoiler: Narra la storia di Guts, da mercenario che, nella saga Epoca D'Oro, si unisce alla Squadra dei Falchi dove conoscerÃ  Griffith, Casca e gli altri componenti fino a diventare il famoso Guerriero Nero in cerca di vendetta contro gli Apostoli e la Mano di Dio, in particolare contro [spoiler]Griffith (diventato Phemt per aver sacrificato i suoi compagni e anche Casca e Guts stesso, unici sopravvissuti alla Eclissi).[/spoiler]

Da questa opera, oltre al manga, sono state realizzate 2 serie anime: la prima del 1997 narra le vicende dell'epoca d'oro fino alla eclissi mentre la seconda serie anime del 2016-2017 composta da 2 stagioni, narra le vicende successive ovvero la saga della condanna fino ai primi capitoli del falco millenario. Ci sono anche 3 film che sono un riassunto della serie del 1997 con una nuova grafica.
Personalmente per iniziare Berserk consiglio la lettura obbligatoria del manga perchÃ¨ purtroppo gli adattamenti dei 3 film e delle serie anime non sono fedeli al 100% all'opera e sarÃ  difficile comprendere certe parti. Il manga Ã¨ molto piÃ¹ crudo e profondo (adatto ad un pubblico adulto) e vengono spiegate certe scene che nella animazione hanno deciso di tagliare: ad esempio la parte piÃ¹ fondamentale dell'infanzia di Guts (che Ã¨ importantissima per comprendere il carattere del personaggio) e molte altre parti. Per quanto riguarda l'animazione consiglio di vedere Berserk in questo ordine:
- Serie 1997, i 3 film e poi la serie 2016-2017 (ovviamente questo Ã¨ da fare dopo aver letto il manga).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Adesso andiamo al gioco:
La grafica ragazzi la trovo davvero bella ed Ã¨ una CGI degna: chi dice il contrario non ha visto la serie del 2016-2017 che li la CGI fa davvero pena purtroppo. La colonna sonora nulla da dire, sempre eccezionale come le serie anime e i 3 film. La modalitÃ  di gioco puÃ² non piacere a tutti perchÃ¨ Ã¨ un musou ovvero un gioco picchiaduro a missioni e quindi non Ã¨ un openworld o un gioco d'esplorazione ma ritengo che Ã¨ giusto in Berserk il genere musou proprio perchÃ¨ in questa opera la "legge dell'uccidere" Ã¨ sempre presente in ogni tavola del manga. Il gioco Ã¨ solo in 2 lingue: il giapponese e sottotitoli in inglese (quindi niente italiano). Un punto a favore che ho apprezzato moltissimo di questo videogioco e che farÃ  molto piacere ai fan di Berserk e anche a chi si cimenta per la prima volta in questa storia dopo aver letto l'opera, Ã¨ la fedeltÃ  con il manga: ci sono tutte le parti del manga che sono state tagliate nelle versioni animate e ciÃ² lo rende quasi completo (dico cosÃ­ perchÃ¨ purtroppo ancora non Ã¨ conclusa questa storia).

Beh che altro dire? Consiglio il gioco agli amanti di Berserk e a chi piace il genere musou e anche a chi ha avuto una brutta giornata e vuole sfogarsi nell'uccidere i nemici (Ã¨ un'antistress questo gioco per me oltre al fatto che ritengo Berserk un capolavoro xD).

Un'ultima cosa: preparatevi ad essere SACRIFICATI e a sfogare la vostra modalitÃ  BERSERKER che Ã¨ in voi!!

- AGGIORNAMENTO 25 MAGGIO 2021 -
Come avrete saputo purtroppo, il 6 Maggio del 2021, Miura Ã¨ morto. Ancora non si sa se l'opera verrÃ  continuata oppure resterÃ  ferma al capitolo 363. Ãˆ stato un duro colpo per tutti i fan dell'opera e del mondo dei manga. Per omaggiare il maestro, consiglio assolutamente di giocare a questo gioco e di conoscere il manga di Berserk perchÃ¨ tutti dovrebbero scoprire questo IMMORTALE CAPOLAVORO (che rimanga incompleto oppure che venga completato, rimarrÃ  sempre LEGGENDA).
PS: oltre a Berserk and the Band of Hawk, giocate anche alla trilogia dei Dark Souls e tutti i giochi della From Software: omaggiate Kentaro Miura!
Al Maestro: che possa insegnare a tutti in cielo a creare capolavori come ha fatto nella vita terrena: grazie per averci fatto conoscere Berserk!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091999319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2247, 'last_played': 1594000635}
review:
El juego es bueno, a mi me gusto, aunque tiene unos grandes defectos. dirÃ© que aspectos me gustaron y no me gustaron.

Aspectos buenos.
1. El simple hecho de que usas a guts y blandir la dragon slayer, ufff se siente genial.
2. La cantidad de personajes que se pueden usar.
2. puede que el combate no sea muy variado, y te limites a solo usar dos botones, pero al menos guts es el que puede variar un poco mas. dejando ese aspecto de lado, se mira bien como es que cada uno pelea, me refiero a que todos hacen movimientos diferentes, guts matando enemigos dentro de un radio considerable, casca saltando por los aires tan hÃ¡bil como siempre, judeo con las armas arrojadizas, griffith atacado tan de una manera muy rapida, etc. cada uno fue muy bien echo con los movimientos que le corresponden.
3. El arco de la edad de oro, esta bastante bien, usaron fragmentos de la pelÃ­cula, se saltan algunas cosas pero esta decente para ser un juego..
4. conforme avanzas en la trama, en el modo historia, antes de ir ala batalla , puedes ver como guts (segun en la parte de la historia en la que te encuentras) esta entrenando o con con la banda de de los halcones, puede que no  y eso va cambiando, puede que no sea un detalle grande pero a mi me pareciÃ³ uno muy bueno.
5. despuÃ©s de la edad de oro ya no hay parte de la pelÃ­cula que puedan mostrar, haciendo que los desarrolladores hicieran algunas cinemÃ¡ticas   (fueron pocas) que son  buenas, y es una lastima que teniendo el potencial para adaptar (porque lo demostraron en algunas partes) no lo hicieran.
6. Lo que es el modo eclipse esta bueno para pasar el rato, hay que pasarlo con cada personaje para desbloquear algunas cosas que faltan, pero es un dolor enfrentarse a griffith, solo con guts es medio fÃ¡cil o aceptable.
7. Esta schierke.

Cosas que no me gustaron.
1. la historia despuÃ©s de la edad de oro, da lastima, no adaptaron muchas cosas, como la primera vez que guts se encuentra con la mano de dios,  la pelea con los batos que ayudan muzgus, la pelea con la cabra loca (cuando atrapan a casca para quemrla), la pelea con loa ayudantes de muzgus, etc.
2. TambiÃ©n se salaron muchos personajes, a unos de los comandantes que esta con serpico y farnaze (no me acuedo en nombre xd), las que ayudan a guts a rescatar a casca de muzgus(tapoco me acuerdo alv), el ayudante de ganishka.
3. Este se desglosa de la segunda razÃ³n, ya que a falta de personajes, hay partes que el dialogo lo cambian y pos la carlitos con eso.
4. Las habilidades secundarias casi no sirven de nada, solo las curas llegan a ser 
Ãºtiles pero en el modo eclipse.
5. Los caballos sirven pero poco, y si piensas comprar el dlc, te sugiero que no, la menos que quieras unos bonitos, porque el Ãºnico que esta chulo es el de el caballero calavera.

para terminar dejo unos datos adicionales que pueden o no tomar en cuenta.
1. schierke es la mas difÃ­cil de usar, pero es la que mas me encanta sus movimientos
2. el oro para lo Ãºnico que realmente sirve es para subir de nivel a los demÃ¡s personajes.
3. el crafteo  de objetos sirve casi solo en el modo eclipse, porque necesitas llegar a topar casi todo si quieres vencer a griffith, hay objetos que te ayudan mas que otros, asÃ­ que si te tomas el tiempo para ver que pex con ellos mejor.
4. Lo que es la historia abarca solo lo que es guts, no nada de falconia y de rickett, solo guts, ojo con eso.
5. El juego lo recomiendo si y solo si, esta esta en descuento (que es una cosa rarisima que este en descuento ( Lo compre por 24), y solo comprarlo si eres realmente fan del manga y quieras sentirte como guts y usar la  armadura berserk que esta suculenta.
6. Los grÃ¡ficos puede que no sea lo mejor cuando los miras de cerca, pero cuando los miras de lejos esta bien (a mi no me impuso algo grave).  
7. Los enemigos son repetitivos? si, depende de como lo mires, en una misma pantalla, todos son iguales, pero entre escenarios son diferentes.
En fin ta bueno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332929847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1587254775}
review:
This is a very bad game if I could I would get my money back.

Every mission plays the same after the first. 

The gameplay never evolves and cut scenes were ripped from the movies. This game feels like a tedious chore where you must repeat the same action over and over. if you know the berserk ark just skip this game altogether. very few enjoyments to be found here outside the cutscenes from the films.   

If you are a dynasty warrior fan or Musou games fan dynasty warriors 8 extreme legends is still the best one in my humble opinion. and berserk fans are better or just reading the manga or watching the anime/films.  

Graphics- mediocre
sound- decent
Gameplay - dull, repetitive, boring.
Story - good but nothing new that it adds to the story if you are a fan and many important part and arcs were skipped. 
I would Rate this at  (4/10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198048427327', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 6906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4165, 'last_played': 1631821657}
review: This is not the best musou, but defenetly awesome BERSERK game. The main campaign contains the plot of the original manga from the 1st to the 32nd volumes, focusing on the main action events with Guts. You can play for 8 characters with unique skills, including Guts in the Berserk armor and two apostles: Zodd and Wyald, who can transform in battles. There is also a system of accessories with enhancement / fusion and an endless dungeon with "what if" events. This is a great and exciting adventure, especially for Berserk fans. Definitely worth the time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146984766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1585679999}
review:
7/10 - A rock solid Musou and an amazing tribute to Berserk that, like the manga, starts to fall apart as you get further in and is sadly unfinished. Full review below.

= Intro =Â 

I'm a huge Berserk nerd. It's essentially the manga that made me like manga. I own basically every Berserk game and so decided to pick this up, after DOOM: Eternal bored me stiff.

= Gameplay =Â 

For those unfamiliar with Musou games, it's a third person action game focused on the power fantasy of tearing through hundreds of enemies as an extremely powerful individual, while fighting alongside your own army of troops. Musou games have evolved quite a bit since the Dynasty Warrior stage, and this is no exception, with a solid random item drop system and crafting.

The roster on offer here is a bit thinner than other Musou titles, but it makes up for this by giving each playable character a fairly unique and well realized playstyle. Whether you are swinging Gatsu's mighty sword around or zipping about as Griffith or Judea, or turning into a huge flying Minotaur as Zodd, fans of the manga are going to have a ball here.

Combat is incredibly satisfying, although the difficulty rises and falls quite weirdly from mission to mission. Carving through enemies is pretty easy as long as you stay mobile, on anything but Berserk difficulty but the huge Apostle bosses can be extremely challenging, especially since they are prone to chaining knockbacks and stuns into you.

That said, there is a lot to like here. Especially in terms of the drop system and crafting and the Endless Eclipse mode, a whopping 100+ level campaign with a wide variety of missions and entertaining NPC interactions. Good stuff.

= Graphics and Audio =
Visually this game is decent, for a Musou. I'd highly recommend using Reshade to pump up the saturation and contrast though, as the game can look a little washed out.

Audio is solid, with meaty thwacks and splats punctuating the action.

That said, it isn't going to blow your socks off.

= Style =

The story follows the manga quite accurately, at least for the first half or so (more about this below) - it's a 'dark fantasy' story of friendship, betrayal, loss, vengeance and redemption that really is a modern classic.

A lot of work has gone into this in terms of fanservice. Basically every enemy from the first half of the manga gets represented, including a certain infamous horse...

However, this is very much two different games. The Golden Age arc is incredibly detailed, with even minor fights or excursions getting re-imagined as epic, multi-mission battles, punctuated by lengthy portions of the recent anime adaptation of the same.

After this though, things taper off fast. Cinematics are handled with the in-game engine (ugh...) and far less attention to detail is made - entire epic arcs, like the Count, Griffith's resurrection and Vritannis Harbor are handled with a single mission and other arcs, like the Lost Children are completely omitted. And yes, this means that certain characters you may have been looking forward to playing aren't even in the game, or aren't playable. No Locus, no Irvine, no Rosine etc. Others are relegated to meh once off boss fights, like Mozguz and the Emperor.Â 

The game also abruptly ends at Vritannis Harbor, which is literally just before the biggest and most insanely epic fight in the manga. Despite the length and decent quality of the campaign mode...this was pretty disappointing.

= Value =Â 

Even at full price, there is a *lot* of game here. Aside from the decent campaign, you have plenty to do on replays of missions, whether it be chasing side objectives for gallery art or beating it on a higher difficulty, or as a different character.Â 

The Endless Eclipse mode will provide so much additional endgame content that you are unlikely to ever experience all of it.

That said, like a lot of Musous and ARPGs, this does get a bit repetitive - although item hunting does help here.

= Overall =Â 

+ Nicely varied roster.
+ Interesting loot and crafting system.
+ Wonderful combat.
+ Really captures the feel of the manga (at least the first half).
+ Absolutely tons of content to enjoy.

- Noticeable slip in quality in the second half of the game.
- Bosses are jarringly difficult compared to the rest of the game.
- Does get same-y.
- A ton of cool characters/arcs from the manga are omitted/glossed over.

At the end of the day, this is a quality Musou from the Musou experts. It's not perfect, but as far as fanservice adaptations of popular manga goes...it's way better than most.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277876507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2452, 'last_played': 1584752912}
review: This game has been super fun, I have enjoyed cutting through crowds of enemy's and playing as multiple characters in the berserk universe. Definitely would recommend the game to anyone but it would help if you were already a berserk fan considering you don't get a complete story because of the fact that the manga isn't even done. The story is definitely a great one, my only hope is that it gets finished before I die considering I've been a fan my whole life basically but if you love berserk the way I do then you'll love this game and fighting the enemy's it has to offer with dragon slayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994888758', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1663533278}
review:
I've recently started reading the manga after watching the Golden Age Arc movies. Knowing the gameplay of Dynasty Warriors, a Berserk spin-off caught my attention. I personally find this game a lot of fun, yes the combat is repetitive but I find it really enjoyable fighting thousands of enemies every mission and just swatting them all away in a fit of rage. As my friend call is "Yeah. this is murder porn"

Story-wise, it covers a lot of story arcs, more than I thought it would. If you're a fan of the manga/anime and want to play as Guts (and others) just mowing down a ton of enemies, you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120413071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1584484468}
review:
If you have played any KOEI warriors games, you will know what to expect. This is far more narrative driven, and while I had no previous knowledge of the "Beserk" manga, this game actually made me want to get into it. I loved the character progression through the stories tale. A warrior with bloodlust is perfect for a hoard/hack and slash game. 

I would highly recommend this one sale, as this is when I bought it. The amount of characters/options is limited, but the campaign is a good 15+ hours. Uses a combination of nice animated cut scenes to in game things. This on top of some of the weirdest monster/character design I have seen in a while.

Performance wise, I experienced little to no hitch on max with 59+ FPS, with massive body counts/blood etc. If my only complaint, it would be to uncap the FPS so the slight frame drop might be less note able. Graphically I had no complaints, as it looked almost like a painting as blood and monsters fly across the screen. 

This is one of the better Musou games. I can highly recommend to experience it if that peaks your interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164654175', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1140, 'last_played': 1585418800}
review: To be completely honest this game isn't good. Its extremely repetitive, and at times boring. But why have 100% completed the game? Well Berserk has got to be my favourite piece of fiction ever. So in other words the source material carried it for me. I have read that this is basically a Dynasty Warriors game, I wouldn't know i haven't played any Dynasty Warriors game. If you want a berserk game this is pretty much the only one there is which is a shame, unless you want to emulate the ps2 or dreamcast games or pretend the Dark Souls games are Berserk games. 4/10 only giving it a positive review due to the source material.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978165338', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1586012414}
review:
It's a musou game in the Berserk world. If you like this kind of game and Berserk, you will like this one. The game is graphically beatiful, very fun and well done

At first I had a really hard time trying to get this game to work. The first time I ran, it got stuck in a black screen after the initial splash screens. What fixed for me was playing the game in window mode, disabling movies, changing the compatibility mode to windows 7 and forcing my video card to use the dedicated video card instead of the integrated one. Only then I was able to start the game properly. 
After all that, I played a little bit with these settings and then, from inside the game, I changed it to full screen enabling the movies back on. 

So far the game now starts properly and I'm having a blast playing it

review:
Wish I didn't buy this piece of trash because I craved something Berserk with the Manga's infinite hiatuses and the terrible anime adaptations (2016-2017).

DON'T BUY STAY. AWAY. Don't buy Musou games on Steam, download an emulator and play your warrior games on PC. 

Don't despair friends, Dark Horse studio (who publishes Berserk here in the West) has made a deal with Netflix. So maybe a new adaptation is coming for us !

review:
It's got "3" game modes

Story mode 
which is pointless since you might as well read the manga for a better experience, no point in replaying since it's just the same exact order of objectives

Free Mode
Remove the story from story mode.

Endless Eclipse

author: {'steamid': '76561197977940977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2624, 'last_played': 1701278058}
review:
Quick disclaimer: this is not a deep game. The mechanics are extremely simple (hack and slash), the *character* level up system is literally just prescribed level ups based on EXP without any say in what attributes are raised. 

With that out of the way,  As a huge Berserk fan, I love this game. If I weren't, I'd pass on this one. For fans of the series, however, I think it's enjoyable to play through all the scenarios and play as all the various characters. If you're into Dynasty Warriors and the like as well as Berserk, I think you'll find it worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998739037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1663255576}
review:
It is very poorly optimized and essentially unplayable without a controller. While they have technically made it possible to do so, enjoy remapping every key and manually controllling camera angles via keyboard.

Past that - the game runs... Badly. Enough that it seems to absolutely require tinkering with multiple settings and compatibility modes to make the game reasonably playable. I've spent exponentially more time attempting to get it to run in the way it SHOULD out of the box than I have playing, see other reviews for story considerations but I would NOT purchase this had I known that this was what I was being set up for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042625244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1578246808}
review:
I haven't finished the game, but as a fan of Berserk this is a fun and easily consumable way of learning the story (No replacement for the manga but still). The only real complaint I have is that it's difficulties are too vast. The difference between hard and berserk is cackling while you slice away at enemies without a care, and dying in three seconds to randos. Wish I had more of an in between.

TLDR: IF you like berserk, brutal spectacle, or the Dynasty Warriors franchise, this is a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317900943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1625, 'last_played': 1654905948}
review: For fans of hack and slash games, this is a pretty fun title. It is also quite true to the original manga story. The only reason I don't recommend this game is that it crashes. In my experience, it is not possible to play more than three missions without it crashing. Most of these crashes occur just when a mission ends. It is extremely frustrating to play a mission for 20 or 30 minutes and then the game crashes during the closing animation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007706278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2094, 'last_played': 1624303040}
review:
It's one of the better hack and slash games from Koei. I've been playing them since DW3. Just here to counterbalance the negative reviews of people who bought a type of game they knew they wouldn't like before playing. 

PROS:
Audio/Visual experience of cleaving crowds of enemies in half. the clanging of Gut's sword and the mist of blood never gets old.

Lengthy story mode with lots of special missions in addition to standard exhibition mode

Characters all feel different. not every hack and slash needs 40 characters. the more characters, the less they stand out. This game does not have that problem at all

CONS:

The AI is sometimes annoying. performing your musou and an ally officer rides his horse into you pushing you away from your enemy.

Overall:
100% worth buying if its on sale, if you love Berserk, and you're a fan of musou games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345209539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1781, 'last_played': 1704350125}
review:
Musou Berserk reskin, i would not recommend this to anyone unless you are a extreme Berserk fan and even then i would wait for a sale. Past the first maybe hour or two it becomes a chore to play as its just the same thing over and over again.

The only good thing is it provides clips from the movies and better animation and looks then the garbage that is Berserk 2016/17

If you want to play a berserk game play the ps2 berserk game as its boss fights are pretty legendary

author: {'steamid': '76561198098253988', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1575656188}
review:
As much as I love berserk I simply cannot recommend this game. My reasoning:

1) The game is literally just mindless grinding.
2) User interface and keyboard controls are a mess.
3) Huge performance issues (6 core i7/32GB RAM/GTX1660ti) game is barely playable on low settings 1280x720.

Save yourself $$$ and watch anime - or read manga instead.

review: Excelente Game, principalmente para fÃ£s da serie. vale a pena. estilo hack slash. com mapas que tem objetivos. desafios fracos afinal o Guts Ã© muito forte desde o comeÃ§o mas por ser BERSERK, a gente ja sabe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075317968', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 3367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1860, 'last_played': 1668399014}
review:
In this world, is the destiny of mankind controlled by some transcendental entity or law?
(Unless you really like Berserk, don't get this)

* Pros
+ You get to play as a lot of the Berserk cast, though I wish they would of included a little more (I really wish you could play as Skull Knight)
+ Sound design is great
+ The actual animated cutscenes are pretty good and nice to see the manga come to life
+ It feels great to annihilate tons of enemies with Guts
+ You get to play as Guts in the Berserker Armor, and yes it is amazing
+ The story covers almost everything right up until Guts and crew get on the boat

* Cons
- Majority of cutscenes are from the 2012 Golden Age Arc movies (The movies are great don't get me wrong, but I feel like they should have done all of the cutscenes themselves)
- It gets very repetitive very quickly
- Missions don't have many "objectives" and they are very linear as well
- Almost all the objectives are "go here, kill this"
- Bosses are a joke except some of the Apostles
- Majority of gameplay boils down to you mashing a couple buttons over and over again
- The game barely ever goes on sale, it's definitely not worth $60 or even $30

Overall: 5/10 Average

Must Have? | Buy? | Wait for Sale? | Don't Buy This?
[Wait for Sale]

author: {'steamid': '76561198220267892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1138, 'last_played': 1555602585}
review:
Berserk one of the best anime there is which has a great story line with great action and twists. The game that is based on the story is true to the manga, the game follows a hack and slash mechanism which people can enjoy. If you are a fan of the series you can get this game and enjoy what this game provides you.

Pros:
- Fairly follows the story line of the manga / anime
- Decent graphics
- Fun to play the first time around

Cons:
- Repetitive game play with horde of monsters coming at you
- Gets boring after a while where you do the same thing over and over again with different monsters in different levels
- 10+ hours of repetitive game play

Thought the game might seem boring but can be enjoyed by the fans of the series for which i  would recommend getting this game. I do not see any worth in investing in DLC.

Final Verdict:
Fans must buy to enjoy the series in hack and slash action.

review:
Remember that scene at the beginning of LotR where Sauron is smacking dudes around with a mace and you cringed? It's basically like that, but you're a dude with a mood who has a 2 meter buster sword.

If you're a fan of Berserk or Dynasty Warriors you should be fine. Totally worth it on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064654416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1575494622}
review:
Assuming you like hack and slash, the game is good. You don't need to know the manga / anime to enjoy it, as the story mode retraces most of the manga's story.

The good:
* The story mode does a very good job waving its tale, and the anime parts are very high quality except for some 3D renders of the apostles. The cinematics using the game's engine are decent though there are a few lip sync problems.
* Though you have some options to personalize your character, unlike Dynasty Warrior, you don't need to spend your time micromanaging your inventory.
* The gore and the fighting styles make this feel more realistic and gritty than Dynasty Warrior (though that could be a bad point as well depending on what you are looking for)

The bad:
* There is no multiplayer, though quite a few stages of the story mode could have accomodated it.
* There are very few parts of the story mode where you can use another character than Guts. So although you see all these characters on the character selection screen, they are really relegated to the endless eclipse or the free mode. Again, there were many stages where you could have used another character.
* The commands are slightly less responsive than Dynasty Warrior's, making it a bit harder to trigger your combos and to dodge attacks (which is a lot more important than in Dynasty Warrior). Also the lock on feature creates some really weird scenes where Guts totally misses an enemy with his sword but said enemy ends up impaled on the sword anyway.
* There are tons of different ennemies (way more than in Dynasty Warriors), but most of them act exactly the same.

The ugly:
The boss fights are awful. Basically the bosses have tons of hp, interrupt most of your attacks and are immune to most control effects like stun. So either you run to their blind spot, hit them once or twice and run away, which will take forever, or you use a really cheesy and anticlimatic way to win fights. You end up spending most of your time running away from the boss to farm his unending wave of minions, turning back to unleashe a death attack (musou), then rinse and repeat. There is hardly anything heroic about these fights, which is really disappointing. The fight against Femto was probably the most boring bossfight I ever had in a videogame...

author: {'steamid': '76561197990807396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1573072302}
review:
It's basically a dynasty warriors game with Berserk so yeah... If you like either or both it's probably gonna come across as a solid 8/10 Would recommend for a 50% off sale purchase

Now sadly it does end at the start of the set sail to elfhelm arc so there is actually less story then the 2 seasons of the newest anime covered... but it does a faithful job of actually telling most of the story from berserk up to there; minus a few of the more horrific story additions.  

Lets be honest the MC of Berserk is a perfect Dynasty Warrior style game character because he actually does cut up a ton of his enemies and people notice and its not just some rando dude killing 1000+ people on the battlefield and the leader popping up like to say some nonsense like "oh you work hard!" so it fits the style of the black swordman to be running around murderballing peeps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145787196', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1953, 'last_played': 1680979767}
review:
I love the Berserk series, so bare that in mind while reading this review. The storytelling in this game, is immersive, and in some ways more complete than any of the other outlets the story is told. I would recommend this game to any fan of the Berserk series.

Characters you can play
-Guts
-Griffith
-Casca
-Judeau
-Serpico
-Schierke
-Zodd

author: {'steamid': '76561198110961045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1588566382}
review:
Un muy buen juego, no lo puedo comparar con otros musou ya que es el primer juego de este gÃ©nero que pruebo, de momento no tengo problemas con compatibilidad o semejantes asÃ­ que como port de ps4 es muy bueno

Ahora como representaciÃ³n de la obra de Miura, es un buen reflejo, pero no el mejor, la parte de la edad dorada cuenta con cinemÃ¡ticas de las pelÃ­culas del 2012-2013 que fueron buenas interpretaciones, pero estÃ¡n por debajo de lo que la serie del 96 logro en su momento. Lo que el juego hace es mostrar escenas que en las pelÃ­culas no mostraron como la plÃ¡tica entre Gust y Griffith mientras toma un baÃ±o o la de Caska sobre los sueÃ±os de los integrantes de la banda etc.

Cuenta con censura ya que la obra tampoco se presta para dar la impresiÃ³n por su contenido grafico hasta cierto punto, pero aun asÃ­ lo considero un buen representante del manga.

En conclusiÃ³n, con lo que llevo de juego me deja satisfecho como representante del manga y como juego en mecÃ¡nicas. Lo recomiendo para un fan que conozca sobre la obra y pueda entender referencias que en ocasiones solo se dan en algunos eventos o comentarios durante el juego y para las personas que les gusta este gÃ©nero y quieren probar este juego por la historia les recomiendo leer el manga despuÃ©s de acabar el juego solo para entender algunos puntos que el juego puede dejar al aire

En fin, lo recomiendo, buen juego

author: {'steamid': '76561198421029715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1245, 'last_played': 1604430031}
review:
This game is pretty mediocre, so buy it only if you're a Berserk fan. Some bits are enjoyable, but most of the time it's just too easy and repetitive.
I still recommend it tho cause graphics are nice and there's much more content than I expected. Also, it's our only option to play as Guts - unless you cosplay him on Dark Souls lol

Final verdict:
6/10 (as a Berserk fan)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037697225', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1573135087}
review:
[h1] Are you a fan of [i] Berserk? [/i] If so, this is without a doubt the best way to take in this story, second only to Kentaro Miura's [b] absolutely phenomenal manga [/b] [/h1]

This review is a pretty big one for me. I did myself the service of getting stuck into the [i] Berserk [/i] manga this year, and it is [b] hands down the best manga I've ever read! [/b] I managed to clear 250 issues/chapters of [i] Berserk [/i] in something ridiculous like two weeks, and I found myself wanting for some additional way to immerse myself in this incredibly compelling and dark world. This narrative. This art style. This tone. This is where dark fantasy, the likes of which is seen in [i] Dark Souls, [/i] originates. 

It's such a pity that Kentaro Miura's exceptional manga was done such a disservice as far as anime adaptations go. As a side-rant, I wish an animation studio like [i] MAPPA [/i] or [i] Madhouse [/i]  would pick up this narrative and give it a fresh coat of (non-CGI) paint (some other good studios unfortunately wouldn't do this narrative justice as they'd pussyfoot around the darker, more violent and sexual, beats here). That said, I'm convinced nothing can be quite as affecting as Muira's manga... though this game comes pretty close. I'll do what I can not to spoil [i] Berserk [/i] for the uninitiated here, but this game does a fantastic job of the three-part [i] Golden Age [/i] arc, further developing the bonds in the [i] Band of the Hawk [/i] with some additional dialogue and in-engine cutscenes - if you've read the manga, you know why this is pretty heartwrenching. The rest of the work is done through snippets of the [i] Golden Age [/i] and [i] Advent [/i] movies, where the animation and art quality is quite varied, but gets the job done.

[b] Lets get to gameplay. [/b]
Have you played a [i] Koei Tecmo [/i] 'Warriors' game? It's pretty much just that. The combat system is far from complex and technical, but HOT DAMN does mowing down hordes of enemies with Guts' giant swords feel satisfying! I've only just finished the 'Eclipse', so I've still got a lot more playtime ahead of me, but though far from technical, I've found this pretty simplistic combat quite addicting. There is a bit of a narratively fitting difficulty spike with the eclipse, though things return to normal quite soon thereafter. This game obviously won't be for everyone - I know that [i] Koei Tecmo's [/i] 'Warriors' games are quite divisive, and with a different coat of paint/narrative, I probably wouldn't be as invested and I'd have had my fill... That said, knowing what's coming, knowing what trials Guts still has to face, I'm practically salivating and will no doubt get stuck back into this game as soon as this review is written.

[h1] TL;DR
Are you a fan of [i] Berserk? [/i] Alternatively, are you a fan of [i] Koei Tecmo's [/i] 'Warriors' games? If so, this is a no-brainer:
[b] Pick. This. Game. Up. [/b] [/h1]
.
.
.
.
.
[h1] Having completed the story campaign, I think it's time for a wee review update: [/h1]

[b] The first thing I wish to stress here is that, although some of my updated thoughts on this title are a little negative, my original impression of [i] BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk [/i] still holds true: if you're a fan of this manga, I would HIGHLY recommend picking this game up! [/b]

That being said... as the stakes ratchet up in the latter arcs of [i] Berserk, [/i] this game struggles to deliver the same epic encounters and boss fights that keep one's eyes glued to each and every page of Miura's manga. [i] BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk [/i] is a musou game through and through. It is at its best when you're mowing down thousands of enemies, but as the manga's story progresses and more of your encounters move away from [i] mercenaries, soldiers, lesser spirits, and familiars, [/i] and into the realm of [b] [i] EPIC HUGE APOSTLES AND THE GOD HAND, [/i] [/b] this game [u] unfortunately starts to drop the ball quite a bit. [/u]

Some minor spoilers ahead, though I'll keep it vague (get ready for loads of proper nouns):

[spoiler] The game concludes with the [i] Falcon of The Millennium Empire [/i] arc. Lets first get some positives out of the way: The fight with the Ogre and Kelpie in [i] Enoch Village [/i] is AWESOME! [i] Serpico [/i] and [i] Schierke [/i] are a lot of fun to play (the latter a little less so), and the [i] Berserker armour [/i] is a bloody BLAST! In addition to this, your fight with [i] Grunbeld [/i] - the fire dragon apostle - is pretty damn great. 

This is kinda where the positives end. Your encounter with [i] Slan - one of the God Hand - [/i] is rubbish, easy, and severely lacks the tension from the manga. Though this pales in comparison to the next big transgression:  if you've read the manga, you - like me - were no doubt salivating for [i] Guts' [/i] fight with  the sorcerer [i] Daiba [/i] and his master [i] Ganishka [/i] in [i] Vritannis. [/i] Well, here's some warning in advance: [b] seriously temper your expectations. [/b] You don't fight [i] Daiba [/i] and the encounter with [i] Ganishka [/i] - [b] THE FINAL BOSS OF THE GAME [/b] - is seriously anticlimactic. [/spoiler]

Do I still recommend this game? 
[b] HELL YEAH! [/b] 
I'm currently having a blast playing through the [i] Endless Eclipse [/i] mode. The core gameplay loop here has got me hooked. That said, much like with another [i] Koei Tecmo [/i] anime-based game that I love - [i] Attack on Titan [/i] - I really hope we get a sequel that improves upon the basis this title has set up. 
[h1] Fingers crossed [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198151829806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3171, 'last_played': 1584636752}
review:
If you are a huge Berserk fan and you want to buy this game i am sorry to say that this isnt the game for you, I will admit however, that the cut scenes are alright and it follows the Berserk story fairly well although every level is essentially the same, all you do is slice down thousands of guys with very simplistic combos, it just gets downright boring. This game clearly was just rushed out hoping to get any Berserk fan to buy it, all in all the levels suck and there are very few elements to the game that make you want to play more.

(Edit).
For all those upset at me for not liking musou games, tough shit you like a shitty genre. simplistic levels and goals is a boring way to play a game. Anyway, this review is mostly meant for Berserk fans, as this game does not do the story much justice. for all the musou game fans go ahead waste your money idc, the style of games sucks, its not even close to a good fit for berserk, which should aim to tell a story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022126858', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2288, 'last_played': 1569680347}
review:
This is a musou, in other words a Dynasty Warriors style game. Although I haven't played any of these games before, I can say that it fits the source material well. You slash your weapon at tens of enemies sending them flying with each hit. It is pretty fun and satisfying. Although the basic game loop might get boring for some, for me the objectives during missions and the story got me hooked.

This game is based of off the manga called Berserk. Apparently, it was also adapted to anime of which the game uses as cutscenes in some parts. I heard of it before that there were several references to that in Dark Souls games and I could see them clearly when I played. This game is not like Dark Souls though.

The game looks beautiful with a cell-shaded-like anime art and animated nicely. I love the music too. The combat has a combo system which unlocks new combos as you level up. It also has more than 5 characters to play as but you need to finish a level first with the main character, Guts, to be able to play them with the alternate characters. And I'm not talking about reskins. All characters are very distinct, separate characters with different attacks and combos. You can even unlock evil characters to play as. You can also fight on your horse and call your horse any time as well if you need it. The game has controller support. I played it with a Xbox controller throughout without problems.

The combat might look daunting at first the way the hordes of enemies rushing to you but as you experiment with different combos, you find a few of the combos might work better for you. Like most Japanese action games Guts - the main character - is a badass and it feels great to play as him. I basically used 2-3 combos with Guts till the end. As you rend through enemies, your rage metre fills up and you can activate your rage giving you faster actions and a new metre that fills up as you fight which lets you activate your Death Blow. Death Blow is the ultimate move and evaporates everything in sight barring the bosses or commander type enemies if they are strong enough. There are also boss battles.

The levels don't take too long depending on the objectives you want to achieve. Usually there are several side objectives in each level but otherwise they can be a breeze. Some levels can be completed under 3 minutes. If you didn't do a side quest, you can replay that level but you can't quit the level after doing the said quest, you need to play to the end of the mission. Fortunately though you don't have to redo the other side quests you already did again. After you beat a level, sometimes story sections unlock. You can watch some cutscenes taken from the anime or just audio logs without visuals between the characters. They help form the story of the game.

As you play you unlock different skins for each character and pick up gear from the enemies. You can, then, enhance and amalgamate items you find to make higher rarity versions of them or just to upgrade them. It is pretty in-depth. I'm not particularly into crafting, so I looked up a guide and I didn't craft all the possible items. There is an achievement for that iirc.

The game is in Japanese and has subtitles. You can check the Battle Log any time during the missions to read the things you missed while fighting. You should pay attention to Battle Log anyway if you care about the side quests etc. as well. By doing the side quests you pick up weird objects called Behelits. These eventually unlock some 3d artwork in the gallery.

But that's not all. As you see this game is chock full of content. There is a whole game mode called Endless Eclipse similar to the Abyss in Nioh if you played that game. I'm not sure if it's actually endless but it is entirely possible as it can repeat missions and get harder each time and it also says there are infinite layers in the game. The missions are unique though at least till layer 100. I made it to level 106 with Guts iirc to collect some more Behelits. You cannot get all of them through the main story. It goes without saying but you can play this mode with the characters you unlocked as well and each of them have their own unlocks if you care to play with them to layer 80-100. 

I think this is all I have to say. Well, who am I kidding? I probably forgot to mention some stuff. I clocked 38 hours playing this according to Steam. There is a free DLC called "Exclusive Costumes" in the store. Don't forget to get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082945368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1496796048}
review:
I cannot in good faith, as a Berserk fan, recommend this game. It simply does not do enough justice to this series, and it should not have been a muso game. Period. It doesn't contextualize each encounter like Berserk does, you're just mowing down hordes of enemies without rime or reason.

For example, in the manga, Guts does not get out of most encounters unscathed. He gets beaten down, wounded to extremes. The title of hundred man slayer is not one so easily earned to him. He gets by not just with the force of his sword, but through his fierce battle sense, cunning and wit. Using every advantage he can get a hold of. However in this game you're just killing hundreds of defenseless, faceless enemies. No substance. Fucking boring.

It's for folks who hear Berserk and think only "swish swoosh big sword man." It is a Berserk adaptation, only in name. A reskin of a repetitive series.
And 60 dollars after two years? Piss off.

Edit: still a 60 dollar game. Nice, Koei Tecmo.

review: Una pena que no tenga couch coop como la mayorÃ­a de juegos de KOEI... aÃºn asÃ­ el gÃ©nero musou le queda demasiado bien a Berserk, en este juego se siente maravilloso entrar en la piel de nuestro querido Guts y partir hordas y hordas de enemigos, tal cual como en el anime. Una experiencia emocionante y muy satisfactoria, en este juego puedes palpar el odio de Guts y esparcirlo a tu gusto. AdemÃ¡s de que el juego tiene los hitos principales del anime e incluso ponen escenas de las pelÃ­culas, muy bueno para enterarse de la historia de la parte del anime. No leÃ­ el manga, pero por lo que me ha contado mi hermano tiene muchas cosas diferentes. AÃºn asÃ­ os aseguro de que el lore del anime y de las pelÃ­culas no os va a decepcionar, quizÃ¡s la animaciÃ³n y tal, pero la historia <3 es lo mejor que he visto en mi vida. Al mismo nivel que JoJo de epicidad, aunque son obras enfocadas de diferentes maneras, no se pueden comparar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321403496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15173, 'last_played': 1701832561}
review:
Ahora que estoy actualizado al dia en el manga de Berserk (se siente un enorme vacio)... no me queda mas que alagar a este juego, y llorar con una inquietante sonrisa en mi semblante mientras lleno de sangre de apostoles "la Matadragones".

Sere sincero, es mucho mas fiel que el anime, esta lleno de pequeÃ±os detalles de el manga, el anime nunca me dio esa nostalgia como este juego... le dedicaron su tiempo, y le mostraron mas respeto que el anime al trabajo original.

Quisiera evitar hablar sobre la variedad de personajes con los que pueden masacrar, solo dire que hay apostoles esperando para saciar su innato instinto por sangre.

contras?... esta subtitulado en estupido ingles
pros?... las graficas son hermosas, los hijos de pu... volando en pedazos... es hermoso... maldicion es Berserk quieres otra razon?

Si eres fan de este pedazo de arte llamado "Berserk"... necesitas, debes, es obligatorio, tener este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018443943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 2705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2705, 'last_played': 1560147917}
review:
Berserk and the Band of the Hawk is the only game on Steam based on the acclaimed Berserk manga.  As a huge fan of the manga, I would like to disclaim that I may be quite biased here, but I will try my best to be objective.  The game is made by Omega Force, so it is an off shoot of the Dynasty Warriors recipe.


Pros:
+ The only Berserk game on Steam.
+ Very fun to pick up, get in battles, and become a whirlwind of slash.
+ The Eclipse Mode is a meaty option to enjoy after the Main Story is completed.
+ Many bits and pieces from the OVA Berserk: The Golden Age Arc.
+ Main Story mode covers a large portion of the manga.

Cons:
- Boss fights...  Come on, this is Berserk, the boss fights need to be great!  Dragon Quest Heroes (also developed by Omega Force by published by Square Enix) had fun boss battles, so I know it can be done.
- Playable Characters...  Only 8?  For a Musou game?  I understand that the focus should be Guts, but damn...   At least we could have offered different builds/combos/variances with him (like 5 different Guts with different playstyles based on Heavy Sword)...
- Combos and move sets per characters are limited, especially for a game with 8 playable characters.  Again, this could have been the opportunity to showcase different options/combos/moves per character.
- Small rant here, but why is the Lost Children Arc always missing from current Berserk media?  I know the topics are heavy, but I believe it is part of the manga's DNA.

Verdict: 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198113002103', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1587432808}
review:
I had my doubts buying this game at the time but, having just finished watching the 1997 and the 2017 remake I was pumped to just buy the game and complete my collection.  

Pros:
Simple controls - no complex combos
Good voice acting - felt like you were taking part in the actual series
Endless eclipse mode - dungeon crawler

Cons:
Repetitive - If you don't like high numbers of enemies this is not the game for you.
bahelit - collectibles throughout the game are the only thing i ran into trouble outside of acheivments.

I would highly suggest this game to any fan of the anime or manga.  it is a well made "hack and slash".  You might even find yourself purposefully coming back to play from first to last mission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009505132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1563947420}
review:
RECOMMENDED ONLY FOR BERSERK FANS

Pros
-Fast phased combat
-Makes you feel a real Berserker
-Fan service
-Fun item development
-Well optimized


Cons
-Repetitive
-Only 2 attacks
-Most of the missions are played only as Guts
-Forced inserted battles where is not required by story (Like the hunting mission, there should be no combat, but there is)
-It is just a Dynasty Warriors game with a Berserk skin
-Same old capture the flag system as always

Summary

This is a Dynasty Warriors game with a Berserk skin for the characters, it is only recommended for Berserk fans who want fanservice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018407267', 'num_games_owned': 1983, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 6475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3044, 'last_played': 1628278275}
review:
The game is worth the price only on sale (the lowest I've seen it was 50% off and it rarely goes on sale). The DLCs are just cosmetic mainly and not entirely necessary to fully complete the game.
As a big Berserk fan, I believe that this genre suits it best. Fighting hordes of soldiers or demons as Guts, slashing your way through, feels incredibly satisfying. Some bosses can be annoying and unfair, but once you get the hang of it, it's really fun.
It may be repetitive for some, the graphics are nothing out of this world (you should set the environments to low, if you're experiencing performance issues), the soundtrack is alright (I would've loved to hear some of the songs from the '97 animation) and it has plenty of stuff to collect if you want to keep playing and replaying until you've reached the desired 100% completion (which is not that hard). There are 8 different playable characters, all with different costumes that provide different attacks and skills, there are over 20 warhorses to ride, hundreds of items to collect and hours of fun to have.

PS: If you want to enjoy the uncensored movies, there's a mod available at Nexus Mods you can download.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055371206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1489118888}
review:
Berserk and the Band of the Hawk is a Warriors-style hack and slash game that follows the Berserk series. This was my introduction to the Berserk universe and I have enjoyed the experience. Compared to the other Warriors games, this one does stand out for its graphics and its mechanics. However, this game is also very lackluster in areas that help the other Warriors games be more successful in spite of its potential.

The blood and gore mechanics in this game as well as the fighting mechanics of the characters really help you get a feel of this game as it keeps you hooked for wanting more. It is very satisfying to destroy a horde of enemies in a whirlwind of blood and gore. This feature is what helps this game stand out from the others.

The story follows the Berserk series and is a great way for someone new to the series to get caught up. The story itself is incredible and really keeps you wanting to know more as you follow Guts throughout the entire game. There are a total of six chapters in this game and the story really helps you keep going for reasons that I will cover later.

The item system is interesting as there is a good variety of items to acquire that each have their own buffs and augments. This aspect can also help you get through this game as you can test and mix these items to see what works best for certain missions.

This is where the game begins to suffer, as i said earlier, for its lackluster components that I am about to cover. We will start with the roster, which is very small as it is composed of 8 playable characters. This roster size is very small compared to the other Warriors games and, especially for story mode where you are stuck playing with Guts for 90% of the game, leaves you little room to diversify the gameplay. As for the other characters, they each have their own fighting style and abilities, but you hardly get a chance to play them until you play the Endless Eclipse Mode. This aspect hurts the game significantly as there are more characters in this series that would make interesting playable characters and, while I know this game is meant to follow Guts, more characters would add not only replayability, but different varieties to keep the game fresh for longer.

The game itself is extremely repetitive as most of the missions in all the game modes that are offered are very similar, and at times the exact same. The story and the game mechanics, as I stated earlier, can help with this as well as Endless Eclipse Mode, where you can unlock different costumes and abilities for the different characters as well as get a decent challenge out of the game.

The soundtrack is not praiseworthy, but is not that bad either. You won't find a lot of memorable music tracks in this game.

Overall, this game is lacking in areas that it shouldn't and very repetitive, but has an incredible story and some interesting elements that keeps the game interesting for a time and helps the game stand on its own. I would recommend this game for those who want a different experience of Berserk and for those who want a decent introduction to the series itself. However, a better way to be immersed in the series would be through the movies/episodes as well as the manga. In comparison to the other Warriors games, it is low on the scale.

6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198001180221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 1259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1557705848}
review:
GLANCE RECOMMENDATION: [u][b]66% YES[/b][/u] / 34% NO

[h1]GOOD[/h1]
[list]
[*]Playing as Guts feels great and the sounds as you hit hordes with his giant sword are pleasing.
[*]You can gain rewards and extra experience levels from free mode / Endless Eclipse mode. This is nice if you're having issues overcoming certain challenges or story missions.
[*]The story mode is mostly fantastic. Really interesting, engaging, gripping, and rather true to the manga and, er, semblance of an anime that came out recently. You can tell the CG has more of a budget for the scenes at least.
[/list]

[h1]NEUTRAL[/h1]
[list]
[*]Using Guts is great but there isn't much weight and impact to the hits of his sword. They're close, moreso closer when you're in fury mode, but the regular hits outside of fury mode just aren't as pleasing as I hoped for.
[*]Lots of challenges to do during missions, so there's replayability, but most of them are stressful and not very fun. Mostly timed challenges or "kill X before Y character".
[*]The Free Roam and Endless Eclipse modes sure have a lot to do but... well can't say I ever wanted to do anything in them.
[*]The forging for equipment stats is fine, but you don't get the ability to choose skills to place onto equipment until the last 10% of the game.
[/list]

[h1]BAD[/h1]
[list]
[*]Welcome to Berserk starring Guts and featuring every other playable character. I say that because you get access to play other characters, who have different playstyles, They ALSO all have their own separate levels / experience points. This means leveling all of them up separately. It doesn't end there. Once you unlock characters, you can't just choose them whenever you want. I'd say only 15% of the available missions in story mode let you choose your character from a few that you have unlocked. It's... a weird design choice. I would have rather them just lock you into Guts rather than stare at this big list of locked characters.
[*]There just doesn't seem to be a lot to do that's interesting outside of the story mode once. The combat just isn't varied enough or engaging to make me want to do it again.
[/list]

[h1]SUMMARY[/h1]
Alright look we need to find out who's here for what. Are you a Berserk fan that loves the manga and wished the CG-ridden anime had more of a budget? Then sure check this out around $25 or less. The story mode is pretty fun, just always play as Guts. Are you a fan of Musou games and rolling around different characters? Not sure if this is for you. You'll really suffer if you try to play different characters too often solely in the story. Also you really run out of combos and new things to do fast. What a weird game that could have been much more than its final result.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047776455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2095, 'last_played': 1569696061}
review:
The game is alright. 
I went into this not expecting much but being an enormous Berserk fan - first thanks to the Golden Arc movies and finally the manga. But knowing that no game could capture the majesty of the story, the intricacies of the characters, the horrific creatures and the absolutely animalistic brutality of Guts' rage. 
So why would i recommend it? Because i like Berserk and playing a game with the characters is fun - especially as Schierke. But have you no interest in the manga, don't bother with this. It's fan service and ~20 hours of fun but little else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072400181', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1554622765}
review:
I really enjoyed the manga, the anime and now, this game.

A very really good interpretation from the anime, combined with KOEI Tecmo Hack & Slash style, made me spent hours playing this game. If you really a fans of KT and also the anime, you should play this game. If you didn't know the anime series, you have two options:
1. Play the game, then watch the anime, and
2. Watch the anime, then play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084920331', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1597105020}
review:
La adaptacion es fenomenal, tampoco es el mejor Musou, pero con la ambientacion, los detalles, los soundtracks y lo bien animados que estan los personajes y su entorno puedo decir que es una joyita para los fanaticos de Berserk.
No te vas a arrepentir de jugar este game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027107363', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 7281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6398, 'last_played': 1693607257}
review:
gameplay: 5/10 It's an alright fighting system it's simple and have really nice "oumf" to it when you swing Guts's hunk of iron But it makes you level up to get more combos that you sould already have, cause the late game combos makes the game more fun rather than getting to just spam the first combo you get over and over and over again, but it sould've been more combos for Guts and seperate combos for each playable caracter. Rather than just the same combo input for every caracter.

Animation: 7/10 It's really nice and smooth and able to give you the real feel of wielding the hunk of irons guts uses, but are way to few animation for guts and all the other playable caracters. Some of the cutscenes are fully and beautifuly animated with perfect lip sync, Some that have still caracters with "breathing" models with amazing lipsync only and then the worst ones that has the model "breathing" and acttual like traditional 2D animation mouth movement wich means NO lipsync and looks like they are saying something completly diffrent, while the audio of the acttual sentence is comming out. So damn awkward to see the changes, to diffrent animation styles and i hate to see that they can animate so amazingly and not doing all cutscenes like that, instead going the really disgusting route with rapid changes each mission, But still is very nicely animated mostly and those scenes come often yes but you are treated to the beautiful sword swings of the fucking dragon slayer.

Maps: 3/10 It's meh not really much to say about them, rather them being recyceld with mostly you being spawned on a diffrent part of the map multiple times, BUT it has some really nice maps like the high note of the story parts of Berserk, for example The Tower of Conviction it really makes you feel like you are in mozguz domain and you are trying your best to get trough the tight and claustrophobic halls, one of my favorite maps of the game. Still to few unique maps to call it "good" map veriety.

Models 8/10 : The main caracters models are so perfect and just beautifully modeld after the manga and the Berserker armor is so amazing and so carefully crafted after miuras artstyle and the armor proportion, But the common enemy "mostly" the humans have the same models atleast the weak grunts, The captains or "elites" have they're own models but reused ALLOT (others are just bigger verison of the common weak grunts) and the villagers are just like atleast 4 models that gets reused allot, but understandable so i will let that slide aswell as the small grunts but not the elites wich are just bigger versions of the grunts.

Voice acting 7/10 : some of the voice work especially guts are so perfect in some areas but sometimes it feels like they just say the lines without a care and don't really understand how the caracter reacts to the situation and just gives of an awkward feeling when that happens. For the most parts when it comes to the voice acting its hit and miss in allot of places but when its like big parts of the story the voice actors try theyre best while the animators of the scene did not, wich makes the voice acting feel awkward, even tho its really perfect and allot emotion is comming out the animation does not.


Bosses 5/10 : While the animation is beautifull the hitboxes are hurendous and the stagger some of the bosses they can get you in are the biggest middle finger to the player :Example the snake master has the worst boss map of them all cause what he will do in stage 3 of him, is spam hes tail attack and corner stagger you to F***ing oblivion and that's like the only "challangeing" thing about them. The only bosses that are fun to fight is Zodd and grunbeld-only human form of grunbeld. Mostly the bosses are complet stagger fests that you don't want to be a part of.


Story 5/10 : shocking i know. Mostly beacuse the story misses so many scenes of caracter development of any caracter and misses caracters completly like for example of missing caracters like Luka and her little group, father mozguz'es tortures and many more. Even missing complet chapters for example The lost Children arc and probably even more wich i might have not have noticed sadly. Some parts really gives you the "Berserk" feel. While most probably leaves you like.....de fffff....IS THIS. Tho the ending just gives you the "OUGH" feeling of berserk, (not sure how to explain it but kind of like the sad/happy moments of berserk) The story has missing parts and missing the berserk parts of it allot but has small parts that has that feeling.


Soundtrack 3/10: Not my cup of berserk feeling soundtrack. Its very generic and to be honest packs no punch atall, especially the berserk armor theme is so....so...boring there is nothing in that theme that gives you the like notion of lost sense and overpowerdnes the berserker armor gives the look of. Most of the OST is so damn boring and no punch atall and mostly just exists, but i recommend to choose your own music that gives you the goosebumps. For me i choosed Apocalyptica - PATH when i got the berserker armor and god it felt so perfect and after i replayed the mission and had the original forces theme of 1997 berserk anime. Crist don't think i have had that much hype in any game for a long time.

______________________________________________________________

overall score: 7/10

The one and ONLY Warrior's type game i have played.
 i pushed trough and was entertained enough to get 100% on it.
 
It's alright. not breathtaking but one of the better berserk games even tho it dose not compare to berserk game on the playstation 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068297127', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1639873587}
review: Bueno gente voy a ser breve y conciso . Este juego es estrictamente para la gente que ama el manga y anime BERSERK . Lo que es la jugabilidad es muy similar al Dynasty Warriors . Muy gore y simplista pero muy adictiva . De momento eh jugado poco al juego pero me considero y gran fan del manga y el anime y se los recomiendo a todos que les gusta por igual o incluso mas que mi persona . Lamentablemente para quienes no son del palo de este gran manga dudo mucho que les guste . Para mi como fan es un gran juego y lo recomiendo mas aun si lo encuentran en rebajas .
