author: {'steamid': '76561198047534208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1553142723}
review:
I highly suggest to watch the anime first or read the manga before playing this game as there are a lot of spoilers in it. If you are a fan of the series, I highly recommend this game! I've read the manga several times myself and being able to actually play as Guts and work your way out to greatness is even better!

I can see some people will be confused with the story or get bored fast if they haven't seen the anime or read the manga. For me its just right. The game runs smooth and flawless at maxed settings at 4k resolution. Then again, I have at 2080Ti so most games runs smooth. Only thing that kind of suck is even disabling VSYNC, the game seems to be capped at 60fps. But aside from that, no stutter or freezes or crashes. The game recommended to me to run it in compatibility Windows 7/8 mode but I disregarded that and run it at native to my OS which is Windows 10 Pro and it runs fine.

Ahhh... the nostalgia! Best to play with headphones on and enjoy the BGM while playing this game! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198102030296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1552228947}
review: This Game would have been sick, and I would have gave it a positive rating, Had it been 2002, but it's not. People shouldn't be giving this a good rating. I'm a super die hard fan of berserk, But holy shit man this game is trash. The fact is was made in 2017, and they are asking the price of a AAA game for it ...... It has a fixed camera that is literally fuckin garbage, combat system isn't thought out at all, feels like the first devil may cry but shittier. Just a giant cash grab towards berserk fans, On top of that, They censored everything!? You can at least download a mod for that on nexus, but still. You're censoring a game made for Berserk fans? What Berserk fan  wants  PG berserk game. Don't waste your time, or steams time trying to refund this after you deal with the shitty camera, terrible combat, and tutorial for controls that things you're playing on a Xbox 350 controller, so you just mad type key's till your special pops off. It's not even worth the time and the refund man, Move on. Nothing to see here. Definitely not the droids you're looking for.

review:

Playing whitout a game controller is ridicilously difficult, the cammera es impossible to manage at the same time of all the keys you have to guess through the keyboard.

i did not read in the game description if gamepad is an absolute must. if it doesnt, it's a total rip off

author: {'steamid': '76561198137910196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1546461002}
review: I won't be structuring this review because personally I don't think this game is worth that amount of effort. First off, I can't even explain how disappointing this game is to play. You can make jokes about how the art is better than the animated series that Kadokawa butchered, but unfortunately they butchered this game just as bad. If you want to experience the golden age arc, just watch the movie, they take scenes directly from it and put it into this game after all, and those are the only good parts. The gameplay is poorly made combat reminiscent of the original Drakengard game, drakengard having been made on the playstation 2, and having about the same quality as this game, which was made for the playstation 4. The idle scenes consist of the main cast standing in neutral positions completely unmoving aside from their heads rotating to follow the speaker in the conversation, and the look on all of their faces is so uncanny it makes you uncomfortable talking to them. Their mouths move way too fast an precice, giving the dialogue a gross feeling when you read it. When it comes to the combat system, as well as being a mirror to a game made in the mid 2000s in terms of quality, the combo system is almost nonexistant. During the first three levels, the only thing I did for about an hour straight was light attack, light attack, light attack, strong attack because it's the only viable combo to take out the massive hoardes of small hp pool squishy walking targets that do nothing but look at you menacingly. Not to mention the "archers" often didn't even aim in the right direction to hit me. The combat is boring, and the interface looks like it's from a 90's game. If I had never spent the money on this game I would have a net gain of happiness by buying a bucket full of nails and eating them all. This game is not worth buying, and for a 60 dollar price tag, I only recommend buying this game if you have a fetish for financial abuse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074087052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1545562279}
review:
Not recommending it for the price it's at. Bought it on sale tho

Pros
-Satisfying and enjoyable if you enjoy hack and slash and berserk
-Cutscenes and animations (not talking about scenes from the movie) is a hundred million times more comfortable to watch if you compare it to the CG monstrosity adaptation from 2017
-controls are responsive and damn satisfying to play with

Cons
-60â‚¬ for this is insulting. The price for this should be atleast below 30â‚¬. The game is mediocre at best, but at the current price it's garbage
-Bound to get repetetive
-Boss hitboxes are fucked at times. 
-It's censored as fuck. Dunno why it is, I mean it's berserk. The manga and show isn't really for children or the faint-hearted to begin with..

author: {'steamid': '76561198007426856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1496, 'last_played': 1549083582}
review: I bought this game because I loved the movies but I feel that I have paid full price for half of the content, removing all the adult stuff that makes Berserk different from anything else. This game is just fight-fight-fight and watch a movie during breaks but without all the scenes that makes Berserk special.  They should have had a separate version for kids. I regret having spent money on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049257205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3559, 'last_played': 1711061959}
review:
-Review- //BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk//

Overall i think this game was a good experience for me. It is dedicated to the fans of the anime series Berserk. If you watched or read the manga and also you like gaming this is definitely worth playing to seal your love for this anime.

 I will give a score of 8/10 Behelits.

THE GOOD:
-Enjoyable and simple combat mechanics. The close up camera when you activate the ultimate LOOKS SUPER SICK!!
-Variety of characters to play like Guts, Casca, Zodd, Judeau and more.
-Faithfull to the story.

THE BAD:
-Although the combat system is pretty easy to master it turns out to be repetitive and can bore fast.
-no replay value.
-Skullnight isn't a playable character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314670457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1672012555}
review: A good Berserk game and a very good one at that. I honestly can't say much thus far as I've only completed a small portion so far so this is mostly first impressoins. I do think that hack 'n slash is probably the most suitable genre for Berserk to take on, and in my opinion this game is proof of this. Mind you, I've not played the Dreamcast or PS2 games of Berserk so I have nothing to really compare it to except for other Warriors games of it's kind. If you've played any other Warriors oriented game then I imagine you'd be pretty familiar with the gameplay. So far Berserk and the Band of the Hawk does have its own unique aspects such as the rage gauge and what not. That being said though, I do urge you to try the game out, however if you're not very familiar with the source material (manga + '97 and the three movies anime to be specific) you might be a bit puzzled. The game provides some very important details on it's own but I can't say I consider it as it's own separate adaptation. Some might disagree, but that's just my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059935923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 2095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2095, 'last_played': 1531093550}
review: Quite an enjoyable experience if you enjoy the gameplay of Dynasty Warriors games. A must if you enjoy that and are a fan of Berserk. Additionally, this tells the story of the manga quite decently!

author: {'steamid': '76561198339012887', 'num_games_owned': 2307, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1584724893}
review:
Not like those previous Koei Musou series, the Berserk story happened in a medieval Europe inspired dark fantasy world.
As fast as lightning, as cruel as evil, Berserk the Mad Warrior might be the strongest and chilliest swordsman in Koei history. During battles Berserk desperates his enemies into pieces with his black sword. No one could escape from the sword wind, no one could stand in his way, no one could ever fight back his strength.

Even Berserk has suppressed the limits of humankind, thereâ€™s still another man who is even crazier and more monster likely than the Mad Warrior. Griffith the White Hawk, who used to be a romantic hero known as the founder of Band of the Hawk, signed a term with evils and reborn as a powerful demon.

The Berserk game covers the Berserk manga from Berserk: The Golden Age to Berserk: Falcon of the Millennium Empire. 
So far since 1989, this manga has been well known as a comic book full of bloody corpses and sexual contents, from the controversial plot you might feel hopeless about the dark distortion and the struggle humanity.

Challenging the injustice of fate by constantly struggling, suffering from painful memories, the tragedy of Berserk is Oedipus style. He canâ€™t escape from the cruelty imposed by fate, he canâ€™t seize his beloved or protect his friends, but he can resist and fight back without hesitation and fear.

 If you are fold of the Berserk manga I really recommend you to experience the game world.
But if youâ€™re a Koei fan just enjoyed Mosou series, I would suggest you to wait for the Orochi 4 or Empire series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091384461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1630562057}
review: I bought this on release because I'm a Megafan, and I'll revisit it over the years, but overall it's not nearly as fun or thoughtful as Hyrule Warriors, and I'm not much a fan of Zelda as a series. I was more excited playing through the Dreamcast Berserk game, while this one took a very weird focus to fit Berserk to the dynasty warriors theme when it shoulda been the other way around. If there's a sequel, I'll buy that too purely to support the series, but as a gamer I'm disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999342327', 'num_games_owned': 1118, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1537216058}
review:
The history of the [b]Musou[/b] franchise is an interesting yet storied ride through the generations of video games.  Dating back to the original Playstation, though not seeing its known form until the PS2 sequel, many have seen this tried and true model for the hack-n-slash action game.  With over 20 titles under its belt, [b]Omega Force[/b] and [b]Koei Tecmo[/b] have thus branched to other franchises to combine their  formula with the fanbases that would benefit the most from it.  Shows such as [b]Fist of the North Star[/b], [b]Gundam[/b], and [b]One Piece[/b] have all had their [b]Musou[/b] treatment, and now the [b]Berserk[/b] franchise is trying its hand to become another [b]Musou[/b] staple.

[b]Berserk and The Band of the Hawk[/b] follows wandering swordsman Guts, as he travels from battlefield to battlefield, collecting enough coin to live to see another day, which he surrenders himself to swinging his giant blade throughout countless enemies.  Guts meets a charismatic leader, a white haired and armored man named Griffith, where after a loss in a duel against Griffith, becomes his right hand man in his mercenary group, The Band of the Hawk.

[b]Berserk[/b]'s Story Mode follows the manga and anime, following the important battles throughout Guts' mercenary days, through his tribulations as The Struggler, to the later years as thousands of enemies will try to stop Guts from his goals.  With [b]Berserk[/b] receiving a rare M rating for a [b]Musou[/b] game, you'll see a more violent side of the [b]Musou[/b] franchise, with powerful moves lopping people in half and crushing them through the power of your blade.  Guts and Company travel to various lands, fighting armies in the desert, to spirits in the cold mountains, to trolls in the Astral planes.  Story Mode clocks in at a meaty 15-17 hour campaign, with small Behelit side-quests to bring some extra challenges to each mission.  These Behelits are obtainable with completing side missions, such as beating bosses in a specific manner, or by completing objectives in a certain time limit.  When completed, the Behelits are collectible items that are used to unlock specific art pieces in [b]Berserk[/b]'s Gallery.

Gameplay is about what you would expect from the [b]Musou[/b] series.  The controls remain elementary with a light and heavy/charge attack, a Musou/Frenzy activation, blocking, dashing, a lock-on, Sub-Weapons and consumables.  The Frenzy Gauge, the Musou bar in other titles, when activated gives a big attack boost to your character, the coup de grÃ¢ce comes in the form of the Death Blow special that fills when you rack up kills during Frenzy Mode.  This Death Blow serves as a final touch to the deadliest of combos you can perform, and has the chance to take out a large portion of enemies in the vicinity with a single strike.  The controls and fighting were never a deep part of the game, though there are defensive parries and combo chains available, but it allows anyone to pick up [b]Berserk[/b] and be able to be as powerful as Guts is expected to be.

What breaks the monotony of the fights are the inclusion of boss battles.  While the style of fighting is the same when fighting a one-on-one battle, [b]Berserk[/b]'s bosses will punish for button mashing by giving bosses different combos that can stun and push you back.  Knowledge of attack patterns are necessary in finishing off these bosses quickly, but unless you are playing on the Hard or BERSERK difficulty, there are plenty of ways to mash your way through.

Free Mode is available as well, which allows any Story Mode mission to be played with any of the characters unlocked.  [b]Berserk[/b] only provides 8 fighters to play as, so your choices are slim, but with each character, you can upgrade them by fighting in missions to level them up (up to Level 99, levels can also be bought with gold up to the highest current character level), or with Accessories found on the battlefield.  [b]Berserk[/b] provides three main stats to upgrade: Attack, Defense, and Technique.  Each accessory can hold up to 4 sub stats, which can be used to upgrade a multitude of stats, from Sub-Weapon power to gradually increasing your Frenzy Gauge.  You can upgrade your accessory stats through enhancing or amalgamating: enhancing accessories will upgrade the accessory up to a +9 stat, with the ability to reach a higher rank (Rank is 6-tiered, color coated from Gray to Red); while amalgamating will use other items to enhance the sub-stats of the accessory.  There's a lot of tinkering and depth applied that can really upgrade your characters.

[b]Berserk[/b]'s final mode is the Endless Eclipse: an infinite leveled dungeon that will test your skills.  When a character goes into the Eclipse, you cannot heal between layers or replenish your items, so tactful fighting is key.  The Eclipse is a great way to level up, as well as collecting Behelits and extra costumes and horses, as well as stacking up gold to upgrade your characters and their items.

While [b]Berserk[/b] does not stray from what [b]Omega Force[/b] and [b]Koei Tecmo[/b] have done for almost 20 years, the repetitive gameplay is widely overshadowed by the love and effort put into the source material.  [b]Berserk[/b] carries enough weight in pure enjoyment to mask its shortcomings, and is a knockout success not only for hardened veterans of [b]Berserk[/b] and [b]Musou[/b], but for casual players looking for a way to feel as strong as the Black Swordsman.

[quote][h1]Follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33247611/]A Review Is Worth 1,000 Words[/url] for more content.[/h1][/quote]

review:
I like it. You have to play in BERSERK difficulty for there to be ANY challenge though, sadly Hard and Normal are shit because you take absolutely no fucking damage. 

Wait for a sale, not a 60 dollar game by all means, but it makes a Berserk fan like me happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041804646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1535749116}
review:
I was excited to play this game originally even waiting near three hours to install it on my slow internet connection.  

Unfortunately this is a bad port from console, no mouse support even in menus, trying to fit joystick to keyboard does not work well at all (If you have a controller that works just as well as console) and higher screen resolutions cannot be selected without jumping through hoops which I refuse to do.
For the brief period of time I ran it it seemed to run well enough though I admit I did not play for any length of time.

All of these issues (aside from the resolution) would be small individually but with all of them it is a dealbreaker.  I may buy it for console at some point but I am requesting a refund for the PC version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061164965', 'num_games_owned': 1280, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3853, 'last_played': 1593959129}
review:
Berserk and the Band of the Hawk is an ARPG or the game will be commonly known as a Musou game with the game being made by the same company that does our beloved Dynasty & Samurai warrior games. The game follows from Conviction Arc to Falcon of the Milliennium Empire Arc and we have cutscenes from the movies included.

PROS
- Berserk is perfect for a Hack & Slash game.
- Endless Eclipse is a secondary mode where you can play up to 8 characters for 100 layers (levels)
- [spoiler] We can use Gut's berserker armor & Griffith as Femto [/spoiler]
- Follows the manga so a certain character isn't excluded like he was in the anime or movies. 
- It's Berserk? Do I need say anymore?

CONS
- Just like every Musou game, gameplay does get repeatitive. if you don't like games like Dynasty/Samurai warriors then you likely won't enjoy it.
- Would of liked co-op
- [spoiler] Was bummed when Skull Knight wasn't playable [/spoiler] 

Overall
This is Koei Tecmo's first game following a Dark Fantasy themed musou game and I want to say that I absolutely loved it. Berserk was honestly the best choice because it suits the theme perfectly. Other games I'd like to see them do in the future  following the same theme could be Akame Ga Kill/Basilisk and or a Conan game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042804215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2169, 'last_played': 1680993481}
review: Este juego esta dedicado por completo a los fans de la serie , una obra maestra :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198093905012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1827, 'last_played': 1495969342}
review:
The only good modern Berserk game. 

First of all, if you don't enjoy Musou games, the only way I can recommend this game is if you really like Berserk. I love Berserk and also enjoy a Musou game now and then, therefore for me this is a buy. It follows the story of Berserk up until a small amount after the Eclipse arc and it does do justice to Guts by making him feel like an absolute force to be reckoned with. Especially once you unlock the ability to use the Berserk armour.

If you want to play one of the most enjoyable Musou games and one of the ONLY modern Berserk games, this is the purchase for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044453630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 451, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1677230280}
review:
Low gametime played because i beat the game on PS4 already on Berserk difficulty with a maxed out Guts.
Basically i got this game on a discount for on PC for my love/support for the series
and i somewhat enjoyed it on PS4, but this PC port is absolute trash.
Recommending compatibility mode, no mouse support, max settings tank framerate as low as 22fps on a 6GB GTX 1060 SC. It's awful. The music, specifically the main menu, awfully droney & goes on & on & on in a loop fashion that still haunts me from when i beat the game. Granted, the gameplay isn't out of this world, but you get what you expected, a Dynasty Warrior Berserk game. But based on that, it can be fun & cool to experience & play through some of the battles, but overall, I'd wait for a hard discount on this one. I paid $25 & i still feel somewhat cheated.
Wait for a $20 discount or even less.

6/10

Edit: Wow, still a pos 'til this day, years later on a newer setup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038718418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1716, 'last_played': 1586044099}
review:
Koei TECO yet again has made another hack and slash game but this time with the Japanese dark fantasy manga series Berserk. 
My experience over all with this game? 
Its alright, just be sure to get it on sale.

Who do I recommend this game to? 
Berserk Fans and those who enjoy the dynasty warrior styled gameplay.


The few annoying things this game are....
1. The repetitive gameplay gets bland at some parts, 
2. Recycled maps are abundant, 
3. the performance is bad and...
4. the bosses are absolute â™¥â™¥â™¥ to fight. (looking at you, Femto)
5. They do cut out a lot from the manga..
(Quick mention: They also have video from the Golden Age Arc movies as cutscenes)

Overall, put your grasses on and nothing will be wrong.
(but Everything go wrong.)

(Side Note: My remedy to ((somewhat)) fix performance is to set Enviornment to low and Vsync off.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198036234870', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 1604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1604, 'last_played': 1530361152}
review:
PROS:
â€¢ It's BERSERK
â€¢ Character models look good
â€¢ the 3D animations of the Anime don't look so out of place in a video game cutscene!

CONS:
â€¢ I don't like Dynasty Warriors (they are so Repetetive)
â€¢ Weird switch from 2D cutscenes to 3D after half of the game
â€¢ RT on an Xbox One Controller doesn't work!
â€¢ Repetetive

Verdict: 5/10
I had to vote it down because there is no "meh" rating.

If you like Dynasty Warriors - you will also like this game (and could consider this review as positive). If you don't - watch the anime instead!
It's so stupid when Guts gets celebrated as a Hero for slaying 100 men, when you actually have slain thousands.
Let's sneak in a castle: better kill a thousand guards on the way...
The only enemies who can actually hurt you are the Demons - everything else is just annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050750548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 598, 'playtime_forever': 6447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4870, 'last_played': 1535060288}
review:
Update: After 40 hours trying to get 100% unlocked I am done with this game. In fact, I will unisntall it and never play it again. It is stupidly repetitive and the endless mode doesn't make any sense. Judeau and Casca are garbage; their special move and attack movements are useless. 

The game is gorgeous and as a Berserk fan myself this game is just good. 

Then why did I put a tumnbs down? Easy, the bosses design is really poor. Example of bad design choices. As you can verify going to the forums, every boss spams his attacks and is quite fustrating. 

Finally, the need to play in the endless mode with all characters to unlock stuff is quite repetitive and tedious. 

If you like the series, this game is a must have; it won't let you down since it covers all the storyline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015007645', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 364, 'playtime_forever': 2688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2068, 'last_played': 1621629055}
review:
A musou game with Berserk franchise is perfect combination. But it has its own issues.

Pros:
1. Graphics look pretty good (downgraded heaviliy) but still look pretty good.
2.Gameplay as every musou game , hack and slash the f out of the enemies.
3.Pretty good adaptation of manga/anime about 90% accurate.
4. It looks better then an actual anime of 2016/17 anime.
5. Nosferatu Zodd playable. (Didnt expect lots of characters playable at all, so its pretty cool)
6. Anime cutscenes made it more compelling for story purposes. 
7. Guts sword makes the same sound as from anime, I love that sound.

Cons:
1. Music is very weak, they should have used anime ost.
2. Killing number doesnt matter, no bonuses like in pirate warriors 3 where you kill opponents and every 500 kill your buffs increase your power (def, attack) it made killing lots of opponents pretty useless.
3. Apostles dont stagger, unless you somehow manage to hit very high combo to stagger it.
4.Apostles use attacks that stagger you and cant do shit, they also perfectly locks you in some positions where camera gets rekt and you cant see nothing or even escape.
5. Even if you max out character lv and use good items you dont feel so much stronger. it was strange.
6. Needed more cutscenes, (if you sum up its only 30min) of high quality made cutscenes.
7. Missions where guts needs to save citizens, I repeat guts doesnt get involved with others. so the missions where you save people made no sense what so ever.
8. Very downgraded, it looks nothing like in the first trailer or in screenshots. But still its good looking game, blame consoles.
9. The port is garbage, but for my case I needed to wait 5-15min and the game ran very good. Strange but hey it works.
10. Koei techmo needs to stop abandoning games and fix atleast the main issues.
11. Cutscenes look like a washed up version of a real version we should have gotten, I guess false advertising on steam page lol .
12. The price is nonsense, buy it on sale only.

Overall a lot of people  can get turned off by musou style games, but for those who love to hack to thousands of enemies and get to know some of berserk lore go ahead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059607035', 'num_games_owned': 2173, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1761, 'last_played': 1529288994}
review:
[h1] Los fans de Berserk lo amarÃ¡n y odiarÃ¡n [/h1]


Un juego basado en un animÃ© generalmente no es tan bueno, ya que suele ser muy difÃ­cil plasmar toda una obra en un videojuego, en este caso tenemos a BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk, un videojuego del genero mosou que sin tener todos los reflectores encima, parecÃ­a ser una experiencia agradable para el usuario, entonces, Â¿realmente lo es?


Este videojuego estÃ¡ basado principalmente en el animÃ© de 1997 y su secuela del 2016, durante todo el trayecto te cuentan cÃ³mo fue que empezÃ³, hasta donde termina el animÃ© del 2016. AquÃ­ es donde entra su mayor fortaleza y a la vez su debilidad: Apegarse el animÃ©. Si eres alguien que viÃ³ el animÃ© antes de jugarlo, entonces sabrÃ¡s de que va toda la historia y no tendrÃ¡s problemas en entender, de hecho si te gustÃ³ el animÃ©, entonces te gustarÃ¡ cÃ³mo se va desarrollando el videojuego, el problema es si no viste el animÃ©, ya que el videojuego lamentablemente se limita a explicar lo mÃ¡s superficial de la historia, muchos detalles no los explica, y es entendible que no pueda explicar todo, pero el problema es que de repente estÃ¡s haciendo una cosa y despuÃ©s haces otra cosa muy diferente, te ponen mucho a suponer que pasÃ³ exactamente en ese pedazo que no se cuenta, esto es durante casi todo el juego.


La jugabilidad es digna, al principio se puede sentir muy limitada, pero mediante vamos  avanzando, notarÃ¡s que se pueden hacer mÃ¡s cosas que solo usar el mismo ataque, ademÃ¡s, algo positivo, es el hecho de que en algunas misiones puedas usar a personajes secundarios durante toda la misiÃ³n, esto es algo fresco ya que cada personaje se siente diferente.


Su estilo grÃ¡fico puede ser cuestionable, el juego se mira bien, ni mÃ¡s ni menos, el exceso de escenarios repetitivos, asÃ­ como de enemigos, es algo que le puede quitar credibilidad y hacernos pensar que estamos jugando la misma misiÃ³n una y otra vez, aÃºn asÃ­, graficamente cumple.


Ahora, el mayor problema de este videojuego es sin duda que es demasiado repetitivo, como ya lo mencionÃ© antes, muchas misiones son practicamente iguales, sin exagerar, mÃ¡s de la mitad de las misiones son practicamente la misma, es decir, avanzar y matar a todos los NCP, para posteriormente concluir la misiÃ³n, a esto le sumamos escenarios reciclados, nos da una experiencia aburrida y mÃ¡s que querer seguir, queremos que termine, no obstante mÃ¡s de una misiÃ³n es entretenida, principalmente pelear contra bosses.


Te recomiendo jugarlo si te gusta el genero mosou, asÃ­ como si ya viste el animÃ© Berserk y tambiÃ©n te gustÃ³. No te recomiendo jugarlo si esperas una buena historia ya que aquÃ­ no la cuentan muy bien, ni tampoco si no te gustan los juegos repetitivos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969771062', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2604, 'last_played': 1528171720}
review: I love Berserk. I've consumed almost every kind of media associated with this amazing story save for the PS2 and Dreamcast games. They cut out a lot of the source material from the manga and even some from the original anime and the Golden Age Arc movies in this game, but what's there is extremely fun. The gameplay fits so well with the story of berserk and it gets even better when you receive the Berserker armor. I don't think I've ever felt as powerful as Guts when he's wearing the armor and tearing through anything that gets in his way in a game. A must have for Berserk fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028167121', 'num_games_owned': 1557, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1527291024}
review:
*KLONK*! Mit einem uebergroÃŸen stueck Stahl durch Gegnerhorden, menschlich, daemonisch und untot metzeln... das waere wohl die perfekte Beschreibung fuer dieses Game. 
Unter all den Warrior-Collaboration die es inzwischen gibt, ist Berserk and the Band of the Hawk wohl mein absoluter Favorit. Nicht nur, dass man die einzigartige Story von Guts aus eigener Perspektive erleben kann, es macht auch noch einen heiden SpaÃŸ einfach blind in Gegnermassen zu rennen und wegzuklatschen was da ist. 
Well, ich koennte ewig solche Saetze bringen nun... was ich am liebsten auch tun wuerde, allerdings fange ich wohl besser direkt mit Pro und Kontra des Spiels an.

[h1][b]Pros:[/b][/h1]
â€¢ Die Geschichte des Manga/Anime "Berserk" wird einem hier gut naeher gebracht
â€¢ Frustration? Wut? Depression? Kein Problem. Einfach 2-3 Missionen machen und alle Wut ist raus und man fuehlt sich gut!
â€¢ Eine sehr gute Kombination von Berserk und den Warrior-Games
â€¢ Anime-getreuer Soundtrack 
â€¢ Obwohl es "nur" ein Warriors-Game ist, wird mit Erfolg versucht, die Emotionen die man im Manga/Anime erlebte, hier wieder zugeben
â€¢ Grafisch schoen anzusehen, wobei als Vorlage offenkundig der neuere Anime dient
â€¢ Original-Synchronsprecher des Anime
â€¢ Fuer ein Warriors-Game reichlich unterschiedliche Gegner
â€¢ Fordernde Bosskaempfe an den richtigen Stellen der Story
â€¢ Dafuer muss ich einfach den Punkt geben... das Original Klonk-Geraeusch, wenn das Schwert auf den Gegner trifft. 
â€¢ Man kann alle wichtigen Figuren neben Guts spielen
â€¢ Die Story fuehrt uns bis ins Falcon of the Millennium Empire-Arc, was schonmal einiges weiter ist, als der Anime bis dato. 
â€¢ Gutes Balancing was Gegner und Spieler-Charakter angeht.
â€¢ Schwierige und herausfordernde Bonus-Missionen
â€¢ Ladebildschirm mit Minispiel


[h1][b]Kontras:[/b][/h1]
â€¢ Die Story wird zwar gut erzaehlt, allerdings vieles davon nur in kleinen Events, die alle eine wahnsinnig lange Ladezeit haben
â€¢ Extrem lange Ladebildschirme 
â€¢ Funktioniert erstaunlicher Weise auf Windows 7 besser als auf Windows 10
â€¢ Mit durchschnittlicher Grafikkarte, kann das Game zwar noch sehr schoen aussehen, bekommt dann aber starke FPS-Drops
â€¢ Es endet halt nach dem Falcon of the Millennium Empire Arc... (Ich weiÃŸ, zu dem Zeitpunkt ging der Manga auch nicht weiter als bis dort, aber man will einfach mehr xD)

[h1][b]Fazit:[/b][/h1]
Berserk and the Band of the Hawk ist ein gutes Warriors-Game, welches selbst fuer Nicht-Berserk-Fans ein gewaltiger SpaÃŸ sein kann. 
Die Story ist wie bereits erwaehnt, die Originalstory des Manga/Anime und jeder der Berserk kennt, weiÃŸ, wie gut diese Story ist. 
Durch die Bonus-Missionen und die 4 verschiedenen Schwierigkeitsgrade kann man es immer und immer wieder spielen, selbst wenn man es schon durch hat. 
Fuer Warriors und fuer Berserk Fans ist dieses Spiel einfach ein muss. 
Ich gebe dem Spiel somit eine feste 9 von 10, es waere wohl eine 10, haette ich mit meinem alten PC, der ne mittelmaessige Grafikkarte hatte, nicht diese harten FPS-Drops gehabt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034219483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1488401612}
review:
Quelle claque !! Câ€™est en ces termes que lâ€™on pourrait qualifier Berserk, le manga de Kentaro Miura culte chez les fans, mais peut Ãªtre trop peu connu du grand public. Câ€™est donc Omega Force qui sâ€™est lancÃ© dans cette adaptation vidÃ©o ludique quâ€™est Berserk and the Band of the Hawk. Qui dit Omega Force, dit forcÃ©ment Muso. En effet, le studio sâ€™est fait connaÃ®tre avec les sÃ©ries Dynasty Warriors et Samurai Warriors avant de sâ€™attaquer Ã  dâ€™autres adaptations de manga culte comme Hokuto no Ken, Arslan, Lâ€™attaque des Titans, One Piece, Gundam. 

berserk and the band of the hawk (4)Berserk and the Band of the Hawk est un jeu qui plaira au fan du manga. cette adaptation se rÃ©vÃ¨le Ãªtre extrÃªmement fidÃ¨le au manga. Des cinÃ©matiques provenant des films de la trilogie Golden Age sont aussi prÃ©sentes. Sans trop en faire, le jeu adapte la grande majoritÃ© de lâ€™histoire. On pourra y incarner 8 personnages dont Guts, Griffith ou Casca. Cela peut sembler Ãªtre peu pour un muso, mais le plaisir reste intact, car entre nous, personne ne touche Ã  tous les personnages dâ€™un Dynasty Warriorsâ€¦ Niveau contenu, on retrouve le mode histoire et des modes annexes qui nâ€™ont que trop peu dâ€™intÃ©rÃªt. Vous noterez que le jeu nâ€™est pas disponible en franÃ§ais (mÃªme pas de VOSTFR) et que le censure se fait vachement sentir. En effet, de base le manga Berserk est trÃ¨s violent et il nâ€™est pas rare de trouver des dÃ©membrements ou des scÃ¨nes qui peuvent â€œheurter votre sensibilitÃ©â€. Bien que Berserk and the Band of the Hawk soit plutÃ´t sanglant, les scÃ¨nes sont assez Ã©dulcorÃ©es, câ€™est un petit peu dommage.

Niveau gameplay, lâ€™univers et la violence de Berserk correspondent parfaitement au muso. Les 3/4 des missions vous mettront en face de plusieurs centaines de soldats qui passeront â€œpar-dessus la 3Ã¨me cordeâ€ Ã  chaque coup dâ€™Ã©pÃ©e. Chaque coup fera monter votre jauge de fureur qui une fois activÃ©e, vous fera bÃ©nÃ©ficier dÃ©gÃ¢ts accru et la possibilitÃ© de rÃ©cupÃ©rer des ores qui dÃ©clenchent une attaque ultime. Je vous parle de muso depuis tout Ã  lâ€™heure, mais on peut dire quâ€™il sâ€™agit dâ€™un sous-genre du beatâ€™em all. Le titre ne bÃ©nÃ©ficie pas vraiment dâ€™un level-design digne de ce nom, câ€™est plutÃ´t lâ€™inverse. Et mÃªme les combats de boss sont trÃ¨s basiques et manque de mise en scÃ¨ne (pour autant, ils assurent tout de mÃªme le fan-service).

Berserk and the Band of the Hawk a son cÃ´tÃ© RPG avec des gants de niveaux des accessoires (que vous pourrez amÃ©liorer) Ã  Ã©quiper pour personnaliser vos personnages. Vous pourrez aussi utiliser des armes secondaires (mais tellement marginale).

Sans Ãªtre gÃ©niale, la rÃ©alisation de Berserk and the Band of the Hawk est propreâ€¦ si on ne regarde pas trop prÃªt. Si les personnages principaux jouissent dâ€™une rÃ©alisation soignÃ©e Ã  base cel-shading, ce nâ€™est pas le cas des environnements ou de vos ennemis qui souffrent du syndrome â€œils ont tous la mÃªme tÃªteâ€ et ceux qui sont en armures de la tÃªte aux pieds. On pestera quelques secondes devant les animations des personnages et surtout du cheval (du total nâ€™importe quoi) mais , ce nâ€™est pas le rÃ©alisme que lâ€™on cherche dans ce genre de jeu. Au-delÃ  des graphismes, le titre reste fluide dans les cas mÃªme quand le compteur affiche plusieurs dizaines dâ€™ennemis Ã  lâ€™Ã©cran.

Sans bousculer la longue tradition du genre muso, Berserk and the Band of the Hawk se rÃ©vÃ¨le Ãªtre un super dÃ©fouloir, trÃ¨s fidÃ¨le au manga. Il sâ€™agit dâ€™un jeu Omega Force et comme pour leur prÃ©cÃ©dent titre, le jeu ne bÃ©nÃ©ficie pas de graphisme digne de ce nom et dâ€™une rÃ©alisation correcte, câ€™est bien dommage. Il reste que le jeu possÃ¨de un charme indÃ©niable. Je recommande aux de Berserk et aux fans du genre muso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027665386', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1548, 'last_played': 1523256260}
review:
Comment ? Berserk en jeu vidÃ©o ? Je dois dâ€™abord avouer que jâ€™Ã©tais comblÃ© de lâ€™apprendre. Lâ€™Å“uvre rÃ©side dans presque tous mes tops manga, pour son histoire profonde et ses personnages charismatiques, sans parler du fait quâ€™il sâ€™agit dâ€™une rÃ©fÃ©rence de la dark fantasy des plus solide. Mais câ€™etait accompagnÃ© de doute que venait le plaisir. Dans un genre MUSO ? Moi qui nâ€™aimais pas particuliÃ¨rement ce style dÃ©fouloir, cette nouvelle mâ€™a vite refroidi, mais soit. Comme tout bon fan boy qui se respecte, je devais y goÃ»ter et juger par moi mÃªme si je suis capable dâ€™apprÃ©cier ce nouveau format de Berserk... et quel plaisir de contrÃ´ler Guts et de revivre les batailles les plus Ã©piques et mÃ©morables avec les Faucons, ressentir la puissance du guerrier noir en tranchant une flopÃ©e de soldat dâ€™un coup et voir le sang Ã©clabousser notre personnage. On est sans cesse nourri de violence et câ€™est ce qui est bon (a savoir quâ€™il y a pas mal de censure. Dommage mais comprÃ©hensible pour toucher un publique plus large). Mais je dois dire que pour un gros fan boy comme moi, câ€™est une bonne adaptation de Berserk en jeu vidÃ©o.

Parce que revivre la rencontre avec Griffith, vivre lâ€™Ã©clipse jusquâ€™a lâ€™avÃ¨nement du faucon millÃ©naire, câ€™est juste le pied. Je me suis surpris plusieurs fois Ã  dire Â« tiens, câ€™est bien fidÃ¨le au manga Â» lorsque jâ€™ai vu que des scÃ¨nes animÃ©s sont parfois incrustÃ©s pendant la bataille pour pouvoir nous changer dâ€™objectif ou aprÃ¨s celle ci pour faire Ã©voluer lâ€™histoire. Bien Ã©videment le jeu ne retrace que les grandes lignes et nous Ã©pargne les moments tendres censÃ©s approfondir la relation des personnages, mais jâ€™ai trouvÃ© lâ€™arc de lâ€™Ã¢ge dâ€™or vraiment bien foutu et immersif, trÃ¨s bien pour le dÃ©couvrir avec le jeu. Mais voilÃ  le problÃ¨me : lâ€™Ã©clipse passÃ©e, il nâ€™y aura plus aucune scÃ¨ne animÃ©e ce qui (je trouve) crÃ©era un lÃ©ger dÃ©sÃ©quilibre dans la qualitÃ©. AprÃ¨s ce nâ€™est vraiment un problÃ¨me puisque les scÃ¨nes importantes seront faites en 3D plutÃ´t correct et que lâ€™histoire se comprendra plutÃ´t facilement. En tout cas, mÃªme si la forme paraÃ®t Ãªtre la mÃªme, je vous suggÃ¨re de dâ€™abord lire le manga avant de vous lancer dans le jeu, car si je nâ€™ai pas ressenti toute la profondeur et les Ã©motions de la version papier, jâ€™en dÃ©duis que le jeu ne sert quâ€™a vous dÃ©chaÃ®ner sur une montagne dâ€™ennemie en vous spoilant lâ€™essentiel. Câ€™est trÃ¨s amusant dâ€™incarner plusieurs personnages quâ€™on a vu Ã©voluer au fil des tomes, de savoir quel moment a Ã©tÃ© censurÃ© et ce qui a Ã©tÃ© retirÃ© ou non du jeu etc quand on connais dÃ©jÃ  tout. Mais pour le dire autrement : Berserk and the Band of the Hawk paraÃ®tra trÃ¨s bien pour les fans, mais sÃ»rement moins pour les nÃ©ophytes.

Outre son Ã©popÃ©e qui arrive Ã  retracer les Ã©vÃ©nements importants, Berserk propose un mode Ã‰clipse ou le joueur devra suivre des missions composÃ©es de 5 Â« Ã©tages Â» qui deviendront de plus en plus corsÃ©s en descendant (parce que par Ã©tage, ils sous entendent une descente dans les abysses). Un mode trÃ¨s dÃ©foulant et dur parce quâ€™il ne vous Ã©pargne pas, mÃªme si vous avez la possibilitÃ© de sauvegarder tous les 20 Ã©tages sur les 100 que vous pouvez faire avec chacun des personnages. Il y a aussi un free mode, oÃ¹ vous pouvez rejouer les scÃ©narios principaux avec tous les personnages (du genre Zodd contre Zodd loul), mais bon je ne me suis pas trop attardÃ© sur ce mode parce quâ€™il est surtout lÃ  pour rÃ©cupÃ©rer les Behelits que vous avez manquÃ©es. Et franchement, pour des collectibles Ã  rÃ©cupÃ©rer dans les missions, jâ€™ai juste adorÃ© ce point. Toutes les missions ont des Â« quÃªtes annexes Â» Ã  faire pour rÃ©ussir Ã  les choper. Parfois facile, parfois ardu... mÃªme si au final toutes les rÃ©cupÃ©rer ne dÃ©bloquent pas grand chose (a part un succÃ¨s et des images en 3D dans la galerie), jâ€™ai bien aimÃ© ce point.

Puis franchement, contrÃ´ler Guts en Berserker, Femto ou se transformer avec Zodd pour tout tuer, Ã§a valait le coup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034924122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1502973732}
review:
Pros:
- faithful to anime/manga
- fun to hack cannon fodder apart
- stunning visuals
Cons
- repetetive
- griffith is borderline unplayable
- overpriced
- crafting system is never properly explained
- apostle fights are horrible
- long loading times

tl;dr: only buy if you're a fan of berserk and it's >75% off

author: {'steamid': '76561198332915971', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2350, 'last_played': 1625935170}
review:
Amazing game for Berserk lovers with insane and addictive killing at each stage, perfect fitting for The Black Swordsman!
Other great thing is that you can play with other characters as Griffith, Zodd, Judeau, Casca, and others. Too bad they didn't add some other characters like Azan for example... But still an awesome game. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040552952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1516052041}
review:
probably the only Musou game that makes any real sense imo.

bugged bosses a lot of the time, but that just adds to the nightmare, doesnt it?

i'm not a fan of the Koei Tecmo Warriors/Musou format of games, but for Berserk, waves of demon creatures are totally expected. this game ends with Ganeshka, but plays through a thorough cut of the story, albeit censored in many ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103839440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 3817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2461, 'last_played': 1588918942}
review:
The best berserk game we'll get.

I liked the 3D cutscenes that they did themselves but often it won't do this for its cutscenes and would rather take scenes straight out of the movie plus it has invisible timers but that's just a nit pick.
I really hate how skullbro isn't playable but wyald is. Pluis the endless mose, which isn't endless by the way has charcters hidden within it. though I guess that's a lot better than hiding them behind a paywall but regardless the endless mode is difficult and BS and it's frustrating that those characters (femto and wyald) are locked/hidden behind it.

Not to mention how bad and ridiculously hard the endless mode is but again the main game isn't locked awayu or ruined by it so if you are a fan of berserk then I would absolutely recommend this game to them as it is a complete experience and it can be fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370104392', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 4539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4539, 'last_played': 1518505579}
review:
[h1]Un Musou dinÃ¡mico con grÃ¡ficos de ultima generaciÃ³n[/h1]

[b]Antes de comenzar con el anÃ¡lisis de este juego cabe mencionar ciertos detalles, por ejemplo el genero Mosou es el genero oriental del tipo Hack N' Slash de occidente solo con la diferencia de que en el Mosou te enfrentaras a olas interminables de enemigos. Dicho esto cabe mencionar que este Mosou esta basado en el Manga Berserk del Mangaka Kentaro Miura (El cual les recomiendo ampliamente si aun no lo leen).

Ya entrando al tema funcional del juego, como es un tipo Mosou cabe mencionar que el tipo de gameplay sera muy repetitivo y machacador de botones, en si no tiene la mayor ciencia eres tu en un campo abierto dividido por segmentos en los cuales tienes que andar presionando los botones hasta que te deshagas de todos los enemigos, puedes elegir de un amplia pero aun asÃ­ reducida cantidad de personajes de la saga del los cuales cada uno tiene animaciones como habilidades diferentes para ayudarte de cierta  manera a liberar oleadas o jefes individuales, ademas de que cada uno de ellos poseen algo asÃ­ como habilidades definitivas Ãºnicas que cumplen con el propÃ³sito de arrasar con una gran cantidad de enemigos. 

Los grÃ¡ficos de este juego son de lo mas agradables con respecto a los personajes tienen elementos que le dan cierta similitud a borderlands (Esto no quiere decir que sean iguales) combinando el estilo de animaciÃ³n mediante CGI, en cuanto a la compatibilidad del control cabe destacar que a diferencia de otras entregas de la compaÃ±ia Koei Tecmo en Steam ahora si se pusieron las pilas y entregaron un port 100% ergonomico para el jugador.

En cuanto a la IA cabe mencionar que los algunos jefes son algo injustos en ciertas dificultades y te hacen desesperar ya que obviamente no parecen haber sido testeados y estos hacen el imposible el acercarseles para hacerles daÃ±o en si no poseen un patrÃ³n y por lo tanto la estrategia que puedas tener se reduce a "Machacar botones cuando estÃ©s cerca"

Hay varias modalidades de juego y puedes ir desbloqueando mas caracteres asÃ­ como caballos los cuales te ayudan a llegar mas rÃ¡pido a ciertos puntos.

Pros
+ Experiencia visual 
+ Modalidad de juego sencilla
+ AnimaciÃ³n mediante CGI y escenas animadas en 2D
+ AdaptaciÃ³n del manga (Hay ciertos eventos los cuales no se han llevado a la pantalla chica)
+ Excelente banda sonora
+ Transformaciones de algunos personajes a apostoles

Cons
- No posee multijugador
- Repetitivo y monotono
- Jefes sin estrategia alguna

En si recomiendo ampliamente este juego, aunque sea monÃ³tono y repetitivo el encanto de este juego reside en el echo de que Kentaro Miura plasma su obra de tal manera en que el jugador entienda los arcos principales y si a esto le sumamos la animaciÃ³n en CGI y en 2D se complementa perfectamente, el juego es adictivo y siempre lo visitas para encontrar esa satisfacciÃ³n de librar nivel tras nivel que ya cuando menos cuadras te quemaste 3 horas jugandolo,  a menos que seas como yo que se propuso el completar al 100% y llegue a un punto de preguntarme si en realidad existimos como seres humanos.

Como adicional seas Fan o no de la obra de este mangaka eso no influye en adquirir o no este juego ya que fue elaborado para aquellos que no conocen como apara aquellos que ya somos Fan.
[/b]

review:
Mmmh...
Mi ritrovo a dire che Berserk Ã¨ sempre stato un brand che ho desiderato giocare su PC per anni, ma di certo non me lo immaginavo cosÃ¬. Nonostante sia un fan l'ho trovato tremendamente noioso data la ripetitivitÃ  tipica di questi giochi.
E' un "Warriors" e quindi questo implica vagonate di nemici semi cerebrolesi che vi si accalcano intorno in attesa di essere travolti da praticamente la stessa combo ripetuta migliaia di volte.
La storia Ã¨ seguita direi piÃ¹ che bene ma le ambientazioni, per quanto fedeli, rimangono scarne e poco curate.
Consigliato soltanto a un fan duro della saga.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085978728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2091, 'last_played': 1518985186}
review: Premessa io sono un amante del manga di berserk Ma questo gioco e' pessimo graficamente fatto male con bug che fanno impallare il gioco e una visuale orribile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108235797', 'num_games_owned': 4082, 'num_reviews': 550, 'playtime_forever': 4394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1499, 'last_played': 1576142835}
review:
I love Berserk but this game deserves 5/10 at best.
It's a good game for the first hours but then it gets repetitive way too quickly.
Game is way too easy no matter the difficulty, like every Musou games, you just have to level up and everything will be easy as a pie and even if you don't, it'll be easy as long as you don't get hit which is also very easy especially considering the enemies almost never attack you.
Content is very weak, very few playable characters, very few of everything but uneeded things (items).
Gameplay is too basic, like every Musou games.
Censored game, not enough gore, censored nudity, censored this, censored that. Welcome to 2018, people are to scared to even see drawn titties, blood and gore (thanks to the 'Merica).
Good music but could have been better.

Honestly, I can't recommend it, if it had a better and a more complex gameplay (a mix between The Witcher 3, Devil May Cry and Dark Souls, now that would have been something), at least 20 more playable characters, better and more detailed levels, new gamemodes instead of the same crap we see in every Musou games.
The game would have been amazing but it's not the case.

4.5/10 - I can't recommend it, I'm seriously annoyed by Koei Tecmo, their games are overpriced, they shouldn't be sold for more than 20$, that's why I hate Japanese console developers, they're so dumb, thinking their games is worth that much when it's not, every developers does it, not a reason to do it too. I paid 33$ for the game, I paid way too much for this and for all of their previous games, they never go under 15$ even though that's all what they're worth in the end.
Their ports are crap, lot of dialogue errors ("you" when it should be "your", it just proves how much they just don't care), no French language, too few playable characters, to few things to do, overpriced game.

Honestly, if they keep it like this, I'll just stop buying their games.
I know that fanboys out there will be mad because if people stop buying their games, they won't port them anymore to the PC but if they're too incompetents to bring good games to the PC then that's their fault, not ours.
This level of quality is the quality of a console game, not a computer game.
And a mediocre console game at best.

Final say: Don't buy this game except if you can get it for 10$ or less.
Also, I don't know what's wrong with Koei Tecmo, but their optimization is pure crap, can developers learn how to code properly? It would be the bare minimum to make games.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198072898012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1519, 'last_played': 1647699146}
review:
I really enjoyed playing this game alot! Just a shame that the maps were alot the same and some of the main bosses weren't really that unique to the other MPCs! Was alot of fun to play especially when you get the Beserk armour, so badass just love it!!! It does follow more closely to the manga than the TV show did in my eyes a little bit but then it didn't do some things that happened in the show and manga.

For example with that goat that had a snake as a well....

Though what both did was skip out on an arch but I can understand why that specific story arch would be skipped as it does involve children being killed and there has always been complaints of children being killed in video games..Especially in the way they are killed in the manga. 

I really suggest though if you enjoyed the game give the manga a read! Its really good or watch the 90's Beserk show I still like it more than the new version but I can't deny when Guts gets the beserk armour its EPIC!!! 
There are some certain things that did let me down a little bit but mostly I find it fun! ^ ^

author: {'steamid': '76561198116845938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1481, 'last_played': 1572263378}
review:
Ottimo titolo, essenziale per tutti gli amanti della saga, storia riprodotta fedelmente.
Abbastanza longevo se si vogliono trovare tutti gli sbloccabili.
Graficamente molto buono e ottimi i doppiaggi.
in sostanza un titolo che consiglio caldamente

author: {'steamid': '76561198144977179', 'num_games_owned': 1028, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1790, 'last_played': 1662658097}
review:
I would suggest this for a hardcore Berserk fan. People looking for a solid hack and slash who aren't Beserk fans are better suited picking up DQH2.

This is still a very good game though. Not for non-fans though. There are some slight story changes that might confuse people who aren't familiar with the source material.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965830188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1364, 'last_played': 1516367610}
review:
Dynasty warrior like game with Berserk characters and story? Dream come true.

Story mode follows the manga pretty well and this game went a lot farther in the story then I thought it would.

If your a fan, this is a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044351782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3416, 'last_played': 1516089245}
review:
Standard low-effort game you'd normally expect from the Dynasty Warriors series. 

The non-existant A.I. in this game is insulting (this is true for most if not all Musou titles). This game is the definition of brain dead. Now I do understand that the point of these games are to feel overpowered; so I guess you could enjoy this if you're a slack-jawed retard devoid of any taste.

And everyone giving this trash positive reviews because "It's Berserk" should be ashamed.

In conclusion, the only reasonable price tag I could attach to this steaming pile of shit is $15. Also, why is there no multiplayer?

author: {'steamid': '76561198127634703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1602127804}
review: I am writing this review for the sake of all my friends and those who are curious of the game. After 16 hours I finally beat the story. That's it. Just the story. The game covers everything from the very beginning, The Golden Arc to The Hawk of The Millennium Empire Arc. Certain missions have bonus objectives and if you compete all you get bonus collectibles. If you want to live the Berserk story and feel like a badass cutting through an army of people this is for you. Replayability is very much there as you can play for the bonus objectives as I said earlier, different characters and with different costumes. I encourage all to try if this is on your wishlist. 10/10 will play again very soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004038352', 'num_games_owned': 1696, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1534436431}
review:
Well, when I bought this I didn't expect much from the anime artstyle itself because it's related to the later movie trilogy that retells Berserk Golden Arc while my first contact with Berserk was in the 90's through the anime series that has a much better artstyle and storytelling when compared to these. Besides, I'm a long time fan of Musou games so I had some good expectations for it. How could you go wrong, right?

Well... Meh. It's just a mediocre hack n' slash game. Not even being a Musou helped much. First of all, it lacks the classic two player co-op which is a must for any Musou. The shop and item discovery system ain't rewarding and requires grinding over most stages in search of the same items with extra bonuses or plain leveling up until next level rather focusing on improving your own player skills. Enemies ain't smart, combos are overpowered and bosses have easy patterns although they've still got devasting 1 hit kill blows. In my opinion, it doesn't add anything new for the genre, even lacks basic features as I've mentioned before and also keeps rehashing same ugly movie stock cutscenes from the 2012 movie trilogy which is just awful, as a 90's Berserk fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100263038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1515555641}
review:
I love Berserk as much as the next reviewer, but this was pretty dissapointing and  just didn't "click" with me. 

Aside from there being pretty much no keyboard and mouse support, and lazy optimization...  It was just kinda boring.  I wasn't really feeling the "hack and slash combat" and hordes of enemies deal.  And plus the Golden age arc cutscenes are literally just taken straight from the movies, which I've seen about 3 times over by now.

BUT!

If you like this kind of mindless hack and slash, and haven't seen the movies yet, then this game would be a good fit for you.

review:

Oki, esta fue mi compra otaco del aÃ±o pasado lo compre por ser Berserk y poder jugar con Guts dejandome llevar por el hype de fangirl encabronad0. El juego en si es un dinasty warriors con skin de los personajes de berserk xD (acepten que nunca se va a poder adaptar fielmente berserk).

>A grandes rasgos: el juego es un "hack n slash" que yo siento mas como button smasher en el cual se narra la historia del manga/animu hasta llegar a la segunda parte del halcÃ³n milenario (cuando le dan su armadura a guts/llegan al barco) lo cual lo hace largo... es de hacer notar que el gameplay es full dynasty warriors... no esperes un juegazo o algo muy original; por otro lado, es de los pocos acercamientos sÃ³lidos en videojueguito a la obra de Kentaro Miura asÃ­ que si eres muy fan de su trabajo consideralo(?).

>lo bueno:
+manejas a Guts c:

+manejas a Guts aun mas enc4bronado c:<
+te da una duraciÃ³n de gameplay nada despreciable de 15hrs (si es que no le quitas la historia).
+La historia viene implementada con cutscenes de las pelis recientes con alta calidad de animaciÃ³n.

>Lo malo:
-Como toda adaptaciÃ³n de durrserk, le falta el capitulo de los niÃ±os perdidos :c

-Es repetitivo a madres...

-Tiene a mi antagonista favorito del manga de Miura: Gaston... (porque hay que sacarle provecho a la licencia, y exprimirla lo mas posible, poniendo niveles sin sentido argumental xD).

author: {'steamid': '76561198024629128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1517046970}
review:
EDIT:

I have played this game for about ten more hours than upon initial review, and all I can say is Koei really outdid themselves with this port. It is complete and utter shit. I have five runtime errors and counting (crashes), continual degradation of performance over each consecutive battle (load up game, start first battle at 60 fps, by fourth battle hitting MAYBE 25 fps), and other random performance hiccups. I know it isn't my system as I monitor my cpu, ram, gpu and ssd usage, and they are all under normal load.

The bosses are terrible. The combat lacks weight and screws up with certain hitboxes in movesets. Maps are recycled constantly. Tasks in missions are the same thing again and again (worse than standard Warriors fare). Graphics don't justify shitty performance. Music leaves little to be desired. Spliced in scenes from Berserk OVA jarring and is just more loading time to stretch out battles. 

Don't buy this game, even if on LOW LOW sale.

Please.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ORIGINAL:

I've been playing Koei/W-Omega games since when Dynasty Warriors 2 first launched as a kid. I've easily put thousands of hours into the collection of their games (with the most of that going into DW3/XL). I have read Berserk thrice through at different points of my life, and am definitely captivated by it.

My primary problem with this game is how clunky the combat is relative to other KT titles (primary DW). I don't really feel the right amount of weight or speed that I always perceived in the manga in this title. Hit boxes and mechanics for dueling enemies seems a little lackluster to say the least. I have had problems of attacks with secondary follow throughs not connecting because the enemy hits the ground beforehand. Enemies can stagger you pretty easy, even during your charged attacks (No hyperarmor) and have sometimes even pulled me out of an attack that would have easily been caught in the animation.

I'm still playing through it, but I am still having degrading framerate problems post forcing gpu fix and lowering environmental detail.

It's sad because Dynasty Warriors gameplay IS my childhood, and this game is relatively too simple in terms of scope and mechanical tightness to other previous titles. If I can find solutions to my problems, I shall revise my review.

I got this game as a gift, and I wouldn't pay for it unless it was >$5 USD.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991387553', 'num_games_owned': 1889, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1974, 'last_played': 1531636622}
review:
Totally a game made for fans of Berserk and musou-type games. It's not a great game, but goddamn it, the nostalgia really let's you get into it.

If KT ever puts the game on sale and you like the above, go for it.

review:
Have you ever wanted to be so manly that through your sheer manliness you could kill things way bigger than you? Well in come Guts with his MANLY SWORD OF POWER!!!! Guts is so BAMF that his sword originally oculdnt kill spirits and demons, so what did he do? Continue to beat the crap out of them until his sword was bathed in so much demon blood it actually became etheral and was able to kill the spirits and demons! Oh and that is canon! Talking about cannons Guts has one.... IN HIS ARM!!!! HE KILLS STUFF WITH HIS CANNON ARM!!!
BUY THIS GAME!!! EMBRACE THE MANLI-ESS-NESS OF GUTS!!!

Disclaimer: dont ever be him because his life suuuucccckkkkkssss

Fun game, a reskin of dynasty warriors, but if you like the anime you should enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102097216', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1514327820}
review:
Low on some BERSERK or you can't wait anymore for the next chapter. This game may smooth your pain!
Well haven't play any games from the Warrior series so this was my first time playing a game like this. 

[h1] GAMEPLAY [/h1]
There are heavy and normal attacks that you can chain them to perform some combos and gradually fill [b]Frenzy Mode[/b] by killing hordes of enemies. When using Frenzy Mode, you do tons of damage and yet again fills another meter that lets you perform a [b]Deathblow[/b], with that you can tear everybody in front of you apart. As for defense, other than Dash and block I don't think there is anything special (so far).
There are some items you can buy or unlock by playing missions(and also Endless Eclipse mode), some them are usable (Heal, Buff) and others you can wear as accessories that improves your attributes such as strength. In addition to those, there are also sub-weapons such as daggers, cannon that you can open for Guts as you progress to the story mode (different characters have different sub weapons). 
However, I know games like these are meant to be grindy but itâ€™s not for everybody and for me is big downside of it.

[h1] STORY [/h1]
Just finished [b] The Golden Age [/b]arc, must say they skip lots of important parts! If you are buying this game and you are planning to learn about the story for the first time, I suggest that its better off to just watch the anime or read the manga or you going to miss alot. 
If you already know the story, itâ€™s pretty fun going to some of the missions and playing as Guts and it sure brings back some memories.

 [h1] VISUALS & SOUNDS [/h1]
Character models are well made and some animation are pretty sick. However, some of the environments look bland and are they are reused in some missions. The sounds are good when you comparing it to the 2016 Berserk anime (that sword sound....) but they are nothing specials either. Voice actor for Guts is the one from the movies and the new series and as for the other character Iâ€™m not sure but they are well chosen voice actor if they are not the same.

 [h1] Overall [/h1]
The game is fun in some parts even for people like me who are new to this type of games. However, sometimes it gets grindy just doing the same stuff repeatedly. Well if you love Berserk, you gonna over look the cons and downsides of this game and enjoy ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069237160', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 3389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3143, 'last_played': 1606971711}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971139413', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1653507767}
review: It really HURTS me to have to do this to this game, but the game just isn't very good, which is a shame because the IP that it is based on is GREAT. This feels like a reskin of Dynasty Warriors and/or the Attack on Titan game (same dev). for about the first 5 hours of the game you will feel amazing as guts--chewing through soldiers like a scythe through grass, skillfully destroying enemies--but right about the time you get to the eclipse the game just gets lazy in terms of what it throws at you. It just makes you run through larger maps, do more menial tasks like free prisoners and fight more and more and more soldiers and bosses that are damn near impossible. The design got lazy. I can't recommend the game. Sure, if you see it on sale for $5 at some point...eh, maybe. you'll get a few hours of satisfying guts combat but beyond that it's just dull, lazy game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089289691', 'num_games_owned': 2958, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 2008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1911, 'last_played': 1513374180}
review:
[h1][b]Â¿QuÃ© es BERSERK and The Band of the Hawk?[/b][/h1]

Berserk Musuo es un videojuego hack and slash que sigue la formula Dinasty Warriors, pero en el universo de Berserk recreando los principales arcos de la saga abarcando â€œBlack Swordsmanâ€ a â€œFalcon of the Millenium Empireâ€. 

[b]LO BUENO[/b]

 Fiel en la temÃ¡tica de Berserk; los combates se sienten en muchas ocasiones como el manga
 Buenos grÃ¡ficos y escenarios vastos, aunque limitados.
 Una buena opcion si es que no quieren ver o leer el manga/anime.
 Bastante longevo.

[b]LO MALO[/b]

Muy repetitivo de por si. No ahonda demasiado en las mecanicas avanzadas de estrategia en tiempo real.
La ausencia de algunos personajes clave para jugar.
La ausencia de Susumu Hirazawa.
â€œLost Childrenâ€ va a seguir siendo inadaptable...

[b]Lo que me dejÃ³...[/b]

No hace mucho (menos de un aÃ±o) empece a leer Berserk. Lejos de hacer una review acerca del manga en vez del videojuego... a quien engaÃ±o?. Por supuesto que tengo que hablar del manga. Quizas sea la excusa perfecta para hacerlo.

Fuera de broma, Berserk Musuo abarca una enorme cantidad de material, que recapitula los tomos tankobon del 1 al 32, salteando algunos capitulos incluso arcos (Lost Children que por su contenido va a seguir siendo tirado abajo como material adaptable) pero que te lleva a los principales puntos bastante rapido y sin vueltas, claro que a cambio se pierde bastante de lo que hace Berserk una obra que va mas alla de Guts gritando en ira rabiosa, el gore y escenas de violencia explicita.

Con respecto al juego en si es entretenido a veces sentirse como Guts al blandir su enorme espada y cortar a la mitad a sus oponentes, lo que emula verdaderamente bien esos momentos de mayor tension del manga, aunque por seguir el formato de Berserk, no se puede hacer demasiado con las mecanicas de tomar bases o de moral del ejercito del cual participamos, lo que se deja de lado pasado algunas misiones.

Los modos extra como el Eclipse Mode son algo mediocre que mucho no aporta a la rejugabilidad, mas alla de desbloquear algunos extras que no son esenciales, pero con disfrutar la historia principal es mas que suficiente como para degustar los combates a gran escala y los mayores conflictos en Berserk.

Es una buena alternativa?. Si, si es que no queres ver el atroz anime del 2016-2017 que destroza la atmosfera y los momentos mas bellos del manga. Como videojuego es algo que a no todo el mundo podria gustar, como material de una obra de tercero es bastante fiel y como un conjunto es un buen titulo. No es la mejor adaptacion a formato de videojuego, pero es sin lugar a dudas una muy cercana.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070846161', 'num_games_owned': 1725, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1513199181}
review:
Well, it's pretty straight forward for me. It was fun until the eclipse, the lvl inside the exclipse erroded all fun away I had with the game. It's absolute garbage when you're trying to get to an enemy that is protected by tornados and stun-lock balls, while being slowed down by sometimes invisible sources. If they wanted to give the player the feeling helplessness then they succeded, but I don't play games to feel helpless, for that I can just read the Manga or watch the anime again. The fighting is pretty fun as long as they stay in the dynasty warriors formula, the moment they introduce anything they changed to match the story source material it gets bad or at least worse than dynasty warriors.
It's better to play a dynasty warriors game and then watch the anime/read the manga of Berserk again instead of this dissapointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046498526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1512834376}
review:
English below.

Kenner der Vorlage werden Band of the Hawk zumindest mÃ¶gen. Die Original-Geschichte ist sehr gut in Zwischensequenzen und InEngine-Dialog-Sequenzen nacherzÃ¤hlt. Und diesmal nicht nur â€Das goldene Zeitalterâ€œ sondern auch darÃ¼ber hinaus wird die Sage des Schwarzen Ritters erzÃ¤hlt. Bis zu dem Moment, in dem Guts auf Schierke trifft und die Berserker-RÃ¼stung erhÃ¤lt.

Der einzige Nachteil, der sich daraus ergibt ist die schiere Masse an Zwischensequenzen und Dialogen. Wird eine Mission gewÃ¤hlt starten 1 bis 3 Sequenzen, also 2 bis 20 Minuten, ehe in das MenÃ¼ zur Kampfvorbereitung geleitet wird. Nachdem der MenÃ¼-Punkt â€Start Battleâ€œ gewÃ¤hlt wird kommt meist noch eine weitere Zwischensequenz und auch wÃ¤hrend den Missionen kommt es hÃ¤ufig vor, dass Zwischensequenzen, von 30s bis 5 Minuten, den Spielfluss unterbrechen. Nach jeder erfolgreichen Mission gibt es â€¦ Ihr habt es sicher schon erraten: Zwischensequenzen und Dialoge. In der schwarzen Ritter Saga lÃ¤sst die QualitÃ¤t der Zwischensequenzen zudem nach, da es hier keinen Anime gibt aus dem sie hÃ¤tten herauskopiert werden kÃ¶nnen. Also gibt es nur ein paar InEngine-Rendersequenzen und viel Dialog.

Etwas befremdlich ist, dass das Gameplay zwar Ã¼beraus brutal und zu Berserk passend ist, die Kamera in den Zwischensequenzen aber wegschwenkt wenn es blutig wird.
Zum GlÃ¼ck sind alle Videos Ã¼berspringbar, wenn Missionen wiederholt werden wollen um Bonusziele zu erreichen.

Diese Masse an Zwischensequenzen ist ungewohnt, aber notwendig um die sehr gute Geschichte korrekt zu erzÃ¤hlen, denn das Gameplay gibt leider nicht viel her um die Geschichte darin einzubinden. Guts metzelt sich durch Hunderte von Standardgegnern. Verdrischt nebenbei ein paar Leutnants und hin und wieder einen Apostel. Immer mit den gleichen  Angriffskombos. Die Missionsgebiete sind meist statisch ohne groÃŸe InteraktionsmÃ¶glichkeiten. Der Hebel um ein Tor zu Ã¶ffnen, ist einen entsprechenden Leutnant zu zerstÃ¼ckeln. Gameplay wie man es aus Dynasty Warriors 3 ff., Kessen, oder One Piece -  Pirate Warriors kennt und ggf. mag.

Oben drauf gibt es ein Rollenspielsystem, das diesen Namen eigentlich nicht verdient. Kombos werden leicht erweitert. Alle Werte steigen automatisch an. Deren Auswirkungen sind kaum feststellbar. Als AusrÃ¼stung gibt es nur Ringe, Ketten und Fahnen, die eben diese Werte leicht modifizieren, aber nirgends sichtbar sind. Waffen und RÃ¼stungen Ã¤ndern sich entsprechend der Geschichte, haben aber sonst keine Auswirkungen. (Von der Armkanone mal abgesehen.)

Ich mag das Spiel, weil ich auch die Vorlage mag und weil es auch Ã¼ber das mehrfach ausgeschlachtete goldene Zeitalter hinaus geht. Ich kann aber auch jeden verstehen, der das Spiel nicht gut findet weil das Gameplay zu eintÃ¶nig ist. Interessierte sollten dennoch auf den nÃ¤chsten Sale warten. Der Vollpreis ist fÃ¼r das Gebotene meiner Meinung nach zu hoch.

 ------------------

Fans of the original template will probably like Band of the Hawk. The story is well presented in cut scenes and ingame-dialogs. And this time beyond The Golden Age. The saga of the Black Swordsman is told, until the moment Guts meets Schierke and gets the Berserker-Armor.

The one thing off about this is the enormous number of cut scenes and dialogs. If you choose a mission you get 1 till 3 cut scenes of 2 to 20 Minutes until you reach the Battle Preparation screen. You choose Start Battle and get another cut scene. Often during a mission several other cut scenes start, and after you won .. you guessed it: cut scenes.

Odd is, that the gameplay is â€“ Berserk-like â€“ outragous brutal, but in the cut scenes the camera shows only the bloodless angles with some screems off camera.
The good thing: All those cut-scenes are skippable, if you want to replay a mission for bonus goals.

This gigantic number of cut scenes is unusual, but necessary to tell the story. The gameplay isnâ€™t fit to tell the story correct. Guts slashes through hundreds standard foes, beats a few lieutenants by the side and cuts an apostle once in a while. You'll be pressing the same combos over and over again. The mission areas are mostly static without interaction points. The key to open a door is to cut the lieutenant down guarding it. If you like that gameplay, presented in Dynasty Warriors 3 ff. , Kessen or One Piece â€“ Pirate Warriors you will like this game.

On top of this is a roleplay-system, that defies the definition of roleplay. Combos get enhanced â€“ automatically. Statistic values, like vitality or strength rise â€“ automatically. Loot is presented as rings, necklaces and banners wich enhance the statistic values but are not visible. Weapons and armor change during the story but that means nothing in a gameplay perspective. (Except the arm cannon.)

I like the game, because I like the original template. But I can understand everyone who doesnâ€™t like it. The gameplay is too thin and drab. Those who are interested should wait for the next sale. What is offered is good but not worth the 60$ price tag.
