author: {'steamid': '76561198051325657', 'num_games_owned': 1820, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1497190217}
review:
Je suis fan des Dynasty Warriors mais pas vraiment de Berserk (je l'ai lu quand j'Ã©tais gamin mais Ã§a remonte). En terme de jeu, BatBotH est ultra rÃ©pÃ©titif, plus qu'un Musou car il y a trÃ¨s peu de personnages et de toutes faÃ§ons vous allez jouer Guts 95% du temps (parce c'est obligÃ©) et peu de custo de perso. Pareil, vu que les missions ne sont pas des batailles rangÃ©es, elles sont assez rÃ©pÃ©titives (tuez tout le monde. point.).

NÃ©anmoins, le jeu reste propre (pour un Omega Force), j'ai (re)dÃ©couvert le scÃ©nario (excellent) de Berserk, avec de nombreux extraits tirÃ©s de l'anime et j'ai vraiment passÃ© un bon moment. BatBotH est trÃ¨s accessible pour un Musou et Ã§a fait plaisir. Bref, je le conseille pour ceux qui veulent dÃ©couvrir le genre ou qui aiment le Lore. J'ai passÃ© une petite quinzaine d'heure dessus avec grand plaisir, et mÃªme si je n'ai pas poussÃ© le mode Endless Eclipse, je pense que ce n'est pas trop la peine que je m'y attarde (comme je l'ai dit, peu de custo, peu de persos).

author: {'steamid': '76561198333589938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1505946873}
review: This is definitely a fresh take on the on going dark tale of Berserk.  The game plays like your typical Warriors game, but just has a Berserk spin on it being all of the demons and monsters being there for Guts to lay waste to.  Reliving some of the battles in the manga definitely feels great with fiends such as Griffith or Zodd. If you are a Berserk fan, this is definitely a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038669516', 'num_games_owned': 1850, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 1782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1782, 'last_played': 1490386860}
review:
No es el mejor musou que haya jugado, le faltan opciones y personajes para ello, pero si es una magnÃ­fica adaptaciÃ³n de la historia de Berserk y eso son palabras mayores.

En el modo historia recorres todo el manga hasta lo Ãºltimo publicado, es sin lugar a dudas la parte estrella del juego aunque al principio se hace algo tediosa con tantÃ­simos videos uno detrÃ¡s de otro, pero si no has visto las pelÃ­culas o no las tienes frescas los disfrutarÃ¡s pues son de una gran calidad â€“los extractos estÃ¡n sacados tal cual de la Ãºltima trilogÃ­a-. Una vez se ha superado ese arco los videos estÃ¡n hechos con el motor del juego, son simples pero cumplen su funciÃ³n.

El modo Eclipse Eterno me parece tedioso y mal implantado, especialmente porque las recompensas que dan no tienen valor para la dificultad que supone llegar hasta el final. Y encima hay que completarlo con todos los personajes y todas las batallas de cada uno de ellos. Insufrible.

Se pueden jugar escaramuzas, es decir, batallas rÃ¡pidas en un escenario ya superadoâ€¦ y para de contar. Ni online, ni cooperativo, ni ningÃºn modo mÃ¡s. AdemÃ¡s, al hecho de que hay pocos personajes se le unen cosas como que cada personaje tiene solo un ataque especial, cuando en muchos otros musous puedes usar mÃ¡s (hablo de memoria pero me parece recordar que en DW8 cada hÃ©roe tiene 3).

Si te gusta Berserk te encantarÃ¡, si solo te gustan los musous los hay mejores. Si no te llaman ninguno de los dos no merece la pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013038462', 'num_games_owned': 1270, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1631923600}
review:
Nicht ganz das, was man von den Mosou-Games kennt, das Baseneroberungssystem z.B. existiert fast kaum.
Das Gameplay orientiert sich schon eher an einer einzelnen Person (meistens Guts), die sich den Weg zu Ihren Ziel freikÃ¤mpfen muss.

Das Spiel deckt Storytechnisch eine menge ab, jedoch sollte man das Universum schon ein wenig kennen, bevor man sich ins getÃ¼mmel wirft. Die Gegnermassen wurden nach Mosou-Manier etwas hochgedreht, was Guts fast in jeder schlacht zum 1000-Mann-SchlÃ¤chter werden lÃ¤sst. Storytechnisch natÃ¼rlich total unpassend aber vom Gameplay her macht es sau laune.

Die Golden Age Arc Verfilmungen sind Ã¼brigens in kleinen Teilen im Original in das Spiel eingebaut worden, sodass man aus dem Film bekannte Szenen noch einmal gucken kann. Passt sehr gut in den Storyverlauf.

Meiner Meinung nach schade, dass der 2016 herausgekommene Anime nicht auch simultan eingebaut wurde, aber sowas kann man selbstverstÃ¤ndlich auch nicht erwarten.
Das Bedeutet, dass ab dem Black Swordsman Arc keine Anime-Szenen mehr zu sehen sind. Die Handlung ist der Serie trotzdem fast 1 zu 1 nachempfunden.

*Ich kann leider nicht fÃ¼r den Manga sprechen, da ich diesen nicht gelesen habe, deswegen orientiere ich mich am Audiovisuellen.

TL;DR;
Ein Dynastywarriors, im Berserk-Universum, jedoch mit weniger "Eroberung" und mehr "Slaughter" :>

author: {'steamid': '76561198025166508', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2251, 'last_played': 1572145646}
review:
As a HUGE fan of both Koei games AND the manga BERSERK, I think the game is excellent.
Though, the acheivements, as Koei always put them, are sometimes SERIOUSLY time consuming and\or hard as balls. Also, the AI, again as expected from Koei, is incredibly frustrating. I got stuck in corners or the likes because some ennemies were spamming the same knockbacks moves...
But still, love the game, graphics are very good and it covers 30+ volumes of the manga series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044950151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4274, 'last_played': 1489923986}
review:
Berserk and the Band of the Hawk can be described as Dynasty Warriors with the setting, characters, and stories from Kentaro Miura's "Berserk" manga series. You run around open levels, bashing the living hell out of hordes of enemies, leveling up your character, collecting items, and gathering gold in order to buy items, all in order to increase your characters stats.

In addition to the typical Musou/ Dynasty Warriors levels, where you run a round a somewhat open area beating up dudes, Berserk also boasts a mode called "Endless Abyss", where you fight your way through levels, completing challenges and gaining gold as you progress further down the abyss. The further down you get, the more difficult the fights become, but the rewards also become better, giving you more money and better items. This mode is giving a rogue-lite spin by integrating perma-death, meaning that if you die, you will have to go back to the start and try again (unless you have passed a threshold level, in wich case you can start from that level.)

If you like Dynasty Warriors, you will probably enjoy this game. The gameplay is a bit mindless and button-mashy, but sometimes that's just fine in my opinion. If, like me, you love the source material, you will also find som enjoyment in playing as Guts, Griffith, Judeau, Scorpio, and a handfull of other characters from the Berserk universe. The characters feel distinct, and they fight like you'd imagine they'd fight (I.E, Guts is somewhat slow with his swings but hits like a truck, Griffith is lightning fast with his rapier, and so on). Fans may also find some enjoyment in the in-game glossary (giving some backround information about the universe of Berserk), gallery, cut-scenes from the movies, and the stories taken straight from the manga (specifically, it starts with The Black Swordsman arc, and ends with the infamous boat).

If you don't like Dynasty Warriors or Berserk, you can safely stay away, however. This game will not change your mind on either. For the fans however, it is a pretty good time.

Summary:
+ Simple gameplay, easy to pick up and play
+ The playable characters feel distinct and play like you would expect them to
+ Follows the manga quite closely
+ Decent, if not great, fan service
+ Endless abyss mode puts a rogue-lite spin on the Dynasty Warriors formula, a welcome breath of fresh air in an otherwise repetetive game
+ The best looking Musou/Dynasty Warriors game to date

- The gameplay can be a little TOO simple, and the game is very easy on the default difficulty
- As previously stated, the game gets a repetetive after a while
- The optimization isn't great. It runs fine, but will dipp soewhat during the most extreme brawls
- Would have liked to see more playable characters, like Skull Knight (you can ride his horse but not play as him?)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972371598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1542592611}
review:
It's in Guts' character to swing his sword over and over and over and over again until night becomes day and then night again so this sort of gameplay style suits it perfectly.  

This is coming from a person who's avoided Dynasty Warrior games like the plague.  

The subject matter helps, of course, so if you're a fan of Berserk - chances are you'll love this little gem.  Play it, beat it, go back with other characters if you like, or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036357874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1390, 'last_played': 1494079307}
review:
Gioco che non offre nulla di diverso da un qualsiasi altro musou (vedi la dynasty warriors saga) e che non spicca sicuramente per il gameplay ma si fa apprezzare per l'opportunitÃ  che offre al giocatore di riesplorare la storia del famosissimo manga.
Per essere piÃ¹ precisi quello che si andrÃ  a rivivere sarÃ  la storia rivista e rivisitata dall'anime della trilogia "Golden Age Arc", trilogia la quale ha qualche "difetto" dovuto alle eccessive licenze poetiche che hanno cambiato incredibilimente determinati momenti e sensazioni caratteristiche del manga stesso.
Quindi se siete fan della serie ma ancor di piÃ¹ della trilogia di film (da non confondere con il vecchio e stupendo anime [1997/1998] e tanto meno con la serie animata del 2016/2017 ancora in corso) vi farÃ  passare dei bei momenti.
A patto che abbiate un buon controller e tanta volglia di premere sempre gli stessi 2 tasti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087778835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1546021763}
review:
It's an alternative way of re-experiencing the manga/anime that is well made and interesting enough.
Not a big musou fan but the combat is cathartic and pretty fun in short bursts.
The game also packs lots of content.
Performance wise I'm on recommended settings and it works great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156034706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2237, 'last_played': 1570254251}
review:
Lo dirÃ© como a mi me hubiera gustado que me lo dijeran antes de comprarlo. Primero abordando dos cuestiones que considero importantes, si succede como juego y si es una buena adaptaciÃ³n de Berserk. (La conclusiÃ³n la pondre al inicio para quien no quiera leer todo).

CONCLUSION
En mi opinion a los desarrolladores les ha quedado Berserk como a Puck le quedarÃ­a una armadura de Guts: terriblemente grande. MÃ¡s que ser un juego de Berserk es mÃ¡s bien un juego de Musou con skin de Berserk. Es moderadamente divertido, sobre todo en el Golden Age arc, pero la pesima adaptaciÃ³n a la fuente evito que pudiera disfrutarlo mÃ¡s. Si eres un fan de Berserk que se conoce bien sus mitos y desconoces o no te gustan los Musous, definitivamente pasa de este titulo o espera a que este al 80% de descuento.

Â¿Es un buen juego?
Olvidemonos un segundo que es Berserk. Honestamente es divertido, las batallas son muy grandes, y el modo eclipse nos da un descanso del modo historia, ademas de que puedes jugar con varios personajes con estilos diferentes El crafting de equipo es interesante y ... hasta aquÃ­ creo que llegan las cosas buenas para mi.
La forma en que presentan la historia ... oh dios... mejor habrÃ­a sido que se ahorraran el poco esfuerzo. Es mi primer musou, pero si asÃ­ es su idea de presentar la historia de un juego, que decpcionante. Cuando vi que meterÃ­an escenas de la pelicula me emocione, PERO ESA ES LA PEOR RAZON PARA COMPRARLO y sinceramente mejor ve a ver la pelicula. La edicion, la musica, el ritmo, todo esta mal, tanto me aburria o me causaba (no se la traducciÃ³n adecuada para "cringe") que termine saltandome todas las escenas. La gente se queja de la reciente temporada del 2016, pero si el caso entre el maga-serie de 2016 es como comparar un omelet preparado por uno de los mejores chefs y un huevito revuelto hecho en casa, en el apartado de la historia este juego es como si nos presentara un huevo ya podrido y verde que se le cayo al suelo y ni tuvo la decencia de recoger. Las escenas originales del juego se les ve pereza al hacerlo y ademas tienes que ir a un submenu para acceder a casi la mitad o mÃ¡s de estas. En este titulo, la historia y el juego esta tan separado como pocas veces he visto. 

Â¿Es una fiel adaptaciÃ³n de Berserk?
Superficialmente, si. Pero eso no implica que sea buena. Aqui de nuevo hay dos partes que considero, el como adaptan el argumento, y como adaptan el material a la parte jugable. 
En cuanto al argumento: lo que yo veo es que no han terminado de entender de que va Berserk. Esta obra tiene miedo de adaptar las partes que causan polemica y sin embargo tan necesaria para la escencia de la obra en que se basa, ya que si Berserk no tiene miedo de plasmar ciertas cosas es precisamente porque tiene algo que decir o que quiere trasmitir. La crudeza del mundo real, esa a la que muchos hacen ojos ciegos y cuando les pega a ellos son los primeros en quebrarse. Esa crudeza es a la que se ha enfrentado Guts, y se levanta no importa cuantas veces lo haga tambalearse y le permite sanar, le permite volver a confiar en la gente y tratar de encontrar su lugar en el mundo y asÃ­ nos damos cuenta de la conmovedora fuerza de este personaje. En este juego Guts mata a los monstruos y enemigos solo porque estan en el camino. No termina de transmitir la malicia que llegan a tener, la corrupciÃ³n y vileza. El juego falla rotundamente en mostrarnos porque son nuestros enemigos y solo nos los pone en el camino y cuando los matas pasa al que sigue. Si no tienes un buen villano o grandes adversidades, los logros del heroe no tienen tanto merito.
Un ejemplo es con Wylon, que es la primera vez que sale fuera del manga. Cuando leÃ­ la parte en que aparece, me causo una sensaciÃ³n unica de una combinaciÃ³n de miedo, repugnancia, impotencia y frustraciÃ³n. AquÃ­ ese personaje casi da risa y mucha vergÃ¼enza. El es un mosntruo, pero no tiene que ver con que sea un apostol, era un monstruo desde antes que se volviera uno, siendo solo humano, y el juego falla en retratarlo como tal.

Ahora a nivel jugable. Demasiado fÃ¡cil. Tuve que iniciar en el nivel de dificultad mÃ¡s alta para sentir que estaba en el mundo de Berserk, y se ve que el juego no esta diseÃ±ado para pasarlo asÃ­, porque apenas derrote a Mozgus y ya tengo rato que llegue al tope de nivel de experiencia y no sube mÃ¡s. No hay coherencia de dificultad con los enemigos (los humanos resisten bastante para estar peleando contra Guts sin cubrirse siquiera y muchos monstruos son demasiado debiles para ser monstruos). No hay seguimiento adecuado de la historia en muchas partes (aunque el Golden arc esta bastante bien en ese aspecto), por ejemplo al dirigirse a la torre de la convicciÃ³n entra matando fantasmas y demas, y no hay tal en la historia (le ayudan a entrar a escondidas y ya dentro inicia el caos). DESAPARECEN LOS ENFRENTAMIENTOS CON ENEMIGOS QUE DEBIERON SER SUPER JEFAZOS COMO EL APOSTOL CABRA Y LOS ANGELES. De hecho en la cueva soldados tambien son poseidos (a nivel argumental es una falasia porque de haber sido, no se habrian mantenido tan firmes en su posiciÃ³n en contra de los herejes por ser afectados ellos tambien). Los gadgets de Guts se sienten relativamente adecuados en fuerza y cantidad a excepciÃ³n de la ballesta: muy debil, y muchas flechas. Se supone que con una deberÃ­a matar o casi a cada humano normal, y aqui le puedes disparar como 20 y no cae.
Ahora bien, tambien ha tenido momentos muy muy buenos que me hicieron sentir en el universo de Berserk, como la primera pelea contra Zod, o la batalla de Doldrey, pero al final son momentos muy escasos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345330244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1493593315}
review:
I started reading the berserk manga last week and became instantly addicted to every aspect of this truly unique universe. So i finished it in around 5 days. 

So naturally i just had to check out the game.

And i have to say that i am pleasently surprised by what i'm seeing, playing and experiencing. I never played a dynasty warriors game or anything similar to it, so my hopes were not high for this game, since i understand that this game and dynasty warriors have a lot in common. 

The game's story covers pretty much everything besides the lost children arc, which is a shame, but understandable since it was never about fighting as much as the other chapters. The downside of including everything is simply that the game is only supported by anime cinematics for around 1/3 of the game, after that? Only in game cinematics, which can deliver, but are very rare. So the game's storytelling loses it's grip after the eclipse. Another huge downside is the fact that the game just rushes through some plotpoints, and almost only showing off guts's point of view. A lot of important information is lost and i honestly don't know how someone without prior knowledge is supposed to understand the truly important character storylines and why this or that is happening. The player will for example not understand why in the fuck farnese follows guts all of a sudden. She does not get a single cutscene or context. SHe's just standing there all of a sudden. 

Berserk readers will know that there are 2 kind of basic parts of the storyline. Golden arc, and everything beyond that: Why is that? SImple. Golden arc=Prequel without demons, beyond=with demons. Fighting the demons after the eclipse is waay more fun. and i'm glad to say that there are quite a lot of demon types here. So the second half of the game felt better to me. 

Speaking of killing demons. The gameplay is what you would expect. Fuckload of enemies and one fucking huge sword. The gameplay is kind of basic in the beginnig, but it gains more and more features as you progress the story. And yeah, killing 200 demons in 1 sword swing never gets old. What i'm trying to say is: The gameplay is solid and stays consistent. You will definatly have your fun here. And being the blackswordsman does feel like being the real deal. enemies run from you, demons piss in their pants and nothing can really withstand you. Besides like one or two enemies amongst like 400 enemies on screen. One more positive thing before we move on: The swordswing animations are really spot on. Watching guts swing that thing around makes your blood boil. It feels and looks heavy, enemies splatter all over the battlefields and you can call down real bloodstroms. 

So on to the bossfights... I'll get straight to the point. These bossfights are mostly fucking shit. I found one or two cool, the rest was boring and more a chore than a fight. This game is designed to fight huge hordes of enemies, not bosses. I understand why these fights are in here. But the execution is so shit that i just cannot give them credit for them. These bosses will not get staggered by your attacks and the tracking on their attacks is borderline ridiculous. Blocking doesn't do shit and feels unresponsive on top of it all. I will describe the Zodd fight real quick: Run in a cricle and get a hit off every 20 minutes. The game tries to be dark souls, and gets fancy with mechanics, but it just does not work. BUT i will pat the devs on the back for the amount of bossfights they put in the game. You fight pretty much everything that was in the manga. From bazuso to the kelpie. Everything you would expect is here. But, you know, the fights suck, mostly. 

This brings me to the characters. You have 8 playable characters in this game. which does not sound like a lot. But every character has multiple skins, which do change the fighting style and move sets severly. They should have called these character versions, and not skins. So take the number 8 with a grain of salt. Just one little thing on the side though: A lot of charcaters are in the game with their own moves and everything, but they are not playable. Why is that? Stupid decision by the devs. Especially Skull Knight. Fucker fights by your side at times but is not playable. 

 I'm happy to say though that the characters that are avalaible do all feel distinctly different from one another. And some of them make you feel like a battlefield god at that. Playing with Zodd's beastform for the first time was just insanly fun. But schierke is just as powerful. Her attacks can light up the whole battlefield. And don't get me started about the berserk armor. That shit feels just as strong as it does look in the manga. Insane i tell you. 

The game does have random generated dungeons you can progress through until you die. You can unlock additional skins here and it will always be a little bit different every time. Jsut wanted to mention this. I did not touch this mode myself yet, though.   

So all things considered? Good game that will make you suffer during bossfights here and there. But will ultimatly deliver a lot of fun.  

Berserk fan? Buy. Dynasty fan? Buy. Everyone else? Check out the source material first. You can watch the og berserk in it's entirety on yt for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024079206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1487960696}
review:
It's all good that so many people liked it. For me, it was obvious that it wasn't for me in under 2 hours (thankfully).

The problem with this game is that it doesn't even feel like yet another slightly-tweaked Warriors clone. Yes, you read that right. Because all I expected from this game was that it would turn out to be either an entirely reconsidered Warriors clone or one that was at least true to the Warriors concept. I mean I would be fine, if I could at least get the Warriors experience. As other people also noted, most mechanics (like base captains) seem to have been deconstructed and left that way. They are simply meaningless and incompatible.

The really annoying fps issues are just the icing on the cake (or the feather on the manure pile, as one certain idiom says). I don't know if this was ever fixed or patched, as I got a refund, but it's unacceptable.

And what is with all that loading? Every little event comes with a long loading sequence that is frankly enough to make you want to just throw that controller/mouse-keyboard away and do something else instead of wasting your time.

Sure, it seems that Berserk fans are thrilled anyway, but not me. I am sorry Koei. I believe you failed with this one.

Just remember, especially if you aren't an avid fan of the manga/anime and if you are expecting at least a decent Warriors clone, you are going to be disappointed. In case you still want to try despite that, I recommend waiting until it gets a discount (a hefty one hopefully).

One final recommendation: Just skip all those cutscenes. As I mentioned before, the loading times are already unreasonably long. You wouldn't want to waste more of your 2-hour trial time with the cutscenes. Make sure you actually like what they did with the game and that you will keep it first. Then it's always possible for you to go back and see the cutscenes for your viewing pleasure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998307183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1501057043}
review:
I've waited long to play this game (the PS4 version was way more expencive). So I bought it on PC, I downloaded it, I played it, I finished it and...I liked it! Well, the game is really damn repetitive, but fun as hell. I especially like Conviction Arc the most just because of the astetics. Some bosses were fun, like Mozgus and Zodd in his Apostole form. And, oh my God, the Berserker Armor is amazing!!!!! Too much praise: allmost no variety; no challenge; battle system is fun, but actually entirelly pointless; veeeery little number of actual cuscense.
So, Berserk and The Band of The Hawk is above averedge - 6,5\10. I really can't give more, even though I love Berserk so much. But, with that said, I deffenetely recomend this game, if you're a fan.

review:

Price is WAAAAY to expensive though, there isn't much mechanics in game. You just level-up your character, enhance and equip 3 items, add a few potions and stuff and that's it.

7/10 overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053788394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1500223279}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198121074356', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1492584528}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005154046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3654, 'last_played': 1582375670}
review:
The gameplay is fast, fun and a never ending stream of enemies to kill, pretty fitting as a Berserk game. The most annoying aspect of the gameplay is getting stunlocked by either spears or heavy and fast hitting bosses into a corner with no chance to act. 

The story is an alright adaptation of the manga and pretty much on point for the most part. Though they do skip several parts in the story they could have well adapted into the game, but I do think that's because there is nudity and controversy in those parts of the story. Why they thought it necessary to censor out those parts still dumbfound me. Because the people who buy and play this game is probably going to be Berserk fans, and with that they already have seen those scenes before, so to censor it only takes away from the experience. There is also some grammar errors here and there but nothing too distracting.

The conecept of unlocking playable characters, skins and other items from the manga is also very fun and gives you a reason to continue playing even after you're done with the story mode. It can get repetitive but changing your character will keep the gameplay interesting enough if you enjoy the core gameplay, which is to hack, slash and smash hordes of enemies. 

On a low note, the game crashes, a lot. It is very frustrating when you have come a good bit in the "Endless Abyss" mode, basically a mode where you keep playing missions without being able to save the progress except on determined levels, and then the game crashing resulting in you losing all your progress.

If they would come out with an update and fix the crashes it would greatly enhance the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034643097', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1587403440}
review:
First off, I really like this game but for 60 bucks you ain't really getting much.
You get the story up quite far.
It still has censored a few parts of the story but its understandable since they coudent sell the game if it had everything the manga had.

Anyways it took me about 19 hours to finish the game in one sitting.
And it was way too easy, I was playing on Hard instead of Berserk because well.
You cant start it on Berserk otherwise you die immediatly in one to two hits which while being a challenge, is more of a headache as EVERYTHING kills you in 1-2 hits.

The gameplay is really repetitive but satisfying, the attacks, controls and whatnot.
STill I would have liked to be able to jump attack enemies.

Buy it off a sale, dont buy at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053284227', 'num_games_owned': 921, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1488992126}
review:
TLDR: If you're looking for a Musou game, avoid: Bad AI, poor graphics, small rooster, derivative missions.
          I'm a die-hard Berserk fan and while I enjoyed seeing again most characters, this was a boring, thin-spread, total conversion mod that left me asking: "Forget the money, I want my 14 hours back.."

Long Review:

Berserk is a great license which has deep conflicted characters, exceptional atmosphere and world creation, and a thrilling story.
This game is more of a same-old Musou game that feels pushed to its dated engine trying to fit the license content without much luck.

Many character models have been created with great love and the OVA contents are a plus.

The problem is how boring the game is, as it tries to increase difficulty by throwing thousands of the exact same enemy, which is almost static and never poses a threat.
There is certain character evolution, along the story, but the level up and item management parts are completely pointless.
There are some game modes beside the story to increase content, that include survival and quests, though they don't provide any novelty over the story mode as you will be repeating similar missions.

And while the OVA videos are great, there are tons of visual adventure dialogs that are unnecessary, and in some cases, over-explain story details already told in the OVA sequences.

While the main character models are great, both the scenarios and music look rushed. One of the main perks of Berserk is the locations, and those appear a great-value effort rather than the real deal. Doldrey is the biggest offender, converting those large battles in the desert with a large castle looming into a football hooligan skirmish over a brown poodle in front of White Castle.

I dedicated 14 hours of my life to like this, but I'll rather spend that time brushing my front carpet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063592473', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2239, 'last_played': 1491572842}
review:
Ok i will start by saying it that this game is worth it only if you are a Berserk fan, and wants to see the manga story animated. The game itself is not so good. 

First - it is too easy, even in the hardest difficulty (Berserker mode), the game offers no challenge, just a bunch of paper enemies for you to mash buttons. The only nice battles are against the apostles.

2nd - Too little strategy. Musou games should be about making smart choices in the battlefield, Berserk is just too simple (kill the general, help someone somewhere), and it is funny because it was the same studio that developed Dragon Quest Heroes, and DQH is sooooo much better musou game.

3rd - Gameplay is fast, but too limited. You push X about five to six times, and its a combo, u push Y in the middle of the Xs spam, and gatts will do a variation, you can cancel attacks with dash, which is nice. 

To make it short, if you want to play a good musou game, go play something else. If you want to play a berserk game, this is the one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129384137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 5950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2956, 'last_played': 1670949419}
review:
Nothing new; but a darker dyntasy warriors game.
If you do not enjoy the Musou games do not play it. I'm partial to them; mostly bought to support Beserk franchise and also support Musou franchise! Im really dying for a Torikio musou game.

Pros- Tons of combat; beautiful graphics; smooth gameplay; anything Beserk is pretty much gold honestly unless your some sissy man.

Cons- Repetive; nothing really new. Just homage to one of the worlds greatest manga sagas.

UPDATE: 6/12/2017
still playing in my free time. this game is actually GREAT. Guts is so well done. <3 definately worth a pick up if your a fan of the musou series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074229855', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1266, 'last_played': 1492457998}
review:
Rest in Peace, KentarÅ Miura! T_T


Zu allererst einmal, "BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk" ist vom Gameplay her kein wirklich gutes Spiel. Stumpfes gemetzel, groÃŸteils harmlose Gegner, sich oft wiederholende Karten mit wenig optischen Abwechslungen und recht wenige CombofÃ¤higkeiten.

Warum ich "BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk" trotzdem empfehle? Naja, das hat eher persÃ¶nliche GrÃ¼nde.
Ich bin ein riesen Fan des Manga seit er das erste mal in Deutschland erschienen ist! FÃ¼r mich gibt es einfach keinen besseren. (Schade nur das es immer so lange dauert bis ein neuer Band erscheint :P )

- Dieses Spiel ist meiner Meinung nach eher fÃ¼r Fans gedacht die einfach mal die KÃ¤mpfe aus dem Manga und den Anime selbst erleben wollen. Denn was dieses Spiel ziemlich gut rÃ¼ber bringt ist das Feeling von Berserk! Man schlachtet sich durch endlose Horden von Soldaten und Monstern ohne groÃŸ Ã¼berlegen zu mÃ¼ssen.
FÃ¼r Fans die von Anfang an die Serie verfolgen ist es eine gute Gelegenheit sich noch mal all die Ereignisse der Vergangenheit und die Charaktere ins GedÃ¤chtnis zu rufen.
FÃ¼r Spieler die "Berserk" nicht kennen ist dieses Spiel wohl eher nichts. Zumal die Story hier auch viele LÃ¼cken hat und TeilweiÃŸe sehr komisch Zeit und StorysprÃ¼nge vorkommen wo man sich, wenn man die Manga nicht gelesen hat, fragt was da grade passiert ist.

- Die Grafik ist gar nicht mal so schlecht! Nichts super herrausragendes aber durchaus passend. Auch wenn alles ein wenig steif wirkt, die Charakter Modelle sehen echt klasse aus. Zudem wirft das Spiel zwischen den Leveln immer mal wieder Szenen aus der Anime Serie ein. Allerdings auch nur fÃ¼r die erste HÃ¤lfte des Spiels, ab der Zweiten muss man sich mit Ingame CG Sequenzen begnÃ¼gen da die Serie bisher noch nicht soweit war.
Es ist blutig, ja, aber bei weitem nicht so brutal wie die Manga. Da hÃ¤tten sie durchaus noch ein paar Schippen drauflegen kÃ¶nnen.

- Die Musik allerdings ist fast schon unauffÃ¤llig bis langweilig. Wer Songs wie "Forces" oder "Aria" erwartet wird enttÃ¤uscht werde. Die Soundeffekt sind okay. Viel geschreie und gemetzel halt ;P
Japanische Sprachausgabe mit englischen Untertiteln.

- Kein Multiplayer.

- Wiederspielwert hÃ¤lt sich auch in Grenzen. Wenn man die Story einmal durch hat (Spoiler: Das Spiel hat ein offenes Ende! Fans werden sich darÃ¼ber wohl kaum wundern.) hat man noch den Endless Eclipse Mode aber das wars dann auch schon.

Alles in allem wÃ¼rde ich sagen das "BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk" nur was fÃ¼r eingefleischte Fans ist und nichts fÃ¼r Spieler die "Berserk" nicht kennen. Ich persÃ¶nlich hatte einen riesen SpaÃŸ mit dem Spiel, muss aber zugeben das, wenn es nicht ein "Berserk" Spiel wÃ¤re, es viel von seinem Reiz fÃ¼r mich verloren hÃ¤tte. Empfehlen kann ich das Spiel, ja, aber vielleicht nicht unbedingt zum vollen Preis. Wartet lieber bis es im Angebot ist!

author: {'steamid': '76561198106566973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2560, 'last_played': 1542769826}
review:
I was hoping there would be more to this game, but I did enjoy the anime/cg cutscenes theyve inserted in. 
The roster, given that its a Koei game, is relatively small and doesnt add anything to the story; if you play as different characters, you'd be a dobbleganger in a level that has your selected character in it if its not Guts. 

Other than story, they have free mode, and a challenge mode, which are about it. Theres no real reason to play them unless you want to get 100% in the gallery section.

I only recommend this game because I was itching for a Berserk game on steam; you'll have fun playing through the story if youre a fan, but after you beat it, you might not touch it again, which is a shame because I'm a huge fan of both Berserk and Koei; such a shame :C

author: {'steamid': '76561198075260954', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1363, 'last_played': 1488658093}
review:
If you're a BERSERK fan you definitely need to give this a try. 
The story mode is quite well done for a musou with some pretty good cutscenes. 

They nailed Guts from a gameplay perspective.
It really feels like you're hitting enemies with something incredibly heavy and it's pretty satisfying.

There's a lack of playable characters unfortunately. The ones you can play however are all pretty unique.

Some of the boss fights are really annoying with them seemingly being immune to stuns and invincible during some moves.

Overall I had a lot of fun and feel that I got my moneys worth even though I still havent finished playing through Eclipse Mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054832330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1491072234}
review:
A game without a game mechanics.
Weird as it sounds I couldn't think of this when buying the game, but here we go: instead of a decent gameplay we have a visual nouvelle. At the start you are given two choices: either "easy - easy - easy" mashing enemies amidst their hordes or "holy s***" running around battlefield, delivering a few strikes at the edge of enemy masses, seeking medkits, waiting till the frenzy gauge fills up to deal some damage and then starting all over again.
Yes, that's how it is. Easy, normal, and hard are all variations of Easy without noticeable differences, while on Berserk it's jsut chaos: you can't see who hits you, you can't see where damage comes from, and you have no means to counter it.
The only reason to buy this game is that it's a substitute for the crappy anime we got in 2016, but other than that there is nothing to it. Or you can just watch the playthrough on YouTube: you won't lose much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992949874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1490753988}
review:
Just finished the game.  It was a pretty amazing ride, to be honest.

However, if there is two things to complain about, it would be the following.

1. Lots of load times. Load times everywhere. Even for small stuff. And that can be annoying if you don't know how to occupy your time.

2. Depsite there being 40+ some odd story misions, there are TONS of repeat missions. Which, if you ever played a Warriors game, you should be very familiar with. So, just giving that a warning. It makes the story last slightly longer than I would want it.*

*Griffith is my Husbando and anything without that sweet, beautiful boy is garbage.

I would give it like a 4/5 with anticipation of a warriors game. Probably 3.5 if I didn't know anything about it.
If you are a beserk fan, you will love it. Warriors, fan, you will like the little tweaks they did to improve the game play here.

Neither? Maybe wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997046452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1452, 'last_played': 1490580740}
review:
I LIKE this game, but it's about twenty dollars more expensive than what I'd say it's worth.

Pretty fun early on, but the apostles are incredibly poorly realised.  Dynasy Warriors mechanics are not conducive to pitched boss fights with giant monsters.  They don't fit on the screen, they're so big they trap you in corners and screw up the camera, and their difficulty is purely a function of hitstun and knockback cheese.  Once you're past the golden age arc, a lot of the other Dynasty Warriors mechanics fall apart too; things like base captains and morale and Koei's literally patented unit-density-affects-attack-strength mechanic are all pointless in missions where you're just one guy against an endless horde.

I'm not giving it any points for the cutscenes because they're just lifted directly from the anime.  The in-game cutscenes are... absolute garbage.  Problems from two console generations ago, like expressionless faces, and character models just rotating in place when characters turn.  Also frequent crashes and a lot of framerate issues.

Here's the thing: It's pretty fun, but like other DW-extant games, the things you like about DW aren't represented nearly as well here as they are in DW.  THAT SAID, in a lot of ways, it does really feel like Berserk, and I had quite a bit of fun playing it.  It's just not worth the price tag.

review:
Hey, if you like musous and Berserk, this game is up your alley.
Game runs fine, nothing crazy though. Just 60 fps and a few graphical options.
Pretty lengthy.
Story goes past the golden age arc.
Controls are great. 

The game can get a little repetitive at times if you're not into musou-style games.
I'd give it a 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198240927128', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1489982452}
review:
I had no expectations from this game. As soon as I knew that it was also released for PSP2 and PS3 it become clear that it was not a great game. This is what happens when you try to make a game for too many platforms. Graphics are good, for PSP. But now let's talk about the game itself.

Berserk and the band of the hawk is based on the amazing Berserk manga. You will play almost only with Guts from golden age Arc to the begin of Fantasia Arc. The story mode is weak in so many levels that I don't know even where to start. Don't get me wrong: I'm a huge fan of berserk and it hurts me to make this analisis. Scenarios are repetitive and small. The level up mechanics are useless for others character in story mode. There an item and money function that is pratically uselss, since you don't have many choices. Gameplay is repetitive and OH MY GOD these talking events are so bad directed that you wish they were replaced by manga pages.

And as a fan here's what really makes me do this analisis. The story. The game has some scenes from Berserk previosly movies, which is great! But for some reason they use only a few scenes. Most part of the plot is revelead by these akwards "talks events". But even so, they just don't deliver enough information for the gamer. So if you buy this game because you like Berserk, it doesn't accomplish to deliver a good story telling. And if you buy for gamplay, it's just better to get another musou like Dynasty Warriors. The CGI scenes on the end of the game try to solve this problem, but, as I said, they're few.

2016 was not a good year for berserk adaptations. I do expect this year to be different.

As a non native english speaker, please forgive me for bad english :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198124142583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 6163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2134, 'last_played': 1542330976}
review:
Berserk is one of my favourite anime/manga series of all time so I probably am a little biased towards this game.
I had a lot of fun with this game; yes it is repetitive but this can easily be resolved by changing to play as a different character. There are 8 characters in total to play as which is a small but good selection. My only gripe is why is Wyald a playable character? When they were making this game did they think; "Hmmm; who will Berserk fans really want to play as? How about that giant r@pist dog guy Wyald?" I would have rather played as Isidro or Pippin. 
Another great thing about this game is that it goes past the Golden Age Arc. The Golden Age Arc is fantastic but there is a lot more to Berserk than just that arc. 
Overall I would give this game a 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054458914', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2554, 'last_played': 1566890730}
review:
Me tomo 20 horas terminar el juego y tengo bastante que decir:

[b]Pero antes que nada dejar claro una cosa, si no leÃ­ste el manga FUERA DE AQUÃ
esta no es una buena entrada al mundo de Berserk y posiblemente no entiendas un carajo...
ESTE JUEGO ES FANSERVICE, si no entiendes lo que ocurre de trasfondo te va a parecer lo mas aburrido del mundo, ademas Berserk es un gran manga podrÃ­as estarlo leyendo ahora mismo c: [/b]

TambiÃ©n aclarar un punto, gran parte de las criticas que vi al juego se resumen en [i]"Me esperaba un Dark Souls y esto no lo es"[/i] y si bien creo que es una critica valida, me hace pensar que hay un montÃ³n de gente que sigue viendo Berserk como [i]"la obra que inspiro a Dark Souls"[/i], cuando personalmente creo que Miura escribe cosas que Miyasaki sueÃ±a intentar.[b]Para dejarlo claro tambiÃ©n, este juego es un MUSOU, genero que comparte junto a Dynasty Warriors, Sengoku Basara y otros[/b], si no te gustan este genero no esperes que el juego te cambie, personalmente me puedo considerar un fan asÃ­ que tambiÃ©n voy a hablar de este juego respecto a otros del genero.

una vez nos quitamos a todas las aclaraciones empecemos:
[list]
    [*]Esta es posiblemente la mejor adaptaciÃ³n del manga hasta ahora, solamente se salta 2 arcos bastante pequeÃ±os, es visualmente satisfactorio y si bien niega la parte reflexiva del manga, si que le da un espacio a las conversaciones y funciona como un buen fanservice.
    [*]Durante todo el arco de la [i]Golden Age[/i] usa las escenas de las pelÃ­culas en CGI, si bien elige las mejores escenas posibles, eso es un punto bajo para el buen motor del juego.
    [*]El modelado y los sonidos estÃ¡n muy bien elegidos y cuidados, da mucho gusto manejar a Guts y su pandilla.
    [*]Es uno de los Mosou mas variados que he jugado, a pesar de ser un genero bastante repetitivo este logra darle mucha variedad a su gameplay para mantenerte entretenido.
    [*]El sistema de items y mejoras, si bien no es muy original, es lo suficientemente simple como para no ser muy importante, pero tiene la buena profundidad como para ser satisfactorio y enviciante.
    [*]Se echan de menos mas modos de juego, pero de los 2 que tiene te pueden tener enganchado un buen rato.
    [*]El gamplay es muy representativo, bÃ¡sicamente se trata de ir llegando a un Trigger tras otro y subiendo el nivel del mismo, cosa que va muy de la mano con la forma de pelear de Guts.
    [*]QuizÃ¡s hay demasiadas misiones en la que obligatoriamente tenes que jugar con Guts.
    [*]Pese a que muchos les duela, esta obra tenia que ser un Musou, y cuanto mas lo jugas mas te das cuenta del porque, a lo que voy es que el genero cuadra muy bien con las misiones que juegas.
    [*]El rendimiento es muy bueno, se que mi maquina no es precisamente HighLow pero para ser un port de PS4, solo tube 1 crash y 1 bajon de FPS... cosa con la que estoy bastante contento.
    [*]Hay 4 niveles de dificultad, algunos coleccionables difÃ­ciles y es bastante interesante probar combinaciones de items diferentes, asÃ­ que tiene cierta rejugabilidad.
    [*]Lo que sentÃ­ malo es una parte del juego[Spoiler](Hablo puntualmente de eclipse)[/Spoiler] que abandona bastante al manga por una cuestiÃ³n de limites. Y creo que lo pudieron hacer mas similar.
    [*]El sistema de combos es demasiado sencillo y la cÃ¡mara deja un poco que desear, vamos lo tÃ­pico que no saben hacer los japos, aparentemente.
[/list]

A este punto poco mas puedo decir, en parte es cierto que es triste que esta sea la mejor adaptaciÃ³n de la franquicia, dado que ese titulo se lo gana por lo malas que fueron las otras, pero igualmente lo recibo como un grato regalo para los fans y tambiÃ©n para los amantes del genero, creo que no se van a sentir defraudados.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197983568101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2102, 'last_played': 1490750401}
review:
***Update as of 28 March 2017***

I've since completed the game. My opinion has changed somewhat. I will add that I was pleasantly surprised by how much else there was that kept to the spirit of the manga. Including the fight before the infamous boat.

That being said, being honest I enjoyed the game. They've achieved the task of making this a hack and slash with a story.  However, I implore those who do get into this, to absolutely read the manga and/or watch the OVAs. They are the only mediums that are as close to the original work (or are the original work) as possible.  Learning Japanese is probably the only way to avoid situations like this and many others. 


**Original Review**
It's unfortunate that this game, besides it's efforts to avoid getting an AO rating, still managed to censor out some the more critical parts of the story.  For those that haven't played the game, this will have spoilers so 

**SPOILER ALERT**

While an argument can be made that the story is still told in a way that moves it forward, there are memorable scenes among Berserk fans that give the story the impact. It's lke if your house is destroyed. You know the damage - it's destroyed, but you don't know exactly what hit it or the size. That's what it feels like. I'll touch up on the already spoken about examples. 

-Sexual censorship

Among noticible examples such as the Eclipse scene and Casca's 'assult' as they put it. If you're not a Berserk fan, it's implied that he maybe touched her or had sex with her. He could have been like the facehugger in aliens and impregnated her that way. You still don't know. All you know is that she's now in shock. For Berserk fans, you absolutely know what happened there. It was rape, and for Guts there was no looking away. For Griffith, it was a show of dominance and a testament to Guts, his 'friend'. It was like he said 'You took everything from me when you left that day. You made me lose focus on my dream. Now I'll take away everything from you'. The look in his eyes through it all, Griffith knew. So now you're leading around a Casca that was mentally and physically damaged. Guts has also suffered shock through it all from this incident. His friends killed. Someone he grew very close to, taken advantage of in the worse way, and someone he thought was his best friend at the core of it all. Not to mention he loses an arm. You have to ask yourself, if you saw this, how would you feel? How would you have reacted? Well, go watch the blu-ray of the anime because that's the only way you'll see that. They basically took scenes from the anime and inserted them into this anyway.

-Gore Censorship

Another scene that loses it's impact is the fight between Guts as 'The Black Swordsman' and the 'snake' apostle. It's a memorable scene to Berserk fans because shows Guts absolute ruthlessness. He shows no humility in this fight and how far he's willing to go. In the original animation he gets overwhelmed by the apostle while fighting him, in what looks like genuine fear. Only to surprise the apostle with a literal hand cannon, damaging a good portion of his face. He then brings his sword across the snakes body, chopping him in half.  After this, he has his brief conversation with the apostle, then begins firing arrows into his face. Slowly. As it screams to it's death. Guts is a dark hero and he will do whatever is required to be strong. Even if it means sacrificing his humanity, in order to defeat Griffith. 

I hope to add more to this but many have already spoken about it, including those on Sankaku who will continue to say fans bitch and moan about why the game was censored. It's not just about seeing tits and ass. There's purpose to each of these scenes and they give impact to the delivery of the story. Without those, it loses it's edge and what made it such a mature dark fantasy comic to begin with. 

It's also not without it's other mechanic issues such as unknown timeframes for missions. There are multiple stages where in order to obtain a behelit, you're required to complete a task within a certain time frame. Well, you're never given the specific timeframe. I'm not sure if I'm just new to the Dynasty Warrior type series, but it's hard to meet a deadline if you don't know what the deadline is. You just end up doing the stage multiple times, faster and faster until you get it - which can add increased difficulty if you have to deal with bosses on that stage. It's not like you can get the behilit and quit - you have to complete the stage to ensure completion.   I've run into this issue on the following stages so far:

 - The Golden Age
 - The Battle for Doldrey
 - Infiltrating Windham
 - The Eclipse
 - Vow of Retaliation
 - The Brand's Guidance

I'm sure there will be more before I finish the game.

It's unfortunate that I wanted to support this game. I got this game very close to release in an effort to support the company and it's effort to get it over here in the west. However they single-handedly managed to upset both sides of the world, which in unfortunate because besides it's issues with missing information, it's a decent game overall. This isn't a complete critique of the game. It's a gripe. I'm a big fan of Miura's work in the original movie animations, the new animation (despite criticism of the CG), and the comics. It's a hard sell if left untouched to those that aren't fans of the work and they're trying to reach out to those who haven't watched the series. In turn, they alientate their current fans a bit to widen their audience to gain money. This will allow them to increase their efforts to churn more works out from their company. 

Well, to those who purchased the game and enjoyed it, good for you and I hope you continue to support the company and their cause. 

For those, like myself, who feel slighted that Miura's work was displayed in this manner and unable to experience the work in this medium the way you might have imagined, I'd suggest no longer showing your support. Write your letters to the company and coordinate with parent companies in Japan to express your disappointment.  Of course, they (among others) may feel that nothing of importance was lost because you're just a disappointed customer. Their goal was not you, it was your dollar and regardless of how you feel, they were paid.  There are those that are happy with the way the game came out and that shows in it's "Very Positive" rating on Steam as of 03/19/2017. So what's your point?

I think it would have just been better to release an uncut and general audience version of the game. Pay a little more and experience the work the way it was meant - gore, sex and all. Enough of whatever this is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004852106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1242, 'last_played': 1490225629}
review:
EDIT: I just realized FORCES isn't in the OST! NOOOOOOOOO!
 
I've been enjoying this game tremendously, to my surprise.

As others have mentioned, it's a Dynasty Warriors-type game. But if you consider how Guts fights, it's not a bad choice. In all seriousness, I'm not sure how well another title would capture the essense of combat in Berserk.

Food for thought: I never realized that Bazuzo was a Midland knight and Guts was fighting for Chuder in that first Golden Age battle, but it does make sense.

Upsides:

Guts fights exactly the way you'd want him to.

All the characters are here, and the story is right. Except for the sub-arc with the heretics and the ... erm, "flower girls" from the manga - they cut that.

The dialogue is spot-on - some is from the anime, but the rest is from the manga.

The Berserker Armor IS AMAZING!

Extended Golden Age content in story mode. If you thought the only thing wrong with Berserk was that that the Golden Age wasn't long enough, this is the game for you.

The voice acting and sound is good, and the animation is good.


Downsides:

Most of the blood and gore is censored. It's not *all* gone, but it's a PG-13 version of Berserk.

The enemy AI needs work. On Hard Mode I got through the first battle with the trolls without taking a hit. That's not entirely non-canonical - I'm not sure any of the trolls ever hit Guts - but I rarely have to use healing items anymore.

The nudity and sex is censored. Segments from the anime with it are cut or edited to cover it up, and where they absolutely can't skip it (Slan, the posessed horse, etc) they make it clear what's going on but avoid any visuals.

Like any DW game, it's a bit repetitive.

Grinding. Guts absolutely does become stronger as the series progresses, and I suppose this is the only meaningful way to handle it. But "grinding" is misleading - play through the story mode normally and you'll be strong enough to fight everything when you get to it. If you really need better stats, play through the Endless Eclipse a bit and you'll get it.

The sub-weapons aren't so good. The cannon especially isn't very good compared to the anime - where it all-but oneshots some of the weaker apostles.

FINAL UPDATE: Finished the game - it ends with the fight with Emperor Ganishka, at the docks. This is probably the single weakest moment in the game, because they tried to actually have a stormcloud for Guts to fight, and it looks ridiculous.

We don't get to see the fight with that water god/spirit/thing the Kushan sorceror summons, but if Ganishka's stormcloud looked that bad I can't imagine it would have looked any better.

*Every other enemy in the game looked right.* Ganishka is the only bad one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298501291', 'num_games_owned': 2006, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 35858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35858, 'last_played': 1567681506}
review:
[i]Berserk[/i] is about a myostatin-deficient demon slayer with chronic rage issues and a girlfriend who was harassed by her former employer. In the wake of perhaps the worst work-outing ever our protagonists fall into a lifestyle of countryside camping, walks on the beach and more brutal brawls than a Glaswegian pub car park in a year's worth of Saturday nights, all punctuated by the odd interaction with a calcium-rich knight and, at one point, a very overly-tactile horse.

Silliness aside, [i]Berserk[/i] is the greatest seinen manga ever committed to paper. It has a dark tone running through it, but masterfully wanders through medieval, dark and high fantasy stylings whilst telling the, at times, uncompromisingly heavy story of a compelling protagonist. The game doesn't really capture all that, as it's a hack-and-slash in the style of Omega Force's [i]Musou[/i] games, but it does convey the physicality of each character very well through very satisfying and fun gameplay that's easy to get to grips with.

It has all of the major characters and locations for the story it covers, which is stripped down to the broad strokes from the Golden Age arc to quite a way through the Millennium Falcon arc, up to about episode 278 (which is in Volume 32, or Deluxe Volume 11). It's a decent place to bring the game to a close considering how much of the manga was released when the game was in development.

The audio is great, though it's limited to just Japanese voice acting with English subtitles. While the character models and animations are good the locations are a little lacking and as repetitive as one would expect from a [i]Musou[/i] game.

While it's not the masterpiece adaptation of the manga that fans of the series would like it's still an easy recommendation for any fan of [i]Berserk[/i] and fans of anything in the vein of [i]Dynasty Warriors.[/i]

review: BERSERK and the Band of the Hawk Ã¨ un ottimo titolo del genere Musou. La trama del titolo ricalca alla perfezione tutti gli avvenimenti importanti e non della serie originale, inoltre, il gameplay frenetico e rapido rendono il gioco molto divertente anche dopo svariate ore di gioco. review:
great fun game, but the final(?) story arc is not finished so the game story ends on a whimper.

edit- So i just caught up in the manga (chapter 359) and this game is missing a few good stories from the manga. The game does do a better job than the netflix movies or the 2016 anime at telling the stories. If you actually want to get into Berserk than you need to read the manga.

Rest in peace Kentaro Miura

author: {'steamid': '76561198008411723', 'num_games_owned': 1759, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 4437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4373, 'last_played': 1514681665}
review:
Before starting this review I want to say that I'm a huge fan of Berserk. I've watched every single anime adaptation and read the manga twice. Hell, I even bought the entire manga. In short, my love for Berserk is like a truck. So naturally I was very excited about this game. I thought Berserk and Warriors would be an excellent combination and I'm happy to say that I was right.

For those of you who are not familiar with Warriors games, they are basically hack'n slash games with very simplistic gameplay. You kill hundreds of enemies in each mission. They're not so much about challenge, instead they're about making the player feel like a god. Now, be warned. These games are very divisive and some people find them very boring and repetitive. If you're the kind of person who gets bored quickly, this game may not be for you.

So let's talk about this game. It's basically a Warriors clone with a Berserk skin. The story covers 32 volumes of the manga and it took me 20 hours to beat. So the length is very good. Even though the second half of the game feels a little rushed compared to the first half, it was still a lot of fun for me. Visually, game looks pretty good. I really like the cel-shaded graphics, and there are some very nice cgi cutscenes as well. It's a joy to finally see some post-golden age stuff animated (or at least animated well, cough 2016 anime cough). The game has a pretty enjoyable soundtrack as well. I mean it's no Susumu Hirasawa, but I found it enjoyable. Voice acting is good too. They use the same voice actors from the 2016 anime, so that's nice. Also, I must mention that the game has no English voice over, instead it's Japanese audio with English subtitles.

There are a total of 8 playable characters in the game. Character selection is a little disappointing because of the number of playable characters and lack of some characters (Skull Knight anyone?). But at least all characters feel different enough, so you don't feel like they are the same characters with different looks. You can use these characters during Free Play mode or the Endless Eclipse mode. Endless Eclipse is kind of like a survival/horde mode, but it also has some roguelite elements in it. Basically you go through layers of Eclipse and try to complete series of missions. You get a checkpoint every 20 layers and if you die, you go back to the previous checkpoint. You unlock new equipment and costumes by beating this mode and It's fun enough to keep you playing for a few extra hours.

Now let's talk about some negatives. First and the biggest one is the boss fights. I've been playing games for as long as I can remember but I've never seen more terrible boss fights. They are so bad, they made me question the logic of their inclusion. The game would've been infinitely better without them. Specially that Femto fight. I can write an essay on how broken and annoying that fight is but never mind (I had to beat him 8 fucking times!!). Awful hit boxes, bad camera, never ending stun locks, invinsibility frames on bosses (dafuq?) and so on. Apart from that, the game is not a very good port too. A controller is almost mandatory, and the performance is not stable (be sure to set environment quality to low for better performance).

So overall, I think Berserk and the Band of the Hawk is a very enjoyable game. If you are a Berserk or Warriors fan, you'll definitely like this game. If you've never played a Warriors game but considering buying this game, check out some gameplay videos and keep in mind that the game tends to get a little repetitive at times. Be sure to check out the manga and thanks for reading my review :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197974231725', 'num_games_owned': 1352, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 2677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2647, 'last_played': 1489017752}
review: Anime fans must get this game. Also there are the anime cut scenes from Berserk: The Golden Age Arc I,II,III which makes this game even better, for those who didi'nt watch the TV series or Ova. Anyway as a anime/manga fan i recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001090452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1493176636}
review: A really amazing game. It takes you through so much of the Berserk story that hasn't been seen in the anime yet. The game plays very well and is everything you would expect from a Dynsasty Warriors style game with a Berserk skin. The story mode is really long. I'm about nine hours in and still haven't finished. There's also Endless Eclipse mode which is a pretty sweet gaunlet mode with some nice rewards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102996825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1515, 'last_played': 1683761125}
review: It's a great game for fans but its functionality seems to be dependant on your setup. If you have windows 10 it'll crash a lot infact the game will ask if you would like to switch to windows 7 or 8.1 just to avoid complications. It's nice to see that someone finally made another iteration of a really dark and gritty manga series as a video game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998387928', 'num_games_owned': 1116, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 2103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2103, 'last_played': 1488948696}
review:
Berserk and the Band of the Hawk is a strange case of having enough moving parts to be a good game, but fail in being great at the exact genre its implementing, which is being a Musou. The simplest way I can explain how Berserk Warriors flows between passing and failing this bar to people who neither know Berserk nor those that enjoy Dynasty Warriors and its various incarnations is that there are three fundamental aspects of this game genre; good variety of enemy types which you will potentially butcher in the millions, good variety of locations and/or mission to kill them in and a lot of characters to play as. Well, as much as you can argue about whether this game succeeds in the first two, the third is one of this game's great failures with a paltry pick of just 8 characters -- even with the caveat that some of those characters have several costumes that can offer more powerful variations and transformations of said character. And this is all the more strange when many characters are not only in this game, but given their own specific move sets and specials!

Pieces that, if you look in a certain way, could be laying foundation for a sequel musou that would improve vastly on the groundwork Band of the Hawk laid, which from what they released, may not be a gamble that pays off.

However; even with this fatal crack in the blade, somehow, Berserk and the Awkward Name struggles on to somehow be entertaining and it is still puzzling trying to figure out objectively why this is for me personally. The attention to detail from both the perspective of the Golden Age Films and the actual original story of Berserk is all over the place. While the first part of the game tries its hardest to hit the same highlights that the trilogy went through, specifically because it uses footage directly from it; at the same time it gets a wild hair up its butt to introduce Wyald, the 8th and unexpected character within the roster that so far has not been used in any major Berserk media except this game to date. His inclusion is a no brainer because, itâ€™s another Apostle and army to fight; however, for a fan of the franchise itâ€™s a little weird to get most of the reason why he's in the story almost there, then drop the most important cause that his fight with the Band of the Hawk brings into effect (he knocks over Griffith, showing the state he's in to the rest of the mercs and that's why the Band of the Hawk is thinking about going their separate ways right before the Eclipse). This doesn't hinder the game for a player with no obsessive foreknowledge about minute details such as this, yet what is this game if not something for fans of Berserk? 

Outside of this, the story for the most parts follows the Golden Age, a condensed Black Swordsman with both Snake Baron and The Count, Conviction completely missing The Lost Children beginning, ending around the Falcon of the Millennium Empire right before that damned boat. Including a lot of content I honestly didnâ€™t think theyâ€™d cover as succinctly as they did. And their overall attention to details, such as having different menus depending on where you were in the story progression, was genuinely impressive. What information they may not be able to convey in in-game blather, scenes or movie clips was for the most part allowed to be viewed in optional events. And even outside of Story Mode, in battles in Free or Endless Eclipse, there was genuine heart put into characters talking like they would talk even if they had been long since killed or going up against something they had no real chance to fight. 

But that in particular aspect of the game, seeing The Great Bazuso, thirty man slayer, mocking himself at every time I slaughtered a regular 1000 underlings, is where the short character selection comes back to bite the game in the ass, time and time again.  Because they have almost all the pieces that other Musos use, the reactions and interactions between every character in the game, the different types of fighting and strategies that each character brings with them. They are in the game. You can play against them in specific story parts. Yet, the player canâ€™t play with all of the fully developed pieces in the game. It would be one thing if they just didnâ€™t show up at all, like the mysterious disappearance of Azan. No, seriously KT, where is Azan? Get back to me on that, will ya? 

Where was I? Oh yeah, the pieces that are in the toy box, on full display, and arguably should be playable, LIKE FOR INSTANCE SAY A VERY PROMINENT AND AWSOME SKELETON KNIGHT, FOR EXAMPLE. Them being there, in game, taunting us with how close, yet so far we are from playing them, makes the short roster all the more painful. Especially if maybe they only come in the form of outrageously priced DLC or playable characters in an aforementioned potentially unlikely sequel. 

This is a niche within niche game. You donâ€™t want to gimp any potential strength this game needs in order to build a fan base to generate further products! And Iâ€™m not even talking about the bullshit that is later game Behelit goals, Iâ€™m talking basic things like music selection and increasing the odds of replayablity here! On that note, the soundtrack isnâ€™t that bad, but with how much money this game costs as is, itâ€™s very strange that there isnâ€™t any movie, or more importantly, Susumu Hirasawa music. Iâ€™d even pay DLC money for it, but itâ€™s all the stranger with its absolute absence in a Berserk game. The Dreamcast Sword of the Berserk: Gutâ€™s Rage got Forces 2, Indra and an entire soundtrack. The unreleased outside of Japan PS2 game got Sign. Even the horrible 2016 anime got Oh Ashes. Yet this game gets no Hirasawa whatsoever? Are you even trying to get fans into this game or not?

And then thereâ€™s the wonkiness of the PC port itself. Iâ€™m currently playing on a custom Intel i7 -6700K CPU with 4.00 Ghz with 32 GBs of RAM and Iâ€™ve crashed. Oh boy, have I crashed to desktop with this game so much. Itâ€™s controller only, to the point where itâ€™s the only way to comfortably play the game at all. It canâ€™t really run on Windows 10. Itâ€™s got problems. Hell, it might even be better to stay on a console, Iâ€™m not sure anyone has seriously done performance tests between both to really prove this one way or another, but Iâ€™m telling you, from my perspective, that this isnâ€™t as good as it should be.

But then we get to the real Blood and Guts -- and Guts and Blood, of this game: how it plays. And from every iteration of Guts to the self-aware every hungry brutality of Zodd, every character that you can access plays like you'd want them to. Every swing of Guts' giant slab of iron is heavy attacks, followed by even heavier attacks. With some rechargeable side actions like blowing a noticeably unimpressive cannon arm blast, to very useful concussive and damaging blasts from Miniature Bombs that prime enemies for some daze juggling, and completely useless arrows. Not every existing trick is worth it, but the real power comes from this gameâ€™s Frenzy Mode. With Frenzy comes Death Blows and Transformations, allowing you greater ways to decimate anything stupid enough to get into view.

And yet, when itâ€™s all said in done, I donâ€™t hate this game. Hell, I wouldnâ€™t be so negative about it if there wasnâ€™t something I still like about the sum total of its parts! But because I actually care about it, I also know and will fully admit it can and should strive to do better than this!

As it stands, I donâ€™t really know if I could recommend its purchase to anyone. Itâ€™s not a bad game to try or play, however, Iâ€™m not sure it deserves a full $59.99. And knowing who owns this game, it will likely never will go lower than $29.99 in a sale, but even at that point, Iâ€™m not sure if Iâ€™d recommend a purchase of this version. But if you are still curious, and like me, are dumb enough to be a diehard in either Musou and Berserk, well, itâ€™s your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053218211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1240, 'last_played': 1496806096}
review: Relive the best anime of all time. As a fan of the berserk anime, this was an essential purchase. The game suffers from a very simplistic combat system and a Japanese only audio track. Considering that Berserk was one of the few animes that actually had a decent English voice cast, I was disapointed to find out they didn't use the voice actors from that series. Aside from that the game offers deaper insights into the Golden Age Arc and Guts is even more badass to play as than you'd have imagined back in 1997!

review: Berserk fan? Love Musou games? Looking for some decent challenge? This is the game for you, if you're not familiar with the anime Berserk itself and are looking to get into it via the video game, you will get minor information and detail on the story, but you'll get the ghist of it, if anything check out the Anime or Manga if you enjoyed the game. (I recommend changing the keyboard settings before playing, don't want you to lose hope in the game the moment you start it. Find something that will work with your liking. I use the WASD area for moving and nearby keys for attacking, and use my IJKL to move my camera, keeps the game steady and know whats going on.)

review: I'd recommend it if you're a huge Berserk fan. Combat is nothing amazing, but there's a LOT of game here. It follows the story all the way to just before the leviathan events take place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013739926', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2276, 'last_played': 1540776176}
review:
Recommended only for Hardcore Fans of both Berserk and Koei's "Warriors"-Franchise.

Anyone else should wait for a massive price drop. 

If you've seen the recent movies, the footage they inserted into the game is already known to you, so much of what the game is marketing itelf by is gonna be pointless.

And - as always when talking about Berserk  - remember:

[b]READ THE MANGA FIRST[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197983310330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1627171304}
review:
Un jeu qui respecte bien la franchise du manga Berserk.

On dÃ©fouraille dans un torrent de sang des unitÃ©s de la mÃªme maniÃ¨re qu'un Dynasty/SamuraÃ¯ Warriors et le fait de diriger son personnage dans un gameplay plus "rigide" (la sensation de lourdeur de ces derniers au vu du poids de leur Ã©quipement) nous plonge un peu plus dans la nervositÃ©/tension du jeu.

Les modes restent classiques : 

- Un mode Histoire (pour connaitre totalement l'aventure Golden Age)
- Un mode Libre (afin de pouvoir se retaper certaines scÃ¨nes en jouant le personnage de son choix)
- Un mode "Endless Eclipse" (oÃ¹ vous allez devoir survivre le plus longtemps possible Ã  travers l'Ã©clipse) - Grosse pouce vert sur ce mode excellent :P -

On a droit Ã  une bonne petite palette de personnages, qu'on ne manquera pas de tester les uns aprÃ¨s les autres, et un systÃ¨me d'expÃ©rience comme tout Beat'em all du milieu KOEI.

Bref ! Bien que le prix paraisse un peu trop excessif pour un jeu Ã  la fois anglais et trÃ¨s rÃ©pÃ©tif en soi, "Berserk and the Band of the  Hawk" reste rÃ©servÃ© pour les fans de la franchise et les fÃ©rus de mangas Dark Fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080282999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10170, 'last_played': 1568113907}
review:
Not the most premium game ever, but if you like Berserk, you will like this game. You get to see some new deeper content from the manga animated, however the story mode uses mostly scenes from the movies for cinimatics until you get past the eclipse. Lots of things to achieve on the game for new unlocks, so you can get some decent time out of it. 

P.S use berserker armor outfit guts in endless eclipse mode if you want to be able to go infinite.
